loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en:
Rodelia L. is 37 years old and married to Amador L. Jr.  They live in Morong, a fine-looking place in the province of Rizal. She runs a sari-sari store (sells different goods) with the support of her loving husband. 

They have two children, the eldest is seven, a grade one student and a five year old in nursery school. 

Rodelia plans to use the loan to buy and resell different kinds of goods to support her family.  Her husband does not earn enough to cover their family expense.  She hopes to see herself enjoying the profits of her business and to have a good life.  Now, she is proposing a loan of Php 25,000.  Her previous loan was Php 20,000.  She has maintained a 100% credit rating with ASHI.  She has payed loans in full and on time.

She enjoys the benefits of having loans from ASHI because she progressively achieves her goals in life.  For almost five years Rodelia has shown industrious, discipline and given full time to her family and business to fulfillment her dreams.  She wants to build a strong concrete house and provide the best education for their children.

loans.use: Purchase food and merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Make The Difference Group

texts.en:
Korto G. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Make the Difference'. She is single with 4 children aged 1-20 years old, and their educational levels are kindergarten to 8th grade.

Lorpu is an 1st grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga.

Korto has been running this business for 4 years, and is hoping to improve her business to a real shop. She faces problems with the bad road conditions from where she buys goods to her business site.

Korto needs this loan to purchase new goods to serve her customers. She dreams of giving her family a better education.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to serve customers

loans.name: Gladis Del Rosario

texts.es: Gladis del Rosario C. D. A. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en Colón en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 17 y 14 años D. edad. Ella posee una venta D. comida típica, tiene una tienda D. productos perecederos y también cría y venD. pollos. Gladis es una persona muy admirada y querida en su colonia ya que es alguien que trabaja mucho por sacar adelante a su familia, y para poder brindarle la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los del hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más productos perecederos, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. comida para aves.
texts.en:
Gladis del Rosario C. D. A. is 41 years old. She lives in Colón in the region of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and her two children, 17 and 14 years old. She has a stall where she sells typical local foods, a shop of perishable goods, and she also raises and sells chickens. Gladis is a person who is much admired and loved by her neighbours, as she is someone who works hard to raise her family and to be able to offer her husband the help he needs with the household. She is requesting a loan with which she would be able to purchase more perishable goods; she would also like to be able to purchase a larger quantity of bird food.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bird food and perishable goods.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad K. is 54 years old and the father of three daughters and four sons. He owns and runs a supermarket in Ramallah as a source of living. Two of his sons who work with him at the supermarket are married and responsible for their own families.

Mohammad's wife and sons work with him to help and support the three families. Therefore, he applied for his first loan from FATEN to expand the business and buy more goods which will, he hopes, increase the families' income and improve their situation.

Mohammad and his son Tamer appear in the photo.

loans.use: To make store improvements and to buy more goods

loans.name: Jaritza Group

texts.es:
Rosa Merchán de 42 años. Su esposo vende legumbres en el mercado de mayoristas con el tiene 6 hijos de 18, 13, 12, 10, 9, 8 años.

Rosa es dueña de una tienda, en la que vende huevos, bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. Ella se levanta en la madrugada para comprar en el mercado de mayoristas la mercadería para la tienda.

Con el préstamo espera surtir mas su negocio con aceite, arroz, verde y otros víveres, y así mejorar su tienda.

Rosa es coordinadora del grupo ella esta vestida con una blusa de rallas rojas y una falda jeans, el grupo Jaritza  es integrado por 4 personas en total. Ellos viven en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Rosa compartirá este préstamo con el grupo. Ellos trabajan en la venta de verdes y naranjas, decoraciones de autos, venta de carnes. Los miembros del grupo mutuamente se comprometen a ser responsables en pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 42 years old. Her husband sells vegetables in the wholesale market and has 6 children with Rosa: they are 18, 13, 12, 10, 9 and 8 years old. Rosa is the owner of a small store where she sells eggs, drinks, rice, sugar, etc. She wakes up at dawn to buy her store's inventory in the wholesale market. With the loan, she will better supply her store with oil, rice, and other goods, and thus improve her business. Rosa is the group coordinator; in the picture, she is in the blouse with red stripes and the jean skirt. The Jaritza group consists of 4 people who live in the semi-urban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. Rosa will share the loan with the group. They sell bananas and oranges, car decorations, and meats. The group members commit to each other to jointly be responsible for repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of oil, rice, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Tiang

texts.en:
In order to earn a daily revenue, Mrs. Tiang C., age 60, sells both used and new cloth at the local busy market. With this business, she is able to feed her family. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a local rice farmer. This couple has been married for several years and has been blessed with  eleven children. Three of them are married and the remaining eight are single. Two of her daughters are employed at the garment factory. 

Tiang C. has a single daughter who is jobless and she wants to have a suitable occupation but doesn’t have capital to start a business. Because of this, Tiang C. is requesting a loan in order to buy a variety of groceries as inventory so that her daughter can begin selling in the village. (Tiang C. was not available at that time so her daughter is pictured in her place.)

loans.use: To buy a variety of groceries for inventory.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Тошбоев Равшан проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно- рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мяса. В этой области более 5 лет. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Ravshan T. lives in the Yavan district. He is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle to be resold for meat. Ravshan has been involved in this field for over 5 years. Besides, the development of this business sector allows to provide fresh meat to the markets. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen tiene 53 años de edad. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este es su mayor fuente de ingresos por lo que sale, todos los días para mostrar cada uno de sus productos. ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como es pinturas de labios, bases, cremas perfumes y colonias pues son muy importantes para aumentar su clientela. Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y mantenerlo activo.
texts.en:
Tomasa del Carmen is 53 years old and has been a client of the Foundation for a long time. She sells general merchandise and has been dedicated to this business for more than 17 years. With great effort she has managed to maintain her business. This is her only source of income, so she goes out every day to demonstrate each of her products. She is requesting this loan to purchase products like lipstick, foundation, perfume and other products that are important to growing her clientele. Her greatest dream is to move forward with her business and remain active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan N. S. is a farmer in Busia district, Nambale. He is 84 years old and married. He plants and harvests twice a year. He says he has been in farming for 30 years and that life is defined by food and the determination of the farmer.

He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to buy seeds, prepare land for farming, and buy fertilizer. His main plan is to keep increasing his farm's produce.

loans.use: Expand farming area

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fuerza inicia su segundo ciclo con 17 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de comidas, abarrotes en general, gelatinas, lácteos, artesanía, frutas y quesos.
Como es el caso de la Señora Alicia que es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, Alicia es soltera, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, anteriormente Alicia vendía artesanía y por problemas familiares dejo de realizar este negocio, hace 3 años implemento una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y poco a poco fue agregando mas productos en su negocio ahora vende verduras, frutas. Además los días domingos vende frutas y bebidas en la feria de animales de la ciudad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija mayor. Alicia invertirá su negocio en la compra de arroz, leche, azúcar. Los sueños de Alicia son tener una tienda grande y construir su casa de material noble. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 6,600 soles.
texts.en:
The Fuerza Community Bank is starting its second loan cycle with 17 members. The members have different businesses like selling food, groceries, jellies, milk products, crafts, fruit or cheeses. Alicia is the president of the community bank. She is a 29-year-old single mother of two children. Previously she sold craftwork but because of family problems she had to give up the business. Three years ago she set up a grocery stO. in her home and little by little she added mO. products to the business. Now she sells fruits and vegetables. FurthermO., on Sundays she sells fruits and beverages at the city's animal trade fair, which she does with the help of her eldest daughter. Alicia plans to invest in her business by purchasing rice, milk and sugar. Her dreams are to have a big stO. and to build a home out of quality material. The members require different loan amounts, such as 300, 500 and 600 soles, for a grand total of 6,600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar and milk along with other products

loans.name: Ermalie

texts.en:
Ermalie L. is from the village of Pinamulaan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $113 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Ermalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ermalie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Too Faitful Group

texts.en:
Felecia L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Too Faithful.  She is 29 years old, engaged and has three children who range from seven months to 8 years old. She was only able to attend school to 12th grade due to poverty. Two of her children are in school and she also cares for two siblings.

For 10 years she has been selling items such as rice, creme, pots and onions on the Roberts Field Highway on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy rice, creme, pots, onions and other goods that she sells.
 
Her hope is to make sufficient profit to take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy rice, creme, pots, onions and other goods that she sells.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Mabinuligon, Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and standing cane businesses.  Her husband Crispin, who is 74 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and he also helps his wife.  They have seven children who are 28 to 50 years old. 

Amparo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amparo has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000.  

This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to buy standing cane and stocks for her general store so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and to expand her standing cane business.  Amparo is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

---------------------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en: Ronie T. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Ronie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Ronie operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing pedicab services to local community members. Ronie has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ronie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Ronie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Ronie from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home enlargement.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La joven María Elena L. M., es casada tiene un hijos menor de edad vive junto a su familia en el municipio el viejo, iglesia esquípala 80vras abajo, es una joven profesional con deseos de superación y desarrollarse en el campo laboral, actualmente trabaja para la Alcaldía municipal de Chinandega laborando como asistente de finanza desde hace más de nueve años
 La joven María Elena L. M. ha obtenido cinco créditos de los cuales ha cancelado cuatro, dice sentirse agradecida por la confianza que le hemos brindado ya que con estos créditos a mejorado su vivienda y le han ayudado a resolver algunos problemas de índole familiares.
texts.en:
María Elena L. M. is married and has one young son. She and her family live in “Iglesia Esquípala” part of the town of El Viejo. She is a young professional with a desire to succeed in the workforce and has been working as a finance assistant for the Chinandega city hall for more than nine years. This young lady has had five previous loans and has repaid four of them. She tells us that she is grateful for the trust that we have placed in her, especially because these loans have helped to improve her home and have helped her to resolve some family insolvency issues.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phon H., who was B. 1951, was selected as the bank president of this village loan, located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Members of this village will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes.
                 
Mr. Phon H. and his wife, Mrs. Sim Loa, are farmers who own two hectares of land, which they use to cultivate rice, peanuts and corn for a living. In order to support this farm, Phon decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, peanut seed and fertilizer to grow crops. They are also farmers who work very hard to support a child who is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice and peanut seeds, and fertilizer to grow crops

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en: Patrocenia N. is from the village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Patrocenia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Patrocenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Patrocenia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 8th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lisungi Plus Group

texts.en:
Anne M. aged 58, is the manager of a Community Bank named “Lisungi Plus” which means “Assistance” in English. It is composed of 19 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Anne has been a part of the micro-enterprise world since 1991. She started selling shikwanges (Congolese food)beginning with a capital of $100. She has been with Hope since October 2008. Progressively, her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. 

The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy some sacks of manioc to produce shikwanges and sell them with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $50 per week. Anne’s ambition is to open a general store. She is a widow and a mother of nine children between the ages 18 and 34. One of them attends school.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of manioc to produce shikwanges (Congolese food) and sell them at profit.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita A. is from the village of Bungad. She is 35 years old. Teresita is married and has three young children. To make a living, Teresita makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling "dirty ice cream" or sorbetes for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly S. is a 47-year-old clothing seller in Phnom Penh City. She currently sells clothing for both men and women from her house and in the busy market. She is married with three children who are enrolled in school. The other one is married. Usually Ly S. generates around $2.50 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. Her life partner is her husband (pictured) who is a motor taxi driver around Phnom Penh city of Cambodia. She is concerned that her house is getting old, and some parts of it are cracked. Ly S. thinks that it is not comfortable for her family to live there. Therefore, she would like to request a loan from Kiva to mend her broken house.

loans.use: To mend her broken house.

loans.name: Bayarbold

texts.en:
Bayarbold Y. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Harhorin, the ancient Mongolian empire's capital.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stays at home taking care of their two daughters.  

Bayarbold owns and operates his own wood product business in his home.  He started his business in 2000 based on his childhood talents and interest in crafts.  All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture maker.  

Bayarbold is a modest and hardworking man and plans to have his own work place in the near future. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood materials for his furniture making business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wood materials.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 55 years old, is married and has with adult children. To make a living, Rogelio plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude N. lives in the Namungoona neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married, and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). Gertrude has a business selling milk. She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products door-to-door. Gertrude has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more jerry cans of milk. She also generates additional income through hiring of motorcycles. The main business challenges for Gertrude are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only. Gertrude lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses are rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of milk

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos, es empleado, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres y hermanos, está soltero, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, él trabaja en MOTO STORE desde hace cinco años, donde se encargan de todo lo relacionado a motocicletas.
El además tiene un pequeño taller es propio y quiere adquirir un compresor por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar este compresor que le será de mucha ayuda en el taller, esta inversión le servirá para impulsarse y mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
Su aspiración es lograr un taller amplio para dedicarse solo a él, sin tener que trabajar para otro taller y ayudar a sus padres y hermanos.
texts.en:
Carlos is employed, he is 22 years old, and he lives with his parents and siblings. He is single and he lives in Jiquilisco in the region of Usulutan. He has been employed with Moto Store for the past five years, where he is in charge of anything related to motorcycles.

In addition, he also has his own shop and he wants to purchase a compressor. He requests a loan in order to purchase a compressor which will be of great help in his shop. This investment will motivate him and it will improve the service he provides to his clients.

His goal is to have a large shop and to work there full time, without having to work elsewhere. He wants to support his parents and his siblings.

loans.use: To purchase a compressor.

loans.name: Nimpha

texts.en:
"Nimpha is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures - a pig fattening business and a fish vending business. Her husband Allan, who is 37 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 5 to 12 years old.

Nimpha joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nimpha has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to as additional working capital for her business ventures so that she could continue to save up for future education of her children and support the family's household expenses. Nimpha is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Dinorak Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Dinorak de 40 años de edad, trabaja como docente en la colonia los angeles desde hace 3 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria impartinado el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comarca , su mamà la apoya con el cuido de sus hijos,  su esposo se dedica  a comercializar ganado, ambos se ayudan con los gastos familiares,                                                                                                   Solicita su 3er credito para arreglar la cocina de su vivienda, asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones en el hogar. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida e ir mejorando poco a poco su condiciones de vida para su mayor comodidad en el Hogar.
texts.en:
Dinorak is 40 years old and works as a teacher in the los angeles neighborhood, she has taught elementary school for three years to the rural kids of that area, her mom supports her by taking care of her children, her husband sells cattle and they help each other with the family expenses.  She requests her third credit to fix the kitchen in her home and provide her family with better living conditions. 

Her biggest dream in life is to keep her family united and improve little by little their life conditions for more comfort in their home.

loans.use: Fix kitchen

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy S., 44, resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. S. produces traditional baskets, earning an income of about $2 per day. Her husband sells palm products, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $69 on food and $10 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mrs. Sarun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The sixteen people who make up this village bank loan will use their portion of the loan for different purposes so it can improve the standard of living of their families.

Mrs. SaR. is the village bank president and has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she can grow both rice and watermelon to sell to support her family. She has some problems in the crop fields because her fields have infertile soil, so, to improve production, Mrs. SaR. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer.  With the rest of the loan she is going to buy two piglets and plow a field for growing watermelon.

Her husband, Mr. Sin, owns a horse cart. This couple supports seV. children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, while the other three are studying in local public school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 30 años, vive en concubinato con José. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jair y Ángel; a los que cuida y alimenta en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Hace  8 años comenzó a dedicarse a la “agricultura, desde entonces alquila los terrenos agrícolas anualmente, donde siembra con la ayuda de sus esposo; arveja y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en el campo “me siento tranquila”, afirma. Además cuenta que ella “nunca pierde”, pues cuando el precio de la arveja está bajo en el mercado, hace secar el grano; vendiendo después como semilla; donde obtiene un poco más del dinero invertido, ya que cada saco de semilla seca oscila entre los S/. 500 soles como mínimo. Su principal dificultad es no contar con terrenos propios, además que debe cubrir los gastos educativos de sus hijos. Por ello está pensando en ahorrar cada vez que pueda, para poder comenzar a comprar más terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de arrendamiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente segura, pues sabe que encontrará el apoyo que necesita. Gladys, cosechará dentro de un mes “arveja”, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos para que obtenga una cosecha fructífera.
texts.en:
Gladys, age 30, is in a common law relationship with José. They have two children, Jair and Ángel, who she cares for and feeds in their home in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo. Gladys started farming eight years ago. Since that time, she has been renting farmland on a annual basis in order to grow peas and other vegetables with the help of her husband. What she enjoys most about her work is being in the fields. “It makes me feel calm,” says Gladys. She also claims that she has not experienced any losses because whenever the price of peas is low at the market, she will dry her harvest and sells her products as seeds. As a result, she earns slightly more that what she invested. Each bag of seed sells for at least 500 PEN. Her main difficulty has been not having her own land so that she can cover the educational expenses of her children. For this reason, she plans to save whenever she can so that she can buy more farmland and minimize the cost of renting.

Gladys is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Muruhuay” and receiving her second loan with MFP. She feels secure because she knows that she has the support that she needs. Gladys will be harvesting peas within a month. For this reason, she will use her loan to buy several bags of organic fertilizer to apply on her crops so that she can obtain a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: To several bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Las Flores 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Antonia is one of the members of the group Las Flores 1 & 2 (The Flower). She lives in a simple structure with her one of two children, which she raised after becoming a widow. Ana is excited about her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothing, cosmetics products, and shoes in the main market in Santiago, and then bringing them back to her community to sell in her home or by walking. She will use her profits to invest in her business. She intends to invest in her home by building a concrete structure in the short-term future and improve her business into a big store.

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production. Santiago is the second largest city in the Dominican Republic, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, handbags, wallets, etc.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad.  Es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior. 
Viene trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace siete años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la  venta de materiales de escritorio y servicio de fotocopias.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará hojas al por mayor y tóner para la fotocopiadora.
Su sueño es tener una librería grande y bien implementada.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y el compartir ideas entre las socias
texts.en:
Eulogia is a member of the “Cinnamon Flower” Communal Bank, located in the district and department of Puno. She is 45 years old, is single and has a son. She has a college education.

Eulogia has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for about seven years. Her first loan was of S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, it was used for her business. She sells office supplies and provides a photocopier service.

With the new loan of S/ 500.00 nuevo soles she will buy paper wholesale and toner for the photocopier.

Eulogia’s dream is to have a big bookshop that is very well stocked.

What Eulogia enjoys about her Communal Bank are the meetings and sharing ideas between the members.

loans.use: buy paper wholesale and toner for her photocopier.

loans.name: Esterfilia

texts.es:
Esterfilia es una mujer de 52 años de edad  que vive junto a su esposo y una nieta que esta criando en su humilde hogar en la zona rural  del caserío Guaraguaos Alto en Tambogrande – Piura. 

El esposo de Esterfilia es agricultor, tiene un terreno propio en el cual tiene frutales y cultivos transitorios. Esterfilia ayuda a su esposo, con los gastos del hogar, desempeñando dos trabajos. El primero de ellos es la crianza de ganado ovino. Ella se dedica a la criar ovejas alimentándolas adecuadamente para después venderlas en el mercado de la zona.

Además de ello, Esterfilia cuenta con una pequeña bodega, que pretende ampliar,  en su domicilio, donde vende productos de primera necesidad (huevos, leche, agua, aceite).  

Esterfilia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para poder comprar más productos para su bodega para satisfacer la demanda con la que  cuenta actualmente, otra parte del préstamo será destinada a la compra de alimentos balanceados que sus animales necesitan.

Esterfilia y su esposo gozan de buenas referencias personales. Son muy unidos y esto les ha permitido mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Esterfilia is a 52 year old woman who lives together with her husband and a granddaughter whom she is raising in her humble home, located in the rural community of Guaraguaos Alto in Tambogrande, Piura. 

Esterfilia's husband is an agriculturist and he has his own plot of land where he has fruit trees and transitional cultivations. Esterfilia helps her husband with the household expenses by working two jobs. The first is raising sheep. She dedicates her time to raising sheep and feeding them adequately for later resale in the regional market. 

In addition, Esterfilia has a small grocery store in her house, one she plans on expanding. She sells basic needs products (eggs, milk, water, cooking oil). 

Esterfilia requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase more products for her store and to satisfy the demand that she currently sees. The remaining part of her loan will be used to purchase balanced feed that she needs for her livestock.

Esterfilia and her husband enjoy good personal references. They are very close and this has helped them support their family.

loans.use: to purchase merchadise for her store and to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Victoria Ursula

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc, es conviviente, tiene 35 años, 2 hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad. Victoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general también vende pollo, carne , verduras, frutas. Solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, harina, huevos, etc, para surtir su mercadería. Esta en FINCA Perú hace 10 años, le gusta porque puede ahorrar,  con sus ahorros incremento su capital de trabajo. Su seño es que sus hijos sean profesional e incrementar sus negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Communal Bank “Imasumacc”. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 20 and 15). Victoria has a grocery store where she sells chicken, meat, vegetables, and fruits. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, flour, eggs, and other products to restock her inventory.

She has been with FINCA Peru for ten years. Victoria enjoys being able to save and has used her savings to increase her operating capital. Her dreams include seeing her children become professionals and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, flour, eggs, and other products.

loans.name: Blanco Y Negro Group

texts.es: el grupo se llama "Blanco y Negro" está ubicado en el estado de México, dentro del grupo se encuentra la señora Sandra quien es originaria de la comunidad. Ella tiene tres hijos, nos comenta que desde hace 5 años vende productos de belleza que inicio de manera indirecta ayudándole a una señora, poco a poco se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio y opto por iniciar su propio negocio. Sus ventas han incrementado, ella toma cursos para ofrece este producto para poder fortalecerlo e incrementar sus ventas y así con el tiempo lograr tener incremento en sus ventas con lo cual ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Con el prestamo comprará más productos de belleza ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Con las ganancias que obtenga ahorrara para la educación de sus hijos y para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Ella tiene el sueño de ser una mujer exitosa y algun día poder ver a sus hijos como profesionistas.
texts.en:
This group is called "Blanco y Negro" (Black and White) and is located in the State of Mexico.  Sandra is a member of the group and is originally from this community.  She has three children and tells us that she has been selling beauty products for five years.  She started her business indirectly, helping another lady.  Gradually, she realized that it was a good business and chose to start her own business.  She is taking courses on selling this type of product so that she can strengthen her business and increase her sales.  Over time, she has managed to increase her sales and, through her business, has managed to improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

Sandra will use her loan to buy more beauty products since she has a lot of orders.  She will save some of her profits to pay for her children's education and to continue investing in her business.  Her dream is to be a successful woman and, some day, to be able to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the growth of her husband's ice-selling business. With the loan, he will buy a four-wheeled cart and ice blocks which will allow him to visit different parts of the city for selling ice and earning better profits. 

Summer has come and the demand for ice is very high these days. Mussarat is confident that an investment will help her husband make his business more profitable. Previously he would rent a cart, but now that money which he paid for the cart rental will be added to his income instead. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years. 

Mussarat is the mother of three daughters and two sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Mussarat herself is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. 

She is confident that she will be able to return the loan easily as a result of the improved business conditions of her husband.

loans.use: To buy a cart & blocks of ice

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 24-year-old married woman with two children, lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For the past 11 years she has been operating a business selling fresh foods, the profits from which have enabled her to start up a clothing business. Because she operates in the open, weather is the major challenge she faces. Her dream is to open a boutique.

Sarah is requesting this loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. Her goals are to build her own house and develop rental units in order to diversify her family income.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en:
Jalil is 55, married, and has 4 children. He is engaged in the cultivation of onions, melons and wheat. He is also engaged, together with his sons and wife, in an animal husbandry business. He is energetic and diligent. 

In the future Jalil wants to expand his business. He has a fascination in the crops area as well as purchasing cattle and cows. Jalil would like to get a loan of 700 AZN for purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizers and one calf, which will help him expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer and one calf.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a 59-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her family.

Mila has been a rice farmer for 20 years. With the income she gets from farming, she is able to feed her family and send her children to school. Mila works hard to keep her farm productive.

Mila requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. She hopes to be able to continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 32-year-old widow. For four years she has sold fruit such as mangoes and apples.

Annabelle is a new member of HSPFI. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more fruit to sell. In the future Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío de 43 años, es una mujer muy responsable y con ganas de trabajar. Ella es madre de dos menores hijas, vive en casa propia junto a ellos y su esposo con quien lleva varios años de casada. El trabajo de Rocío  consiste en la venta de golosinas y postres en la puerta de su casa, además ella tiene varios cuartos en su casa los cuales alquila y significa un ingresos mas para su economía, lleva en este trabajo diez años, lo hace en su casa y tiene la ayuda de sus hijas.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da buenos ingresos, además de poder estar en su casa con sus hijas, ella espera mas adelante poder mejorar las condiciones de su casa para así alquilar sus cuartos a mejor precio.Este es el segundo préstamo entre Rocío y la institución MFP, le gusta el grupo al cual esta volviendo de algunos ciclos de retirarse, y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brinda la institución con los préstamos que le dan ya que significan mucho para mejorar su economía.	
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, ella comprara una raspadillera e invertirá en ingredientes para seguir con su actividad de ventas de postres.
texts.en: Rocio is 43 years old and she is a very responsible woman who is eager to work. She is the mother of two young daughters. She lives in a house of her own together with them and her husband, to whom she has been married for many years. Rocio's work consists of the sale of sweets and desserts from the door of her house. She also has various rooms in her house that she rents out and it translates into more income for her personal economy. She has been in business for ten years and she works from home with the help of her daughters. What she most enjoys about her work is that she earns a good income and she is also able to stay at home with her daughters. She hopes to improve the conditions of her house in the future, to rent out the rooms at a better price. It is Rocio's second loan with the MFP institution (Kiva Field Partner). She appreciates the group, having returned after withdrawing for a few loan cycles. She is very thankful for the support provided to her by the institution through the loans granted to her. It helps her to improve her personal economy. With the loan she requests, amounting to 1000 soles, she will purchase a mill and she will also invest in the purchase of ingredients to keep up her dessert business.

loans.use: to purchase a mill and to invest in the purchase of ingredients to keep up her dessert business.

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en:
Almaz, a married mother of four sons and one daughter, has a store that sells sugar, butter, rice, pasta and other products. Located in a highly populated area, her business can generate an income of about 80 AZN per week.

Now requesting her second loan from AqroInvest and Kiva for 1500 AZN to purchase additional store inventory, Almaz hopes to expand her shop and introduce new products to her customers in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
After his retirement from the military, Mohammad, a 58-year-old hardworking man, opened a mini-market to sell food products and kids’ snacks using his retirement salary.

Although Mohammad has a big family that includes six sons and three daughters, he was able to raise them and send them to college so that most of them are now employees who contribute to the family income, but he still has three members of the family who are under the age of 20.

Now Mohammad has applied for a loan to add new items to the mini-market inventory and re-organize the space to have a good expansion for it.

loans.use: To add new items for the mini-market.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 55 years old, married with three children. Her spouse works as a farmer in the village of Guayabal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She enjoys daily activities in her hog raising business. She devotes herself full-time to maintaining her business which is the only source of income for her family. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them earning P5,500 (Philippine pesos) per head.

She wants to purchase baby livestock but she has insufficient capital, that’s why she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional piglets and feed to sustain her hog-raising business. She hopes to grow her business with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and feed to sustain her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Francisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: La socia tiene 4 hijos de 12, 9, 8, 3 años de edad, la socia se dedica  aún a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos en especial vacas, ella compra las vacas tiernas y las engorda y luego de ello la socia las lleva a vender a la feria del poblado de Combapata. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en la compra de vacas tiernas para la venta.
texts.en:
This member has four children (ages 12, 9, 8, and 3). She buys and sells livestock, especially cows. The member buys young cows for fattening and eventually sells them at the village fair in Combapata.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of young cows that she can sell later.

loans.use: to purchase young cows for eventual resale.

loans.name: Tujijure 2 Group

texts.fr:
Marie est une commerçante âgée de 48ans qui habite la localité de Rutoki de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers de boutique (haricots, riz, sucre, savons, biscuits…) depuis 5 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée a Paul ; un tailleur et ont ensemble  7 enfants dont 5 étudient. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 200,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités d’articles divers de boutique (haricots, riz, sucre, savons, biscuits…)  à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tujijure II»
texts.en:
Marie is a 48-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Rutoki in the province of Gitega in the center of the country.  She has been buying and selling various items (beans, rice, sugar, soaps, cookies) for five years.  She is also a farmer. She attended school up to the sixth year of primary school.  She is married to Paul, a tailor, and they have seven children together, five of whom attend school.

The Kiva loan of 200,000 Burundi francs will increase her capital, allowing her to buy large quantities of items (beans, rice, sugar, soap, cookies) to sell in order to earn a large profit. 

She is a member of the community group “Tujijure II”.

loans.use: to increase her capital, allowing her to buy large quantities of items (beans, rice, sugar, soap, cookies) to sell in order to earn a large profit.

loans.name: Aiah Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfiance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 5,500,000.00 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for the withholding and repayments. 

Aiah is the leader of this group of teachers. The 47-year-old man is a native of Yormadu in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has five children – two in primary school and the others in secondary school. Aiah has been a professional teacher for the past twenty years. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy household furniture and food, and invest the rest in a small business.

loans.use: to buy household furniture and food, and invest the rest in a small business.

loans.name: Sinsindagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SINSINDAGBE est composé de trois membres qui résident dans la même zone. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Raïmatou est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Raïmatou est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Rafiou. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Raïmatou n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Raïmatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis trois ans, Raïmatou vend des condiments dans son quartier, activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. Raïmatou s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Raïmatou et les autres membres du groupe SINSINDAGBE sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The SINSINDAGBE group is comprised of three members who live in the same area. The group representative, Raïmatou is the lady with her hand raised in the photo. With a view to increasing the scale of their business to better meet their customers' demand, this group is seeking financial assistance from Alidé for the third time. Raïmatou is 37 years old and is married to Rafiou. They have two children in school, and living at home. Raïmatou did not attend school. Raïmatou lives with her husband and children. The couple meet the household budget together. For three years, Raïmatou has sold condiments in her neighbourhood, a business which proves quite profitable for her.
Raïmatou buys her supplies in one of Benin's markets. With the goal of strengthening their business and better meeting the needs of their customers, Raïmatou and the other members of the SINSINDAGBE group are seeking a third loan with Alidé.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Luanda A Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Luanda A Group in Western Kenya! Jane is the facilitator of the Luanda A SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jane will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Luanda A SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Jane with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sokrem

texts.en:
Sokrem (in the photo), age 23, is single and lives with her father in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her father buys and sells cows.    

Sokrem is a cleaner. She is applying for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to help provide capital to her father to buy additional cows to resell.

loans.use: To provide capital to her father to buy additional cows to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, maize, rice, cocoyams, Irish potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Gumersida

texts.en:
Gumersida is from Kinuman, Norte Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Gumersida is married with 10 children. She plants and harvests vegetables and corn for sale. 

Gumersida has been in her business for three years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Gumersida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicharrones (fried pork skins), cups, soft drinks, and more

loans.name: Matilde Del Carmen

texts.es: Matilde tiene 67 años de edad es viuda tiene 1 hija y es mayor de edad por lo que es independiente. Ella estudio desde joven la carrera de corte y confección. Su papa en ese tiempo le regalo una máquina de coser. En la actualidad ella les cose la ropa a sus vecinos. Con el préstamo Matilde quiere comprar una máquina de coser, telas, hilos etc. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura grande para así  poderle dar trabajo  muchas personas que no lo tengan.
texts.en:
Matilde is 67 years old.  She is a widow and has a grown daughter who is independent.  From a young age, she studied cutting and tailoring, at which time her father gave her a sewing machine as a gift.  She currently sews clothes for her neighbors.  

With the loan, Matilde wants to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread, etc.  Her dream is to have a large tailoring shop so that she can offer employment to many people who don't have work.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is taking out another Kiva loan. Her dream was always to have a very spacious general store so that she could offer good service to each one of her customers. Now, thanks to her efforts, and also the help that Yehu Microfinance Trust offers, she has her own general store.

She is applying for this loan in order to buy more products for her general store, such as drinks, tea leaves, rice, milk, bread and other items so that her daily sales volume increases. This way she can meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more products for her general store, such as drinks, tea leaves, rice, milk, bread and other items.

loans.name: Soert's Group

texts.en:
Soert, 44, lives in a rural area of the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meachey province and she is married with six children. The main family’s source of income is from working as a paid worker. She and her husband have been working for several years. The current business earns her about 25,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
Soert has been with VisionFund for three cycles. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, Soert wants to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single mother of 3 and she is 42 years old. Her first born is in college. The second born is employed in a salon and the last born is in primary school. She is determined to educate all her children up to college level. Jane supplies building materials mostly sand to the people who are putting up residential and commercial buildings at Rongai. To get orders to supply materials, she frequently visits sites and talks to contractors. She buys the sand from those who harvest along the river beds. She hires a lorry and supplies the materials to her clients according to the orders. Jane buys the sand at USD 250 (inclusive of transport) and sells at USD 300. With more people putting up residential houses in Rongai, Jane is able to get many orders to supply the sand. Her working capital is not able to cater for these orders. Jane would like to take a loan of USD 300 to add to her working capital. This will enable her cater for all her orders.

loans.use: Jane wants to increase on the tonnage of sand she supplies from two trips per day to three.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud M. owns an Auto Parts store in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Mahmud is looking for funding so that he can increase the number of parts available allowing him to increase his customer base.

loans.use: To purchase Auto Parts that will allow him to service more types of vehicles

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon of Papaigalagala has great cooking experience. She runs her own barbarque business in front of her house. Her place is close to the University gate, and she has many customers from the students of the University.

Levon is making good money from selling her BBQ, and she is willing to make and sell her BBQ 5 days a week. She is able to save some money from her business to support her children and her family. She has asked for another loan to upgrade and improve her small business.

loans.use: Purchase more supplies for making the BBQ

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a high breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresita De Monserra

texts.es:
Teresita is an accomplished, responsible career woman. She is married and has three daughters who are 20, 16, and 14 years old. Her husband works in an agro-industrial company as a veterinarian. One of her daughters help her in her business, which she started because she enjoys sales. While she has the extra income to live on, she needs it for her all her children's tuition costs. The reason she started her business was so that she could send her children to college. She started her business 6 years ago, selling clothes amongst neighbors and close friends and acquaintances. It took off well and she increased the range of items to sell like perfumes, women's sandals and accessories, and her customer base has increased.

Teresita is seeking a loan of $925 to buy more fashionable clothes, perfumes, sandals, and accessories to stock up her business and to better attend her customers. She will repay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you for giving your support to grow and develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresita es una mujer trabajadora, cumplida y muy responsable, ella esta casada y tiene tres hijas de 20, 16 y 14 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja en una empresa agro industrial como médico veterinario. Una de sus hijas le ayuda en el negocio, el cual empezó por que le gustan mucho las ventas y de esta manera también podía tener un ingreso extra para su hogar, ya que el gasto es elevado por que todas sus hijas están estudiando y necesitan este ingreso para que puedan terminar sus estudios, esto es el motivo más grande que la llevo a iniciar su negocio ya que desea que todas sus hijas tengan estudios universitarios. Ella empezó hace 6 años con su negocio vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinas y amistades y le comenzó a ir muy bien, entonces amplio su gama de productos e incursionó en la venta de perfumes, sandalias para dama y accesorios también, así su clientela se ha incrementado.

Teresita está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar ropa de temporada, perfumes, sandalias y accesorios para surtir más su negocio y así atender mejor a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que les das para poder continuar ampliando y creciendo su negocio.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
ELENA is 44 years old, married, and until now has been unable to become pregnant. She sells rice, sugar, pasta noodles, drinks, and cooking oil in her convenience store. With her loan she will invest in the purchase of more products for her store so that her business will prosper. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 1 with Ms. Elena Hernández Vázquez (handicrafts) and Ms. Emiliana López López (handicrafts). Elena and Emiliana will invest in the purchase of cloth and thread in multiple colors.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA tiene 44 años, casada, hasta el momento no ha podido embarazarse. Se dedica a la venta de arroz, azúcar, pastas, aceite, bebidas, en su tienda de abarrotes.. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir la tienda con el objetivo de que el negocio prospere. Pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 1 junto con doña Elena Hernández Vázquez (artesana) y doña Emiliana López López (artesana). Elena y Emiliana invertirán en la compra de tela e hilos en su variedad de colores.

loans.use: Convenience Store

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.pt:
Cacilda is a worker at the Water Supply Company in the City of Maxixe in the province of Inhambane. She's a single mother, and has 2 children. She joined the loan program in 2006. This loan that she will take is her fourth. She has used the loan money for the purchase of furniture for her residence. Cacilda's children are studying in elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Cacilda e trabalhadora da Empresa de Abastecimento de Agua na Cidade da Maxixe na provincia de Inhambane. Ela e mae solteira, e tem 2 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Este emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o quarto. Ela tem usado o dinheiro do emprestimo para a compra de mobiliario para a sua residencia. os filhos de Cacilda estao a estudar no ensino basico.

loans.use: Cacilda wants to use the money to purchase furnishings for her home

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanda Kumari M., 24 years old, lives in Thecho, Laltipur, Nepal. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agricultural work. Mrs. M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband, one son, and one daughter. Her husband's name is Daya Ram M.. He works in a carpet factory. Her daughter is studying in grade 2.

Mrs. M. opened her tailor shop 2 months ago. Before that, she worked in her friend’s tailor shop. She makes different types of ladies' dresses in her shop. She prefers to make traditional and modern dresses for ladies like blouses and kurta Sulwar.

Now she is asking for her first loan of in the amount of US$ 175 to buy cloth, shears, etc. for her new tailor shop. She wants to earn enough to be able to spend her income on her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy cloth etc. for her tailor shop

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and has three children. She has been a member of the community bank “Retoño” for one year. She says that the community bank has helped her learn how to run her business efficiently.

Maria’s husband is sick and she now has to support the family. When she started with the community bank she had nothing. Now, thanks to her loan, she has a small store. She travels to different markets and buys fruits, vegetables, and grains, which she then sells from her store in the city of Ayacucho.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a stand to set up in the markets where she currently only buys her merchandise. Maria dreams of continuing to be able to save, expanding her business, and that her children will have a better life.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a stand to set up in the markets where she currently only buys her merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs. María del Pilar A. V. lives in the district of Agallpampa in Otuzco province in the city of La Libertad, Peru. She is 36 years old with a high school education. She also has two grown children.

When María was young she worked as a housekeeper and she saved what she earned in order to begin her own business. In this way she slowly started a grocery store in her own home in which she sells basic foods and beauty products.

María is part of the Communal Bank “Jesús Nazareno” (“Jesus of Nazareth”) and from this communal bank she received her first loan of S/. 300.00 (approximately $100 U.S.). With this money she purchased various products to supply her store.

With a loan of S/. 1000.00 ($350 U.S.) that she will repay in 6 months, María will buy 1 box of oil, noodles, rice, and beauty products, especially perfume and cologne.

María dreams of building her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María del Pilar A. V. vive en el distrito de Agallpampa en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú; tiene 36 años de edad y estudió secundaria completa. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Cuando era más joven trabajaba como empleada del hogar y lo que ganaba lo iba ahorrando para poner su negocio de esa forma lentamente implementa una pequeña bodega en su casa en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad y productos de belleza. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús Nazareno” en este banco comunal recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró varios productos para surtir su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 que pagará en 6 meses, comprará 1 caja de aceite, fideos, arroz y productos de belleza especialmente perfumes y colonias. La señora Maria sueña con ampliar mas su negocio

loans.use: To purchase products to supply a general store

loans.name: Kutbinisso

texts.ru:
Kutbinisso T., 57, lives in Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is a widowed mother of 5 children. Kutbinisso earns money by raising animals. She has a small cowshed where she keeps calves. She buys calves, fattens them and re-sells them at the markets for a profit. This helps Kutbinisso support her family; while she is a single mother, she also needs to work to keep her children fed and clothed. Kutbinisso would like to buy another calf, but she needs a loan to do so. Now is a good time to buy a calf, because after winter, the animals are thin and are being sold for lower prices. Kutbinisso plans to repay the loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Толибова Кутбиниссо проживает в районе Абдурахмони Дзжоми. Клиентке 57лет , вдова , имеет 5 детей. Зарабатывает клиентка путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота.Имеет небольшой коровник ,в котором имеются бычки.Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает на рынках по более выгодной цене. Это помогает обеспечивать семью , несмотря на то , что она одинокая женщина , ей приходится работать , чтобы дети были сытыми и одетыми.Но клиентка хочет купить дополнительно еще одного бычка, но для этого ей нужно получить кредит.Именно сейчас покупка бычка может быть выгодна , так как после зимы животные исхудавшие , продаются по низим ценам. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena A. is a soap maker. He is married and has 2 children. He is running out of raw materials he uses in the manufacture of soap.

He is asking for a loan of $525 to buy these raw materials.

loans.use: To buy raw materials used in the manufacture of soap

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru:
Shamigul S. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 48 years old, is married and has 5 children. She has a High School education. Shamigul has a piece of land where she grows vegetables. Once the vegetables are grown, she puts some away for her family's consumption and sells the rest on the market. In order to get good crops she needs to purchase mineral fertilizer. For this goal she wishes to obtain a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Сафарбекова Шамигул жительница города Вахдат . Возраст 48 лет , замужем ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Шамигул занимается сельским хозяйством. Она имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Собрав урожай клиентка делает необходимые запасы для своей семьи ,а лишнее продает на рынке. Но что бы собрать качественный урожай ей необходимо купить минеральные удобрения . Для чего она и решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Eal

texts.en: Mrs. Eal N. is 32 years old and lives with her husband Kub Matt in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To help support their three children and their education expenses, she sells fish in the market and he works in construction. Mrs. Eal has been renting her stall in the market since 2007 and is now applying for a loan in order to purchase this stall. This will eliminate her current monthly rental costs. By reducing her business overhead, Mrs. Eal hopes that she will be able to focus on increasing her business inventory to include vegetables, pork, and beef.

loans.use: To purchase the stall she rents in the market

loans.name: Narzinisso

texts.ru:
Narzinisso A. lives in Jalollidini Rumy. She is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. She works as a bookkeeper. Additionally, she works in animal husbandry. She has a business enterprise in which she raises sheep. She wants to take out a loan to buy a calf. Narzinisso is very active woman who is not cowed by the difficulties in her life. She can pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Акрамова Нарзиниссо жительница района Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем и имеет четверых детей. Работает бухгалтером. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство где разводит овец. Хочет получить кредит и использовать его для покупки бычка. Нарзиниссо очень активная женщина и не боится никаких трудностей в жизни.Погасить кредит она сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing a calf

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys B. is a single parent and has 4 children. She has received schooling through primary level. Gladys sells used clothing and fabric at Siwdo, which she has done since 1981. Gladys uses her income to take care of her children's welfare. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more used clothing and fabric for re-sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to buy building materials for the family house which is a work in progress.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing and fabric for sale

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhim V., 43, is married and sells groceries to the people in her area. She has five children aged 16, 14, 12, 9, and an infant. She earns about $5 per day. Her husband makes about $7 per day working as a fisherman.

For another source of income, Mrs. Chhim V. requests a loan to purchase a plot of farmland for her husband to grow rice when he is not fishing.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of farmland to grow rice for additional income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell in her small business

loans.name: Ovi

texts.es: Ovi tiene 27 años, su estado actual es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Ella es ama de casa, se levanta a las 6.00 a.m. a preparar el almuerzo, después da de comer a sus animales o los sujeta en el campo ante una estaca, después de esto a las 11 lleva el almuerzo para su esposo, en seguida se queda trabajando en su chacra de papas, que es el producto que siembra en mayor cantidad. A Ovi le agrada esa actividad, ya que desde niña lo hizo.
