(20211040027) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị Hạt (20211040025) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,808,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20211040028) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị Hòa (20211040044) is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,360,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. 5. Nguyễn Thị Hằng (20211040024) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. L. Nguyễn Thị (20211040023) là 30 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà 1 - Nhóm 07 (Nhóm 07). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 2.464.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Ngô Thị P. (20211040027) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị Hạt (20211040025) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.808.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. Nguyễn Thị T. (20211040028) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị Hòa (20211040044) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Nguyễn Thị Hằng (20211040024) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 50-year-old married man who has three children. He has been working in a networking occupation for the past 10 years during the time when this occupation became well known and required in Lebanon. After getting good experience, he decided in 2009 to open his own networking business and start performing internet connections to his town and its surroundings. 

Today, Adnan is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase an additional internet machine to improve his business and increase his family income and his living situation.

loans.use: To purchase an additional internet machine

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda S. is from the village of Kinoguitan in Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old and widowed with 4 adul children. To make a living, Linda sells snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

Linda has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting her first loan, for 4000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more products for sale.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony O. O. is a butchery owner in Nambale, Busia district. He started this business in 2004, after his cereals business made losses and he saw greener pastures in meat sales. Anthony is 29 years old, married and blessed with 1 child. Anthony gets his meat stock daily from the slaughter house.

Anthony would like a loan of KES 20,000 to boost his meat stock due to the demands of his customers. He says his main plan currently, as a firstborn in his family, is to empower his younger siblings to be self-dependent.

loans.use: Boost butchery business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose Antonio es un joven de 22 años de edad es soltero, actualmente vive con su abuela en San Martin Jil. y para que no lo mantenga su abuela instalo un negocio que es venta de celulares, computadoras, discos duros, CDS, el esta graduado a nivel medio de Perito Contador tambien realiza tramites contables. El credito que solicita es para comprar repuestos de computadoras. Es un negocio rentable le va muy bien ya que tiene clientes que lo solicitan para que les brinde sus servicios. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y poder vender computadoras de todas marcas, para llegar a ser un empresario de exito reconocido por la comunidad y poder ayudar a su abuela.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a young man who is 22 years of age, single, and currently lives with his grandmother in San Martin Jilotepeque. In order to support his grandmother, he established a business selling mobile phones, computers, hard drives, and CDs. Jose Antonio graduated as a certified accountant and also performs accounting paperwork.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy computer parts. His business is profitable and doing very well because he has customers who request his services. Jose Antonio dreams of growing his business and selling all brands of computers so that he can become a successful well-known entrepreneur in the community and continue to support his grandmother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase three computers, accessories, and parts

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en:
Rosel M. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 41 years old. Rosel is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosel owns & operates a specialized-general store, selling a variety of fruits like mangoes, in the local community. Rosel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and the ability to engage in business activities. Rosel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. is currently in the business of selling Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cooking oil, etc. at a market and is requesting a loan to stock hens and cocks to sell.  Rose is 43 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock hens and cocks to sell

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna G. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells dried fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosanna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosanna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en: Batsuh T. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own ger – a traditional housing tent – in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His wife works as a tailor while he operates a carpentry business in their town. Batsuh has been working as a carpenter since 2005 and over this period, he has earned the loyalty of his customers because of the quality of his work and service. His business is more profitable in the summertime than in the cold season. In the future, Batsuh would like to own his own carpentry shop and expand his product line in order to grow his customer base. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more timber for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame E. trades in vegetables and foodstuffs at Takoradi.  Maame has been through junior high school. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a painter. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra food items for sale. She hopes to plough back her profit into her business.

loans.use: buy extra food items for sale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda N. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 51 years old. Merlinda is married and has six children. Her younger children still go to school and she hopes to have them finish college. To make a living, Merlinda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Merlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the second loan taken out by Merlinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arlyne

texts.en:
Arlyne G. lives in the village of Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old, married and has seven grown children. She makes a living by raising livestock, especially ducks.  She has been in this business for more than four years and earns about 7,500 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Arlyne joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to improve and expand her small business.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand a small livestock business

location.town: Mabasa Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 25 years old and is married with two children. He is a businessman and his wife is in business as well. This family is serious in their daily activities because they are visionary.

Jean Claude owns a business selling bedsheets. He has an experience of ten years in this field and the hours of his business are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day.

Now, Jean Claude is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more bedsheets for sale. With this expansion, he will be able to attract more customers and earn more profits which he will use for his family and in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena D. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Filomena is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Filomena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Filomena has successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory. This loan is Filomena's second loan taken from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which enables its field partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene L. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Irene is married and has a four-month-old child. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Irene is doing her best to improve her income because she wants to save for her family's future.

Irene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Irene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is married with two grown children. He is a farmer from the small town of Vodyanoye, in eastern Ukraine. He grows early spring vegetables, i.e. tomatoes, radish, etc. Nikolai owns 5 big greenhouses and a separate one for seedlings. Three of them have heating systems. He tried his luck in this business 15 years ago. 

Currently, Nikolai has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas into his flourishing farming business. He spends about 20,000-22,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year.  

Nikolai is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to install heating units in 2 of his six greenhouses. He is hoping to plant and grow 9,000 tall-grown tomatoes. Nikolai has witnessed an obvious advantage of heating systems in his greenhouses: tomatoes ripen much faster and rot less.  He is hoping to continue investing in his business which has very good potential in this highly agricultural region of Ukraine.

loans.use: To install heating systems in 2 greenhouses

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a twenty-eight year old woman. She is married and has four children. They live in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She wants to own a permanent house for residence and a sustainable income-generating venture. 

She has been operating a bar for seven years. The business has grown over time amidst challenges in finances. Nevertheless, she looks forward to owning a popular bar in town. Constance needs the loan to purchase beer, because the festive season is fast approaching.

loans.use: To buy beer to sell during the festive season

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama L. is married and takes care of three children. Ama sells a variety of items such as fruits, maize, and others, in Abura.  She has been doing this for three years. Her husband is a mason. 

Ama uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more fruits for resale. Ama plans to reinvest her new profit back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits for resale

loans.name: Aurore

texts.fr: Aurore est née le 09 Août 1979 et vit depuis sa naissance à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à un Marcelin, Aurore est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Aurore vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Aurore a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et s'est lancée dans le commerce d'ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, seaux en plastique etc.) par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Aurore vend également des pâtes alimentaires. Aurore s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Aurore exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. C'est la première fois que Aurore sollicite un concours financier auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en: Aurore was born on August 9, 1979, and has  lived in Ekpè all her life, in the town of Sèmè-Podji.  Married to  Marcelin, Aurore is the mother of three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple meet their various family expenses.  Aurore left school at the secondary level and became involved in the business of selling kitchen equipment (coolers, plastic buckets, etc.) through the local distribution system.  As a sideline, Aurore also sells pasta.  She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin.  Aurore has been doing this kind of work for seven years.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan through ALIDé, with the intention of growing her business and increasing her revenue.

loans.use: to purchase plastic kitchen equipment

loans.name: Ma. Loreta

texts.en:
Ma. Loreta T. lives in the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old, married and has five school-aged children. She makes a living by selling personal items and kitchen supplies to people who live in her area. Ma. Loreta has worked in this business for more than 15 years and earns about 2,500 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Ma. Loreta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI after using it to buy more supplies and increase her working capital. She is applying for a new loan, her fifth, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: La señora Luisa A. Avilés es originaria de Huitzililla, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. Ella tiene 54 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º. Año de primaria, ella tiene una hija se llama Rosa Isela tiene 16 años de edad está estudiando en bachilleres, ella tiene su negocio de venta de Jafra y Avon por catalogo y va a utilizar su crédito para comprar productos de Jafra y Avon lo que pida el cliente y para mejorar la casa para la alimentación, ella ofrece a sus clientes perfumes, viles, barnices, cosméticos etc. ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años la invito una amiga primero empezó con Avon   y después con Jafra ella va de casa en casa ofreciendo sus productos enseña sus catálogos y anota lo que quieren, ella lleva el pedido y le llega a su casa, al principio inicio con su propio dinero, ella tiene productos de sobra y los va vendiendo van sus clientas a su casa a traer para regalos, su negocio es importante porque se va sobrellevando en su hogar para la comida, los gastos y para pagar el préstamo , todo le gusta de su negocio más vender Jafra porque gana más le va bien le dan más ganancias, ella está orgullosa de su negocio cuando vende al contado. Sus clientas son las muchacaha, jobenes, señoras les ofrece perfumes, viles barniz, trastes de plástico, cosméticos, su negocio es popular por las ventas del Avon, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son hay veces que no tiene para pagar cuando su esposo tiene el le presta, la competencia que enfrenta son hay más personas que venden Avon y Jafra, las ganancias del negocio las utiliza para pagar los créditos, ella está planeando vender dobladitas, tacos de arroz y lo piensa lograr con el siguiente préstamo que le den, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son repellar los cuartos, pintarlos y echarle piso a la cocina, los planes y esperanza son salir adelante, mejorar su casa, tener una camioneta, ella está muy feliz con este préstamo porque le va a ayudar a su negocio y a su familia
texts.en:
Luisa A. Avilés is from Huitzililla, in the city of Ayala, state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is 54 years old, and she has a second grade education.  She has a 16 year old daughter, Rosa Isela, who is working on her high school diploma.  

She has a business selling Jafra and Avon by catalog.  She will use the loan to buy the Jafra and Avon products that her customers request.  She will also use it to improve the kitchen in her house.  She has been selling her customers perfumes, lipstick, nail polish, and cosmetics, etc. for three years.  A friend invited her.  First, she started with Avon.  Then she started selling Jafra.  She goes door to door to sell her products.  She shows her catalogs and marks down what they want.  She takes the order and later delivers it to the customer’s house.  She started with her own money.  She has extra products, and her customers go to her house to buy them as presents.  Her business is important because it is used to get food, pay expenses, and pay the loan.

She likes everything about her business.  She likes selling Jafra more because she earns more.  It is going well for her, and she gets good earnings.  She is proud of her business when she makes a sale for cash.  Her customers are girls, young women, and ladies.  She sells perfumes, lipstick, nail polish, plastic containers, and cosmetics.  Her business selling Avon is very popular.  The challenge she faces in her business is that sometimes she does not have the money to pay.  When her husband has it, he lends it to her.  She also faces a lot of competition selling Avon and Jafra.  She uses the income from her business to pay the loan.  She is planning on selling “dobladitas” (a type of Chilean bread) and rice tacos.  She plans to do that with the next loan that she is given.  

The improvements she wants to make on her house are to plaster the rooms, paint them, and to put down a floor in the kitchen.  Her plans and hopes are to get ahead, improve her house, and to have a truck.  She is very happy with this loan because it will help her business and her family.

loans.use: To buy Jafra and Aavon perfumes and lipsticks and to buy clothes to stock her business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca actualmente tiene 55 años de edad, actualmente vive con dos  hijas las cuales trabajan y obtienen su propio ingreso apoyando de esta manera en los gastos del hogar,  segùn referecias de los vecinos y compañeros de trabajo la Sra. Francisca es responsable y trabajadora; labora como afanadora en el Hospital Jacinto Hernandez de nueva Guinea desde hace 16 años.
solicicta su primer financiamiento con AFODENIC mediante el apoyo de Kiva el cual invertirá en compra de materiales de construcciòn los cuales le permitiran cambiar el techo a su cocina devido ha que en temporadas de lluvia se moja  y se le hace lodo lo que afecta la salud de su familia, es una mujer muy responsable y todo este efuerzo lo hace pensando en el bienestar de sus seres queridos.  

Su mayor deseo es brindar un techo digno y que a su familia no le falte lo basico.
texts.en:
Francisca, 55, lives with two daughters who work and earn their own income thus helping out with household expenses.  According to references from neighbors and coworkers, Francisca is responsible and hard working.  She has been employed as a Cleaning Lady at Jacinto Hernández Hospital in Nueva Guinea for 16 years.

She is asking for her first AFODENIC loan through Kiva support that she’ll use to buy building materials that will make it possible for her to replace her kitchen roof because during the rainy season it gets wet and everything becomes mud which affects her family’s health.  She is a very responsible woman and she exerts all this effort thinking of her loved ones’ wellbeing.

Her greatest wish is to provide a proper roof and that her family never lacks the basics.

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida V. P.  de 39 años vive en la Urbanizaciòn la Playa muy cerca al mar;  en ese ambiente de playa brisa y mar, se desempeña en su negocio dedicado a la comercializaciòn de productos mediante guias especializadas y de mercancia que le encargan sus clientes y que no aparecen en el catalogo de su oferta, como perfumes, utiles escolares, calzado, ropa femenina, masculina e infantil y en general todo lo que le piden sus buenos clientes.
Su negocio inicò hace cuatro años, cuando aun no estaba inscrita en las empresas que ofrecen productos por catalogos y en ese moemento lo hacia a travès de una amiga, pero gradualmente crecieron sus clientes y se independizò, agregando muchas otras mercanicas que no tenian las guias especializadas de productos y tambien se inscribiò en diversas revistas, para comercializar varios tipos de mercancia.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y su primer credikiva, con el cual planea comprar utiles escolares, aprovechando que es la época en que los colegios inician sus clases y estos  productos tienen muy alta rotaciòn; con esta inversiòn augura su èxito porque sus clientes, padres de familia, satisfacen la apremiante  necesidad de dotar a sus hijos con libros, cuadernos, lapices reglas, etc  necesarios para lograr su aprovechamiento escolar.  Asi mismo Aida  tambien venderá uniformes y calzados para estudiantes, pues ella los  comprará  en mayor volumen obteniendo  buenos descuentos que posteriormente venderà  a padres de familia  mediante el sistema de crèdito, el cual facilita el acceso a la educaciòn de sus hijos.
Desde que iniciò su financiamiento con la Fundaciòn ha obtenido logros en su negocio, como el de  conseguir utilidades que le facilitan aportar a su hogar y sobre todo tener un capital adicional al suyo, para responder a la demanda de sus clientes. 
Su mayor desafio es lograr tener un almacen, para prosicionar su negocio, aumentar sus utilidades y seguir mejorando las condiciones  de vida familiar, pues  ella y su conyuge se esfuerzan y trabajan para que sus cuatro hijos, en las edades de 4 a 20 años, logren la prosperidad y el èxito derivado de una educaciòn de calidad y mejores opciones laborales futuras.
texts.en:
Aida V. P., 39, lives in the La Playa development, very near the ocean.  In that ambience of sea breezes and the ocean she undertakes her work selling catalogue merchandise and other items not in catalogues that her customers order from her like perfumes, school supplies, shoes, clothing for women, men and children and, in general, whatever her good customers request.

The business started four years ago when she still wasn’t enrolled with any of the catalogue firms; at that time she did it through a friend.  Gradually her customer base grew and she became independent adding a lot more merchandise that wasn’t included in the catalogues and she also subscribed to several magazines in order to sell all kinds of merchandise.

This is her 3rd loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her first with Kiva.  She plans to use it to buy school supplies taking advantage of the season in which schools restart classes and these products are quick sellers.  This investment bodes success because her customers, parents, can satisfy the pressing need to supply their children with books, notebooks, pencils, rulers, etc. needed to do well in school.  In addition, Aida will also sell school uniforms and shoes for students because she’ll buy them in large quantities and then offer generous discounts.  She will sell them to the parents on credit which will make their children’s access to education easier.

Since starting financing through the Fundación she’s reached goals in her business, like earning profits to contribute to her home and, above all, having additional capital of her own to respond to customer demand.

Her greatest challenge is to have a warehouse, to position her business in the marketplace, to increase profits and to continue improving her family’s conditions because she and her spouse work hard and make the effort so that their four children, ranging in ages between 4 and 20, will attain prosperity and success, derived from a quality education, and better future employment options.

loans.use: To buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes to sell to students.

loans.name: Chhavy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan would be provided to four members. Each would use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes, all of which would be geared towards improving their families' standard of living.

Mrs. Chhavy was selected by the other members as the group's leader. She is a Khmer cake seller and a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land. On her land, she grows rice, which is both sold for a profit and kept to feed her family. She is a widow with five children: three of her children are seamstresses in garment factories, while the other two attend the local public school. Although they work very hard, their family does not earn much income. To improve their lot, Mrs. Chhavy is seeking a loan to start a new business. Specifically, she would like to buy piglets and chickens, and rest of the loan proceeds she would be used to build a breeding area.

loans.use: To start a new animal breeding business

loans.name: Llina Paola

texts.es: LLina Paola Gòmez se dedica a la venta de medicina natural, con grandes satisfacciones y es la ver como sus clientes, cuentan los testimonios del efecto de sus productos en la salud de ellos . Llina es una mujer casada y con dos hijos en las edades de 4 a 8 años, que iniciò esta actividad cuando su esposo fuè trasladado a otra ciudad y decidiò empezar a generar oportunidades para ella y para su familia, así fue como empezó, le fue bien y le gustó, pero cuando llegó el nacimiento de su tercer hijo suspendió su negocio, para dedicarse a su atenciòn y la de sus otros dos pequeños y una vez su esposo fue nuevamente trasladado a la ciudad e Barranquilla,   la retomó con mas fuerza y hoy se siente muy satisfecha de haber logado su autonomia y sobre todo de apoyar a sus esposo en la prosperidad de su hogar. Asì es como Llina Paola tiene sus principales clientes en San Andrès, isla donde naciò  y tambien en Valledupar, Sincelejos y Cartagena, estas tres ùltimas son ciudades de la costa Norte de Colombia.  Para desarrollar esta actividad Llina  se ha preparado mucho, pues es necesario conocer la composiciòn de los productos, sus efectos y sobre todo hacer seguimiento al impacto que estos producen en sus clientes. Su dinamismo, diciplina y concentraciòn en su meta  le facilitado el trascender de un mercado domèstico e informal, donde solo concentraba familiares y vecinos,  a un mercado mas activo  extendido en otras ciudades de una manera mas formal, mientras  Llina continua con su sueño de perfeccionarlo  y tener un punto de distribuciòn en los Centros comerciales, para lograr un acceso masivo de clientes, aunque su gran desafio es conseguir el capital para hacerlo; pero para Llina teniendo un norte muy claro es muy probable que logre cristalizar sus objetivas aspiraciones.
texts.en:
Llina Paola Gòmez sells natural medicines.  She finds her work very satisfying and enjoys it when her customers tell her about the effect her products have had on their health.  Llina is married and has two children aged 4 and 8.  She started out in this business when her husband was transferred to another city and she decided to start creating opportunities for herself and her family.  Her business went well and she enjoyed it but then, when her third child was born, she put her business on hold so that she could devote her time to him and her other two young children.  When her husband was transferred again to the city of Barranquilla, she started her business again with even more energy and today she feels very satisfied to have achieved her independence and to have become able to support her husband in making their household prosper.

Llina Paola's main customers are in San Andrés, the island where she was born, and also in Valledupar, Sincelejos and Cartagena.  These last three places are cities on the north coast of Colombia.  In order to carry out her business, Llina did a lot of preparation work since it is necessary to know the make-up of her products, their effects and, above all, to keep track of the impact that they have on her customers.  Llina's dynamism, discipline and concentration on her goal enabled her to move from supplying a domestic and informal market where she only sold to family members and neighbors, to selling products to a more active market which extends to other cities, in a more formal way.  Llina dreams of perfecting her business and owning a sales location in shopping malls, so that she can have access to more customers.  Her biggest challenge is acquiring the capital to do this but Llina knows very clearly what she wants and so it is very probable that she will manage to achieve her aspirations.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta U. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Crisanta is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Crisanta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies for her poultry house. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Crisanta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies for her poultry house.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan is married to Mr. Soem. Both of them are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice for their own family and to sell. They are also chicken breeders. They support a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. In order to improve their living conditions, they want to start a new business. They need some money to support this business. Mrs. Yan is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Mme Adjovi est mère de 02 enfants, mariée à un militaire, elle est âgée de 46ans et réside à Adidogomé (un quartier environ 09km de la ville de Lomé). Elle est dans cette activité (eau  minérale en sachet et  vente de jus de fruits) depuis 1981. Elle achète les matières premières à Lomé, à Kara (430km de Lomé) et à Bassar et revend après transformation en jus de bissap, citron, à toutes personnes et surtout aux écoliers. Elle veut ce premier prêt pour acheter 02 sacs de sucre, 06 sacs de bissap, et des sachets d’eau minérale. Elle a une ambition mettre les jus en bouteille plastique pour  revendre dans les autres pays.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjovi is a mother of two and married to a serviceman; she is 46 years old and resides in Adidogome (a neighborhood about five miles from the city of Lome). She has been in this business (pouches of mineral water and sale of fruit juice) since 1981. She purchases her ingredients in Lome, Kara (270 miles from Lome), and Bassar, and resells after transformation to "jus de bissap" (a hibiscus flower tea) with lemon to a variety of customers, mostly schoolchildren. She wants this first loan to purchase two bags of sugar, six bags of bissap, and mineral water pouches. Her ambition is to prepare juice in plastic bottles to resale in other countries.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, bissap (hibiscus flowers), lemons and pouches of mineral water

loans.name: Dakan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, les sept femmes du groupe Dakan ont en moyenne 36 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le marché Médine de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de charbon de bois, de bois e chauffe, d’habits, de la friperie, du riz et du pain. 
Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 9ème  cycle de prêt solidaire. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Madame Fatoumata compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux ballons d’habits de la friperie au grand marché de Ségou.. La revente se fait en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, en ambulant dans les différents quartiers et de façon fixe au marché Médine, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif d’ouvrir un magasin de vente d’habits de la friperie.
texts.en:
The majority married in monogamous families, the seven women of the Dakan group are on average 36 years old with six children. They live in the Angoulême district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They are acquainted through marriage, kinship, and business associations at the Médine market in Ségou. The group's members do business in charcoal, firewood, clothing (new and used), rice, and bread. 

In order to pay for supplies in cash, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso; they are on their ninth group loan. The previous loans have been fully repaid.

Madame Fatoumata plans to use her loan to buy two bales of used clothing at the big market in Ségou. She resells door-to-door, as an itinerant vendor, and at a stall in the Médine market; her customers are both male and female, and she sells for cash and credit. 

Madame Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 29,000 CFA with this loan. This will be reinvested in the business and used for occasional household expenses. Her goal is to open a second-hand clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene  66  años de edad, él es casado tiene 2  hijos.  Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope en donde   cuenta con servicios de agua, pero no de energía eléctrica el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

Carlos se dedica a la comercialización de animales en especial de ganado  porcino y caprino los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres hace varios años es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro, durante este tiempo, el realiza sus ventas en los caseríos de Mórrope y también realiza entregas desde su domicilio. En todos estos años Carlos ha adquirido clientela fija para su negocio.  Además con ingresos adicionales producto de la agricultura

Carlos  está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000  para hacer un mejoramiento en el interior y exterior de su casa, pues necesita realizar unos acabados para que pueda contar con seguridad y comodidad en su hogar.

Carlos desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas eferencias, las personas que lo conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Carlos is 66 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in his own home in the rural section of the District of Mórrope. This area receives running water, but no electricity since it is a small community of approximately 200 families.

Carlos sells animals, especially pigs and goats. The animals are raised in pens located behind his house. Carlos learned this trade from his parents and has been in business for several years. He is known for being a perfectionist in his job. Throughout this time, he has conducted sales in the villages of Mórrope and has also sold animals from his home. Over the years, Carlos has acquired an established customer base for his business. He also earns income from farming.

Carlos is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can make improvements to the interior and exterior of his house. He needs to complete some of the finishing touches so that his home will be secure and comfortable.

Carlos wants to improve his quality of life through effort and work. He has good references. The people who know him describe him as a peaceful and responsible person.

loans.use: to complete the interior and exterior finishes of his house.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, eggs, bread & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 50 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 15 and 25. She sells milk, juice, bread and so on in her supermarket. Athanasie's business is well-organized and she works from 7am until 10pm every day. She has 20 years of experience.
Athanasie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her business by buying more foodstuffs, such as soft drinks, to sell. With her profits, Athanasie will save to pay for her children's school fees and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to increase her business by buying more bread, juice and milk.

loans.name: Edith Irma

texts.es:
Edith es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando.  Edith estudió hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.
Actualmente se dedica a  la venta de chanchos,  trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cuatro ciclos, su primer préstamo  fue por la suma  de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de afrecho, negocio que tenía anteriormente.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro chanchos.  La señora trabaja sola, su esposo realiza servicio en mototaxi (transporte).
Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, sacar profesional a sus hijos y tener un futuro mejor.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the Community Bank "Virgen de la Asunción", which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Department of Puno.  She is 33 years old and married with 4 children who are at school.  Edith studied until the third year of secondary education.

Edith currently works selling pigs.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four lending cycles.  Her first loan was for the sum of 500 New Soles, the money was invested in the purchase of bran animal food for a business that she had previously.

With this new loan of 500 New Soles, she will buy four pigs.  The Señora works on her own, as her husband has a mototaxi service (transportation).

Her dream is to improve the quality of life for her family, turn her children into professionals, and have a better future.

What she likes about the Community Bank loan is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: to buy four pigs.

loans.name: Malaka Kavling 2 Group

texts.en: Syamsuryawati is 40 years old with 4 children. She has a grocery store in front of her house. She started this business last year. She sells primary daily groceries like rice, eggs, flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. She is borrowing 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for adding items in her grocery store. She is happy because she can help her family to increase its income. In the future she wants to expand her grocery store and be a distributor for other grocery stores around her home.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, eggs, flour, etc for sale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. She has a retail shop that sells fish such as sardines, mackerel & milk fish. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Fe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
29-year-old Elyn is a married woman from the town of Banga, in the province of South Cotabato. She has a 9-year-old child.

Elyn has been a farmer for more than 10 years. She helps her husband plant rice and corn at their farm. They usually sell their harvest to rice traders in the town and earn about 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month from farming.

Elyn has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, 7 sacks of rice seed, and 4 liters of insecticide. She hopes for the farming business to be stable. She also hopes for her child to finish college someday.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer, 7 sacks of rice seed, and 4 liters of insecticide

loans.name: Aramis

texts.es: Aramis  de 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en las edad de 4 meses y 2 hijastros el mayor de ellos tiene 20 años;  allí se dedica a la elaboración de desinfectantes y productos de aseo, oficio que aprendió siendo empleado de una fábrica que elaboraba productos de aseo para el hogar; de aquí sacó todo su conocimiento y experiencia de negocio, para en el futuro iniciar su propia aventura empresarial. En ella le ha ido muy bien y quiere hacerla crecer, pero tiene un gran desafío y es el de tener un capital de trabajo suficiente,  para producir y ampliar su mercado, que cada día se expande y exige mas. Su meta es distribuir los productos en la zona sur de Cartagena y ampliar su cobertura en la zona norte, donde está su nicho de mercado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su crcedikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas para fabricar productos de aseo, inversión exitosa porque está justificada en la demanda de su mercado y en su potencial de expansión al sur de la ciudad,  donde aun no ha incursionado. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y también requiere financiar su cartera para responder a nuevos clientes y dar un nuevo aire a su negocio, que seguramente con la inyección de capital de trabajo de su credikiva se oxigenará.
texts.en:
Aramis is 30 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias with his wife and three children, who range in age from 4 months to the stepchildren who are 20.  He earns his livelihood by making disinfectants and cleaning products.  Aramis learned this trade while he was employed at a factory that manufactures household cleaning products.  He used all of his knowledge and experience from this business to start his own venture.  Aramis has done very well and now wants to make his business grow, but his greatest challenge is having enough capital to increase production and expand his market, which is growing more each day.  His goal is to distribute his products in the southern part of Cartagena and to expand his coverage in the northern areas where he already has a niche market.  

For this reason Aramis is applying for a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the money to buy raw materials for making cleaning products.  A successful investment is justified because of the demand in his market and the potential expansion into the southern part of the city where he has yet to enter.  His sales are conducted on credit, so he also needs to fund his reserves so that he can respond to new customers and breathe new life into his business.  With his Kiva loan, Aramis can confidently inject new operating capital into his venture.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making cleaning products.

loans.name: Chariya

texts.en: Chariya is a grocery seller earns $5 per day. Her husband is working in the factory earns $3 per day. they have one child, he is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on rent house fee, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work. She wants to buy more kind of goods to sell in her small grocery store when she could make good income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband traveling to work

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years of age, married and has three children. To improve her family's household income, Gemma sells frozen foods in their communities. She earns about 500 PHP a week.

Gemma plans to use this loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more frozen foods such as hot dogs, chicken, and "tocino" to sell in their village. She wants to generate more income so she will be able to save for her family's needs.

In the future, she dreams to open her own frozen foods shop in their village to make her more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods such as hot dogs, chicken, and tocino.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 53 years old and  married. He has been living and working in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He comes from a big family. 

Sok and his wife are involved in cultivating rice for their livelihood. They work on their inherited farm. Together, they typically earn about $7.50 per day to support their living and household expenses. 

Sok is requesting a loan from HKL,  a Kiva partner, which he will use to pay laborers harvesting his rice crops. In the future, he wishes to expand his farmland and generate more rice production in order to raise his family from poverty.

loans.use: to pay for laborers harvesting his rice crops.

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es: El señor Francisco, 56 años de edad, originario de  Corinto municipio de Chinandega, pero vive en León, es padre de tres hijos, de los cuales dos son profesionales y el ultimo esta cursando el tercer año de la secundaria. El es comerciante, tiene un humilde establecimiento de auto lavado, donde con sus propias manos y herramientas manuales lava carros , es muy servicial , atento a pesar que su local no es un sitio nada lujoso ni con comodidades modernas para lavar autos es buscado por taxis y vehículos privados para que el les haga la limpieza semanal,  el antes de tener este negocio era chofer de vehículos privados esto lo hizo por mas de 30 años y conoce de mantenimiento y limpieza da autos , es por ello que sus clientes lo buscan para solicitarle sus servicios, ya tiene dos años con este negocio, y lo puso por la falta de trabajo en la que estaba y sobre todo porque todavía le falta un hijo por preparar pues el quiere que sea un profesional al igual que sus hermanos así que por ello busca la manera de sacar adelante a su familia de manera honrada y digna. El requiere el préstamo para comprar aspiradora, manguera, desinfectantes, jabones, toallas, spray aromáticos para realizar, cera para carros, que son parte de las herramientas de  limpieza de los autos  las cuales el necesita para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, pues el desea poder tener una mejor infraestructura de su negocio, pintarlo, ponerle piso para poder ser mas atractivo a los clientes y salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
56-year-old Francisco is originally from Corinto, in Chinandega, but he lives in León.  He is the father of three children.  Two of his children are professionals and the youngest is in his third year of high school.  Francisco has a humble car-wash establishment where, with his own hands and manual tools, he washes cars.  He is very obliging and attentive, despite the fact that his establishment is not at all fancy and doesn't have modern conveniences for washing cars.  He is used by taxi drivers and private vehicle owners who have him carry out their weekly clean.  Before he had this business, he was a driver of private vehicles.  He did this work for more than 30 years and knows how to maintain and clean cars.  For this reason, his customers seek him out to request his services.  He has had this business for two years and he set it up because he didn't have a job and, above all, because he still has one child to support who wants to become a professional, like his siblings.  For this reason, Francisco looked for a way to support his family in an honest and decent manner.

Francisco needs this loan to buy a vacuum cleaner, hose, disinfectants, soaps, towels and aromatic sprays to clean and wax cars.  These are some of the cleaning tools that he needs to provide his customers with a better service.  He would like to be able to have better infrastructure in his business, painting it and laying some flooring, so that it can be more attractive to his customers and help him to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner, hose, disinfectants, soaps, towels and aromatic sprays for cleaning and waxing cars

loans.name: Tambuka Group

texts.fr:
Odette est une commerçante âgée de 32ans qui habite la localité de Mumuri de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis 3 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 9e année secondaire. Elle est mariée a Faustin et ont ensemble 5 enfants dont 3étudient a l’école primaire. 
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes à revendre  afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices et accroitre ses économies. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tambuka»
texts.en:
Odette is a 32-year-old merchant who lives in the town of Mumuri in Gitega Province, in the middle of the country. She has been doing commerce in bananas for three year. She is also a farmer. 

Odette has attended school and reached the 9th grade. She is married to Faustin. Together they have five children, of whom three are in primary school. 

The Kiva loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that she obtained has enabled her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas to resell, so as to make a large profit and to increase her savings. 

She is a member of the community group "Tambuka".

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children both of whom go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (her sisters). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

Winfred sells second-hand clothes in a shop on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and also to start importing second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Vanessa Katherine

texts.es:
Vanessa tiene 23 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijas, vive con el esposo y con las dos hijas gemelas de 4 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC LUCHANDO JUNTOS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Zapotal nuevo, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a Labores Comerciales en su mayoría.
 
Vanessa se dedica a realizar quehaceres domésticos y a la agricultura hace 5 años atrás, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para el mejoramiento del sembrío, comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas, abonos. Con la ayuda del préstamo obtendrá un buen beneficio.

El sueño es poder comprarse una casa, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en la agricultura.

En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 23, lives in a common law relationship and has two daughters.  She lives with her husband and two twin four-year-old daughters in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

The “Luchando Juntos” communal bank is located in Recinto Zapotal Nuevo that belongs to Ventanas Canton; most of the members are involved in commercial activities.

Vanessa has been doing domestic chores and farming for the last five years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.

She’s asking for the loan to improve her crops; with help from the loan she’ll obtain a good benefit.

Her dream is to be able to buy a house; she’s had no type of problem.  In her free time she likes to watch television.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, insecticides, and compost

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es:
La señora Ancelma  se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace cinco años, ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es hacer tortas y prepara el mole para los tamales.
Tiene  la cantidad de  tres hijos Isabel de treinta y dos años de edad, Carlos Damián de treinta años de edad y José Luis de veinte ocho años de edad.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de hojas de plátano y maíz para la elaboración de masa, chile, tomate, manteca y cebollas para la elaboración de tamales.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado  para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ancelma has sold tamales for a living for five years now.  She tells us that what she likes most about her business is making tortas and preparing the mole for her tamales.

She has three children: Isabel, who is 32 years old, Carlos Damián, who is 30 years old, and José Luis, who is 28 years old.  

She asked for this loan to buy banana leaves and corn to make masa, and chilies, tomatoes, lard, and onions to make tamales.

She thanks the Foundation for the help it has given her to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She has been in active farming for 10 years besides running a carpentry shop in the local market. She is married with four children, three of whom are of school-going age. Her farm produces maize, milk and vegetables that are sold to the local market.

She has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use her income for increasing her dairy business to four dairy cows, and also to buy a motorcycle to supply her produce to the market. 

Margaret laments of rampant animal diseases and the shortage of feeds during dry seasons as the major farming challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахиму 23 года, он еще не женат. Живет со своей матерью. Отца рано потеряли, и их вырастила их мать. Мать раньше торговала на рынке зеленью, со временем она перешла на овощи и фрукты. Возраст и погодные условия не позволяли часто выходить на торговлю. Абдурахим помогал с сестрой торговать матери. Сестра вышла замуж, он остался один с матерью. Теперь полностью контролирует семейный бизнес. У нас кредит получил впервые, раньше товар привозил в рассрочку.  А сейчас перед новым годом ему необходимо привезти товар на наличные, потому что так дешевле и быстрее получить товар.
texts.en: Abdurahim is 23 years old and not yet married.  He lives with his mother.  His father died early, and his mother raised him.  His mother previously sold herbs at a market and then transitioned to selling fruits and vegetables.  Her age and weather conditions did not allow her to work often, so Abdurahim and his sister helped their mother with the sales.  The sister got married, and he was left alone with his mother.  Now, he fully controls the family business.  Abdurahim obtained a loan from us for the first time and previously bought his products in installments.  He currently needs cash to bring in products in anticipation of the New Year's holiday because it is cheaper and quicker to get products with cash.

loans.use: to purchase apples

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Besides a farming business, Mrs. Chan, 50, is a fish seller in a local market of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She generates an income of around $2.00 per day through this business. Presently she has four children, three of whom are living together with her in their home. 

Now it’s time for her to grow her dry-season rice again. And Mrs. Chan would like to ask for a loan from Kiva to purchase a plowing machine to progress well with her work. These funds will improve her farming business. For her future goal, Mrs. Chan intends to expand her farmland and increase her output for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to progress with her work.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, 48, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Banteay Mean Chey Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in an agricultural business for over twenty years and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. Two of her children are employed as garment workers in Thailand.

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Chet is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase fertilizer to use for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, she would be able to generate extra income from her agricultural business in the dry season to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business, renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use for growing rice in the dry season

loans.name: Pachamama Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACHAMAMA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por diez  integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Yolanda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de refrescos y gelatinas, venta de aji, venta de comida, venta de polleras y enaguas, venta de pan, tienda de barrio, venta de busos y guantes, venta y producción de guantes.

La señora Yolanda, indica que forma parte de una asociación comunal por primera vez, ingresando por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de gelatinas y frescos, que viene trabajando hace años. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de gelatina) mismos que adquirirá de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.

En la fotografía se puede identificar a dos socias que no aparecen totalmente, la señora Norah que se encuentra detras de la señora de sombrero verde y la señora Juana que se ubica en el costado derecho y solo aparese medio cuerpo.
texts.en:
The “PACHAMAMA” communal bank will start its first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch Regional Office. It is made up of ten members and they have a board of directors, at the head of which is Yolanda. 

The businesses that the members of the bank undertake are varied, amongst which we have: sale of soft drinks and gelatine desserts, sale of aji (chilli), sale of food, sale of traditional Andean skirts and underskirts, sale of bread, a neighborhood shop, sale of thick pants for winter and gloves, and the sale and manufacture of gloves. 

Yolanda, who says that this is the first time she is part of a communal bank, joins upon the invitation of a member. Today she has a business selling gelatine desserts and soft drinks, which she has been doing for many years. 

The credit from this loan cycle is to extend the range of own merchandise (purchase of gelatine desserts) which she will obtain in the city of El Alto and then, once they are made, she will sell her merchandise during fiestas. This style of working enables her to support her family, given that she is married and has five children. 

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health aspect.

In the photograph, two members who aren't fully visible can be identified: Norah who is found behind the woman with the green hat and Juana who is found on the right-hand side and you can only see half of her body.

loans.use: to buy gelatine desserts.

loans.name: Las Flores Del Maguey Group

texts.es: Las Flores del Maguey es un grupo solidario conformado por 3 integrantes, mujeres que luchan para poder progresar perla garcia es una mujer de 46 años, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 15 años de edad y vive en unión libre, perla se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. a ella le ayudaría mucho el credito de 4000 cordobas en comprar mas frutas de las granjas cercanas para vender, su sueno es comprar un solar para construir la casa. La otra integrante del grupo es esmeralda que también vende frutas en el mercado.
texts.en: Las Flores del Maguey es un grupo solidario conformado por 3 integrantes, mujeres que luchan para poder progresar perla garcia es una mujer de 46 años, tiene 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 15 años de edad y vive en unión libre, perla se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. a ella le ayudaría mucho el credito de 4000 cordobas en comprar mas frutas de las granjas cercanas para vender, su sueno es comprar un solar para construir la casa. La otra integrante del grupo es esmeralda que también vende frutas en el mercado.

loans.use: para comprar frutas y verduras para vender

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock.

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil is a resident of Beylagan town. He started his private business in 2004. As most private businesses in town he began selling foodstuffs. As for the capital he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed four loans. Now he owns a food store and he needs new loan to increase the stock of goods and working capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is 40 years old and lives in District 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and has five children. She took a loan from AFS to help her buy sheep and other materials for her business of animal husbandry. She is an uneducated woman. She wants to continue practicing animal husbandry. Her husband sells the sheep at the bazaar. The business allows her to make her familys livelihood better because it adds income.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a welding machine for her business

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor has a little business selling baked goods and chocolate at the Central market in Kherson, Ukraine. An experienced entrepreneur, he has been selling for eight years and has been successful offering good quality products for low prices. Igor supports his family of four with his venture - he and his wife, Elena, have a nine year old son and a six year old daughter.

Igor currently has two sales locations for his business, one of which is in a good location that gives him an edge in selling his products. Igor has requested a loan of $1000 so that he can purchase new food inventories to stock his kiosks. This is Igor’s third loan with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to more opportunities to assist him with his business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
DOLORES sells bread door-to-door in her community. She is 66 years old, has 8 children and is a widow. She is a member of the Santiago 1 group along with María Díaz Ruiz (fruit and vegetable sales), Marta Juárez Laguna (fruit sales), Dionisia Ruiz Vásquez (tamale sales). They hope to invest the loan to increase sales and, thus, earn more profits to help their budget.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

DOLORES, se dedica a hacer pan y lo vende de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad, tiene 66 años, tuvo 8 hijos y actualmente está viuda. Pertenece al grupo Santiago 1 junto con doña María Díaz Ruiz (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Marta Juárez Laguna (venta de frutas) y doña Dionisia Ruiz Vásquez (venta de tamales).Ellas esperan invertir sus préstamos en incrementar la compra de sus productos y así lograr obtener mas ganancias que beneficien su presupuesto.

loans.use:
BREAD SALES

VENTA DE PAN

loans.name: Apessi

texts.fr:
Born in Tékponou, Ms. Apessi A. is a 45-year-old mother of five (5) children. She sells cola nuts and skillfully manages her income-generating business. To maximize her profit, she would like to go herself to production areas to buy the cola nuts. As she lacks the financial means to do so, she is requesting a loan of $200. Once she accomplishes this dream, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and in particular to send her children to school.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Tékponou, Madame A. Apessi est âgée de 45 ans et est mère de cinq (5) enfants. Vendeuse de cola, elle maîtrise très bien son activité génératrice de revenu. Pour maximiser son profit, elle veut aller elle-même s’approvisionner dans les zones de production. Nécessitant des moyens financiers, elle vient solliciter $200. une fois ce rêve réalisé, elle envisage améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cola nuts

loans.name: Viviane

texts.en: Viviane is a 25-year-old young woman. Viviane owns a clothing store, and she needs to purchase new merchandise for her business. This is the 3rd time Viviane has asked for a loan from A. Majmoua. Viviane is an independent and ambitious micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Señora Hortencia belongs to the communal bank called 'Guadalupe' located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 42 years old and she's separated from her husband. She has one son who still depends on her financially. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small business selling sodas/refreshments.

She currently sells sodas/refreshments and she also runs a small office for local routes for three-wheeled motocarros. She gets up about 6:00 am to prepare breakfast for her son and she then goes to the office to sell refreshments and to take care of her routing business.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will invest it in her routing business and she will purchase 25 boxes of soda/drinks and beer.

Hortencia is very happy with the support she gets from Manuela Ramos since she's able to take care of herself and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia pertenece al banco comunal Guadalupe ubicado en Jr. Puno 355, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años es separada y madre de un hijo que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de venta de gaseosas y una línea de concesión de rutas para motocarros. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. a preparar el desayuno de su hijo y luego se dedica a la venta de sus gaseosas y a la atención de su oficina. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el pago de una cuota de concesión de rutas para motocarros y en la compra de 25 cajas de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Hortencia se siente muy satisfecha con el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda ya que puede valerse por si misma y puede trabajar de manera independiente.

loans.use: To invest in her routing business and to buy refreshments

loans.name: Yuldash

texts.en:
K. Yuldash is 40 years old. He is married with three children.

Yuldash is purchasing and selling animals. He has been in the business for 20 years. Currently he has 2 donkeys that he uses for transporting hay and the fodder for animals, 1 horse that he uses for plowing the land, 10 cows, and 4 sheep. Yuldash purchases the animals in the central market of Dushanbe city and usually, one week later, is selling in the local market of his city.
