El socio tiene 35 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el realiza servicio de turismo y también servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el también lleva turistas a distintos lugares como Ollantaytambo, Chinchero y Machupicchu, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de turismo.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro para comprar algunos repuestos de carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Madres Trabajadoras" ("working mothers") community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is 35 years old and is married and has one child. The member alternates his daily activities with the transportation business. He provides a tourism service and also a taxi service. He works from 7AM until 6PM. He also takes tourists to different places like Ollantaytambo, Chinchero and Machupicchu. The member wishes to improve his tourism service. The member requests the loan to maintain his car and to buy some car parts.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain his car and to buy some car parts.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a palm-oil extractor. She also prepares millet porridge and serves them with doughnuts and bread in Abura. She has received a senior-high education.  She is divorced and takes care of six dependents. She has been in this trade for 24 years. She feeds, clothes and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales. 

Her loan will be used to buy millet, flour, sugar, pepper and other ingredients to prepare the porridge for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy millet, flour, sugar, pepper and other ingredients to prepare the porridge for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 26 years old and engaged to be married. Her future husband is a soldier. Grace is a tailor and sells different traditional fabrics to make "bitenge" (African tunics) with different color patterns. She has been doing this for 11 years and her business has enabled her to develop herself. Grace is requesting a loan to buy more fabrics in order to make more profits to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married women with three children.  She lives in the city of Hato Mayor. This is a rural area where agricultural activities are common. 

She is dedicated to raising pigs. She takes care of them from the time the mother is pregnant until they are ready to be sold. She sells the pigs after they are grown, some for meat and other to reproduce. She has been running this business for four years. 

Maria has taken out two loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past year, both of which have been paid back in full. She has used these loans to expand her business.

Her most difficult challenge is to be sure that her children live a Christian life, according with Jesus' will. She really enjoys working and taking care of her family. She thanks all of you for supporting her dream to change her life and give her family a better kind of living.

loans.use: to buy pig food.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rocio; la socia tiene 30 años de edad, la socia es casada; La socia tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura como actividad principal, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz blanco de primera, el cual es llevado a Urubamba el valle sagrado al por mayor para la venta, también se dedica al comercio la socia elabora comidas caseras y las vende en su pensión, la socia es muy conocida en el poblado y siempre la visitan para saborear sus ricos y diversos potajes, la socia también cría animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, una ves estos engordados y algo maduros son llevados a las ferias y vendidos al por mayor y menor. La socia desea dar una muy buena calidad de vida a sus menores hijitos y por ello trabaja mucho para poder darles lo que necesitan y ahorrar para sus estudios. La socia desea invertir en la compra de animales menores al por mayor como gallinas doble pechugas  y engordarlas para la venta, otra parte del crédito desea invertirlo en la compra de maíz blanco para la nueva siembra y arroz, aceite al por mayor para su pensión restaurante.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rocío, 30, is a member of the “Reyna de Los Angeles de Urquillos” communal bank located in Urquillos District in Calca Province and Cusco Department.

She’s married and has three children.  Her main activity is agriculture; she plants top grade white corn which is then taken to Urubamba in the Sacred Valley to be sold at wholesale.  She’s also a merchant.  She prepares home-cooked meals to sell.  She’s very well known in the town and is always visited to enjoy her delicious and diverse stews.  She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs which, once fattened and mature, are taken to the markets to be sold at wholesale and retail.  

She would like to give her little children a better quality of life and this is why she works so much to be able to give them what they need and to save up for their education.

She wants to invest in the purchase of small farm animals at wholesale, like double breasted chickens, to fatten up to sell.  Another portion of the loan is to buy white corn for the new planting season and rice and oil at wholesale for her daily meal restaurant.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in her various businesses.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa, age 51, owns and operates a shop where she buys and sells coconuts for the preparation of copra. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have three children.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 in order to buy coconuts to sell for making copra. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell for making copra

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond  lives in the Philippines.  He is 34 years old and married with 2 children. 
Raymond has a shop that sells snacks, noodles, detergents & beverages. He has been running this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Raymond is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future,Raymond hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for his store.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is a responsible father and has a great plan for his family. He is 53 years old and has 8 children. He aims to continue sending all of his children to school because it is the only valuable thing he can give to them. Rice farming is the main source of their income. Despite the hardships of life, he still has the strong determination to pursue the business.

Jaime wants to increase his production in order to increase his income. This will help to satisfy his family's basic needs and support the education of his children. He asks for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings. He hopes to increase his yields this cropping season. He believes that patience and hard work will enable him to achieve these goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Victor Grabiel

texts.es:
Víctor de 21 años, vive con su esposa en casa de sus suegros, cuenta  con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza porla agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Víctor se dedica a la reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos, a colocado su taller mecánico en la casa de sus suegros,cuenta con su propia clientela, ya que para ese rubro no hay competencia en la zona donde vive, todos los días atiende y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias de la casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de respuestos y lubricantes para que venda en su taller, con la finalidad de que tenga mayor cantidad de clientes para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Víctor es un joven que trata de salir adelante por sus propios medios, deseando que todo le vaya bien para que su negocio crezca y logre sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
21-year-old Víctor lives with his wife in his in-laws' home.  The only service the house receives is electricity.  It is located in the rural part of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for its farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Víctor repairs and services vehicles.  He has set up his vehicle repair shop at his in-laws' and has his own customer base.  There is no competition to his business in the area in which he lives.  Every day he serves his customers and, with the income that he makes, he is able to cover his household's daily needs.

Víctor has requested a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy spare parts and lubricants to sell in his vehicle repair shop.  His aim is to attract more customers so that he can repay his loan and improve his quality of life.  Víctor is ayoung man who tries to get ahead in life through his own means.  He would like everything to go well so that his business grows and he is able to achieve the goals he has set for himself.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants to sell in his vehicle repair shop

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 43 years old and married. He lives in the rural area of Isabela, where he is busy in his hog business, raising pigs to sell later on at the local market in his town. He also works as a farmer for additional income to provide for the needs of his family. 

Danilo is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs, to have quality meat. He dreams that when he sells his pigs in the future he'll be able to construct a house to have a convenient home for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her family's needs. Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business.

Maria is 52-years-old and married to a responsible man. The couple has been blessed with nine children. She has been running her hog raising business for two years and earned about PHP 2,500 per piglet. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional stocks of feed and vaccine to sustain her hog-raising business. Maria is thankful because her income has been increasing.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of feed and vaccine for her hogs.

loans.name: Arman Junio

texts.en:
Arman is married and has 5 children. Arman is 39 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He owns and manages his own bakery to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, he earns PHP 12,000 doing this work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase bread flour and other bread making ingredients.
 
Arman has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Arman hopes to improve and expand his business so that he can have bakeries in other barangays (villages). He plan to have branch.

loans.use: to purchase bread flour and other bread making ingredients.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.es:
Jeffrey tiene 32 años es casado, vive con su mujer en Otavalo que se encuentra en la provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. Se describe como una persona luchadora y muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante todos los días.

Jeffrey trabaja solo en su casa en la elaboracion de artesanías como son las flautas de madera (tunda). Es el segundo crédito que solicita a Fodemi el mismo que se va a invertir en la compra de tubos de madera (tunda) que es la materia prima para la elaboración de flautas, esto le ayudará a que su producción aumente lo que generará un buen número de ventas y sus ingresos se incrementarán lo cual le ayudará para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder tener una familia y un buen taller propio para compartir sus habilidades con las demás personas.
texts.en: Jeffrey is 32 years old and married. He lives with his wife in Otavalo, in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador. He describes himself as a tenacious and very hard-working person who enjoys getting ahead in life every day. Jeffrey works alone at home making handicrafts such as flutes. This is the second loan that he has requested from Fodemi and he will invest it in buying wood cane (tunda) which is the raw material he uses in making his [traverse] flutes. This will help him to increase his production and make a good number of sales. His income will increase, which will help him to improve his quality of life. Jeffrey's dream is to be able to have a family and to have a good workshop of his own so that he can share his skills with other people.

loans.use: to buy wood cane (tunda), a raw material for making flutes

loans.name: Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Juboo a été crée depuis le 10/octobre 2010 il est composé de 11 membres issus du meme groupement et habitant le meme village. 

Madame Waly Tew est la responsable de ce groupe elle est marié et mère d un enfant .Elle s active dans le petit commerce plus précisément dans la vente de tissu de produits détergents et comme activité secondaire elle fait de l'embouche porcine.Elle est debout sur la droite de la photo habillé en vêtement rose.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité.

Avec ses bénéfices elle compte acheter des habits pour son enfant et payer des médicaments pour ce dernier en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Juboo Group was established on October 10, 2010. It is made up of 11 members coming from the same group and living in the same village.

Mrs. Waly Tew is responsible for the group. She's the one standing on the right in the photograph, wearing a pink outfit.

She's married and the mother of one child. Her business consists in selling fabrics and detergents. As a secondary business, she also raises pigs. 

She has a good experience in her field of activity. With her profits, she intends to buy clothes for her child, as well as medication in case of sickness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, detergents, and pigs

loans.name: Kifayat

texts.en: Kifayat is a 46-year-old woman who has been engaged in bee-keeping for the last ten years.  She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her husband in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  She sells honey of high quality and this is a very profitable business but it also requires a lot of effort to make good honey.  Kifayat applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase better bee hives and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bee hives for her business.

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia se vera ampliamente beneficiada con el otorgamiento del crédito ya que con el podrá surtir su pequeño negocio de abarrotes al que le están haciendo falta diferentes tipos de mercancía que es fruta, verdura y productos de lactios.
Doña Nidia es madre soltera tiene dos hijos por los cuales se ha esforzado mucho para salir adelante; la señora Nidia inicio como comerciante hace ya once años con la finalidad de poder darle buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Siempre ha contado con el apoyo y la ayuda de su madre con quien vive actualmente.
texts.en:
Nidia has benefited amply from past loans, enabling her to supply her small grocery business. But it presently lacks certain kinds of merchandise, including fruit, vegetables, and dairy products.

Nidia is a single mother with 2 children and she has made great efforts for their advancement. Nidia became a merchant some 11 years ago in order to offer a good quality of life to her children. She has always been able to count on the help and aid of her mother with whom she lives at present.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, and dairy products for her small grocery business.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tamales, vive con sus cuatro hijos, ella busco una alternativa para crear ingresos para el hogar, por eso inicio con el negocio de los tamales hace 4 años, aprendiendo por iniciativa propia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, aceite, papas, pollo, verduras, para tener así los ingredientes necesarios, en una cantidad considerable, que le permita preparar sus ventas por algunas semanas.
Ella espera que esta inversión le ayude para fortalecer sus ventas y estabilizar su condición económica.
texts.en:
María sells tamales. She lives with her four children. María was looking for an alternative to generate household income, so she decided to start a tamale business four years ago. She learned this business on her own.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy corn, oil, potatoes, chicken, and vegetables so that she will have a considerable amount of necessary ingredients. This will allow her to prepare the food that she sells for a few weeks. She hopes that this investment will help strengthen her sales and stabilize her financial condition.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, potatoes, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Salvacion has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Salvacion has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Salvacion hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Leonor tiene 53 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella se dedica a diferentes actividades económicas como venta de chicha, crianza de animales menores y venta de jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Leonor requiere el préstamo para comprar más jora y comprar gallinas.  
 
Leonor es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Leonor was born in the province of Urubamba but lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja.  This town is located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba and department of Cusco, Peru.

Leonor is 53 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has five children.  She works in different economic activities such as selling "chicha" [a corn beverage], raising small farm animals, and selling "jora" [fermented corn].  She has been working in these businesses for several years now and it is going very well for her.  Now she needs the loan to buy more jora and to buy chickens.

Leonor is a member of the Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja group, made up of 19 members who live in the village of Rumichaca Baja where they carry out their economic activities.

loans.use: to buy more fermented corn and chickens.

loans.name: Mushamukadzi Group

texts.en:
Rungamirai is a 57-year-old lady. She is married and has four children, ages 39, 37, 35, and 31 years, all no longer going to school. Besides her family, she also takes care of her grandchild.

She is in the agriculture business (poultry) in Masvingo. She is running the business with the help of her husband. She has been in business for over ten years and has no employees working for her. 

Rungamirai has requested a loan of $400 to buy more chicks and feed. With the extra cash from this business, she will be able to provide basic needs for her family. The challenge she faces in the business is high competition in the market. 

Rungamirai is planning to have a much bigger poultry project in the next five years so that she can employ at least a number of people in her community to ease their problems.

loans.use: to buy a stock of feed and chicks.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 46, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. He has been a construction foreman for over ten years and is successful in his career. Additionally, he is a motor taxi driver. His wife is a gardener. One of his children is employed as a construction worker. 

In order to improve his business, Sary is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more construction materials for use in his construction work. By doing so, he could run his business smoothly and generate more income for his family.  In the future, he would like to build a new house and support his children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more construction materials for his construction work.

loans.name: Mealea

texts.en:
Mealea, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples: Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey, etc.) She has been working in a weaving shop for over ten years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Her husband has been growing potatoes for over ten years as well, earning approximately USD 8 per day. 

Due to her difficulty in traveling, Mealea is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. In the future, she would like rebuild her present house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahire is an Internally Displaced Person(IDP) from the Armenian-occupied Fizuli region. Now she lives in Beylagan Ashigly and her family is engaged in cattle breeding. She has borrowed four times from theNormicro Beylagan branch. The proceeds from these  loans were used to increase the number of livestock. Now Tahire needs $1,200 to further increase the size of her family's herd.

loans.use: To increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry T. is forty years old and married with four children. He sells second-hand clothes in Magburaka town (Sierra Leone). Once a week he takes the clothes to village markets. His business is the only source of income for the family.

To diversify his business, Henry would like a loan to purchase four bales of children's and women's clothes. He says that there is a high demand for these clothes in nearby villages. Henry is dedicated to providing his family the best of life.

loans.use: Diversify his stock of used clothing

loans.name: Idalia Marleny

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Idalia Marleny and my main source of income is a clothing sales business. I'm a street vendor and I rely on sales of new clothes and footwear that I get on consignment. I've been selling clothes for 3 years and the business generates income that covers my family's expenses and payments to my suppliers. Thanks to the this business, I've improved my house and the comfort of my family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Idalia Marleny, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir con los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores. Gracias a las utilidades que persivo de este negocio he mejorado mi vivienda, logrando mayor comodidad para mi familia.

loans.use: Buy clothes for clothing sales business.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Mireya is married and has a 16-year-old daughter. Her husband is a construction worker, and she started her business because his salary couldn't cover the household expenses and she wanted to educate her daughter. So she decided to help her family out by opening her small convenience store 11 years ago, and little by little her business and her clientele grew. Now her product line has increased and she hopes to see continued growth.

Mireya is requesting a loan of $500 to invest in her business, specifically to enlarge the store to better accommodate her customers and increase her sales by offering new and varied products. She plans to repay the loan within three months. She and her family are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mireya esta casada y tiene una hija de 16 años, su esposo trabaja como albañil, ella empezó con su negocio por que con el sueldo de su esposo no cubrían los gastos familiares y quería brindarle educación a su hija, así que ella decidió ayudar a su esposo abriendo su pequeña tienda de abarrotes hace 11 años atrás vendiendo solo lo indispensable, y poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio y fue incrementando su cartera de clientes, ahora ya tiene más surtido y desea continuar con su crecimiento.

Mireya esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 500 para invertir en su negocio, específicamente ampliar su tienda para mayor comodidad para sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo nuevos y más variados productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Enlarge her convenience store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy threads and other materials she needs

loans.name: Munnawer

texts.en: My name is Munnawer A.. I am a mother of eight: four sons and four daughters. All of my children could not get an education due to our poor financial circumstances. I embroider clothes on order, and two of my sons are apprentices at a welder’s shop. By now they have gained enough expertise and therefore want to start their own business. We therefore require a loan of $175 for this purpose.

loans.use: Start a welding shop

loans.name: Nohemí

texts.es:
Several years ago, Nohemi, with the desire to learn to make clothes for herself, started to help her friend, who taught her how to make and design clothing. Slowly Nohemi became more and more involved in helping her friend. After realizing that she could put together clothing on her own, she started her own business which makes her able to help her husband with the expenses of their 4 children. Eight years ago she started first mending clothes and then totally producing them.

Thanks to her perseverance as a seamstress, she has been successful. That is the reason why she currently has several orders to make uniforms for schools near her home. She is requesting a loan of USD $375 that she will repay within six months. With this money, Nohemi will be able to buy fabric and materials to be able to make the uniforms and thus make money to be able to maintain her children in school. Her oldest is attending a university and Nohemi truly wishes that he continue his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Hace varios Años, que Noemí, con las ganas de aprender a fabricar ropa para ella. Comenzó a ayudarle a una amiga. Quien le enseñó todo lo que era necesario para poder elaborar y componer ropa. Poco a poco Nohemí se fue involucrando más y más a ayudarle a su amiga. Y después de darse cuenta que ella podía elaborar una prenda sola. Decidió comenzar su propio negocio que le permitiera poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de sus 4 hijos. Hace 8 años que comenzó primero a reparar prendas y después a fabricarlas en su totalidad.

Gracias a su empeño como costurera Nohemí ah tenido éxito. Es por eso que actualmente tiene varios pedidos de uniformes para unas escuelas que están por su casa. Es por eso que Nohemí está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Nohemí podrá comprar telas y material para poder elaborar sus uniformes y así poder sacar dinero para poder mantener a sus hijos estudiando. Puesto que Actualmente el mayor ya está en universidad y Nohemí desea que él siga estudiando.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the making of clothing.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru:
Mahmadali U. Rahmanovich lives in the Fayzabad region. He is 49 years old and is married. He has a college education. He is a history teacher by profession. He works at a local school but is also in the business of raising cattle. He purchases young calves, raises them and in 45 days resells them on the local market. This business is the only source of income for his family. He plans to use the money from the loan to purchase a calf, which will allow him to increase turnover. He plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Умаров Махмадали Рахмонович житель района Файзабад . Возраст 49 лет , женат .Имеет высшее образование ,по специальности преподаватель истории . Работает в местной школе учителем . Кроме того занимается животноводством .Покупает молодых бычков , откармливает и через 45 дней продает их на местном рынке . Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Планирует получить кредит на покупку бычка, что позволит ему увеличить оборот . Кредит планирует погасить в течении 12 месяцев .

loans.use: purchase a calf

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. prepares palm oil for sale. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She wants to increase production but lacks funding.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more oil palm fruit, which is the major raw material for the oil production.

loans.use: To buy more oil palm fruit to produce palm oil

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
She is married and the mother of 6 children. She sells her products in the big open-air market of Diourbel. Her business consists in buying locally grown fruit to retail, such as mangoes, oranges, bananas, and local cereals. She would like to reinforce this business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants, elle fait du commerce dans le grand marché de Diourbel. Cette activité consiste à acheter des fruits du pays pour les revendre au détail, comme les mangues, oranges, bananes et autres céréales locales pour renforcer ses activités.

loans.use:
to reinforce her business venture

Pour renforcer ses activités

loans.name: Binta

texts.en: Binta M. is 30 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells beans wholesale. She learned her trade on her own and started her business in 2001. She is very grateful in anticipation of her Kiva loan. She needs a loan of $875.00 to buy more bags of beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Born in Kpalimé November 10th, 1977, Mr. Anani M. is single and has one child. In 2003, he established Bar Horeb where he sells drinks and cell phone credit recharge cards. He is seeking his first loan to buy 45 cases of drinks and 50 recharge cards. He is requesting this loan to replenish his stock which is sold out.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Kpalimé la 10 novembre 1977, Monsieur M. Anani est célibataire avec un enfant. En 2003, elle a crée BAR HOREB dans lequel il vend des boissons et cartes de recharge. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 45 casiers de boissons et 50 cartes de recharge. Il fait cette demande son stock est épuisé et il voulait faire le réapprovisionnement.

loans.use: Purchase drinks and cell phone recharge cards

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria and her husband have a small business making rakes for tractors and with this income they support their children. They started the business when they purchased second-hand cars to take apart, providing the framework to start building rakes adaptable to tractors, and selling car parts to other workshops.

Gregoria needs a loan for 3000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (US$ 1075) to invest in a second car. Gregoira is a member of Las Hormigas Village Bank.

Greogia’s dream is to construct a home, to have a small store, and that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to invest in a second car

loans.name: Las Tigresas Group

texts.es:
The “Tigresas” Communal Bank was founded on January 23, 2006.  It is currently in its fifth cycle and the members incluD. 11 women and one man.  It is a communal bank comprised of people that live in the San Jerónimo district located 20 minutes from the city of Cusco.  They work offering agricultural products and services and selling food in the market.  The female members of the communal bank are mothers who contribute in an important way to the income of their family economic unit, combining their own activites at home with the businesses that they administer.  The credit that they receive allows them the possibility to contribute and to capitalize on the entrepreneurial initiatives that each one of them has to generate income and contribute to the family budget.  This aspect is of vital importance in their personal growth as women.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.


El banco comunal las “TIGRESAS”, se fundo el 23 D. enero del 2006, actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo 11 mujeres y 01 varón, es un banco comunal conformado por socias que viven en el distrito D. San Jerónimo ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco, las actividades económicas a las que se dedican son el comercio D. productos agrícolas  y servicios venta D. comidas dentro del mercado).
Las integrantes del banco comunal son madres D. familia que contribuyen D. manera importante con los ingresos D. la unidad económica familiar,  combinando actividades propias del hogar y los pequeños negocios que administran. Los créditos a los que acceden, les brinda la posibilidad D. contribuir y capitalizar las iniciativas emprendedoras que cada una D. ellas tiene para poder generar D. ingresos y contribuir al presupuesto familiar, aspecto que tiene vital importancia en el crecimiento personal como mujer.

loans.use: Working capital for the members' agricultural products and services businesses

loans.name: Mrs. Vath Vanna Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vath V., the Village Bank President in Preak Ta Ten Village in Kandal Province, is a rice farmer earning a small income to help support the household. Currently, insufficient funds prevent her from buying more rice seeds, so she is requesting a loan to be able to cultivate more rice. Vath is a 42-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

One member in this village bank has end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. This member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Christina A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Christina A. M. from Kyela. Married with seven children between the ages of 16 and 22, she is also responsible for supporting three orphans. Christina, who has been selling cocoa since 2007, works at her business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, assisted by her husband.

Currently earning about $70 each month from her business, she is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more fresh cocoa to resell. In the future, she plans to open a buying centre for her product. Christina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy fresh cocoa for resale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: MARGARITA CUENTA CON 59 AÑOS DE EDAD, ACTUALMENTE VIUDA, CON 5 HIJOS INDEPENDIENTES LA MISMA QUE CUENTA CON VIVIENDA PROPIA DOTADA DE SERVICIOS BASICOS. ELLA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE ARROZ EN CHALA PARA COMERCIALIZARLO PROCESADO Y CUENTA CON UNA VAGONETA QUE SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE DE PASAJEROS QUE LE GENERA RENTA DIARIA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDAS, CUENTA CON 12 AÑOS DEEXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, SIENDO LA ACTIVIDAD UNIFAMILIAR. DICHAS ACTIVIDADES TIENEN COMPETENCIA EN LA ZONA SIN EMBARGO SU EXPERIENCIA Y CONSOLIDACION EN EL MERCADO HACEN QUE TENGAN BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL CREDITO TIENE COMO DESTINO LA REPARACION DE SU VAGONETA YA QUE LA MISMA SUFRIO UN CHOQUE YA QUE LA MISMA ES UNA SUS PRINCIPALES HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO Y FUENTES DE INGRESOS. LA CLIENTE  CUENTA CON 8 CREDITOS EN LA INSTITUCION CON EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGOS Y TAMBIEN TIENE EXPERIENCIA EN OTRAS INSTITUICONES FINANCIERAS DONDE TAMBIEN CUENTA CON BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO.
texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old and is a widow. She has 5 children who now support themselves. She has her own home, equipped with basic services. She sells corn once it has been processed and also has a car that she uses to transport people. This gives her income during the week. On the weekend she sells food. She has 12 years of experience in these areas, and they have been a good source of income for her single family. There is a lot of competition in the activities she is involved in, but thanks to her experience she has been able to capture a lot of the market and therefore has high demand. This credit will be used to repair her car, because it was in an accident. Since the car is a principal source of income for Margarita, it is important that she repair it. Margarita has had 8 loans with excellent payment history. She has worked with other financial institutions where she also had a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Masci, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her car

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en: Mrs Bui Thi L.  lives in the Tan Huong commune, Ninh Giang district, Hai Duong province. She is 51 years old and has 2 children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2003. Her family’s main income is trading poultry.  For the next loan cycle, Mrs. L. is requesting a loan of 10 million VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: Invest in poultry business

loans.name: Souy

texts.en:
Souy P., 39, is a mother of two children who lives in Cheay Sbay Village in Kampong Thom Province. She raises pigs for sale and has a rice mill, charging a service fee for grinding rice for her villagers. She also cares for her mother.

P. started this business in 2000; her husband is a rice farmer. With their well-managed business, they both work hard every day to generate revenue. As another source of income, P. normally buys rice to grind for re-sale. With a view to improving her business, she now needs a loan to purchase rice to stock for re-sale; any remainder of the loan amount will be used for repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice to stock for re-sale

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona P. de 63 años de edad, está casada, con el Sr. Victorino Vera de 64 años, ellos tienen 3 hijos, todos son independientes y ya formaron su familia.

Doña Ramona comenzó con este negocio aproximadamente en el año 1.979, con el capital adquirido por la venta de un automóvil, empezó con una pequeña despensa que fue creciendo con el correr del tiempo, en la actualidad ya tienen su clientela formada, gracias a la buena atención y productos que ofrecen.

La Sra. Ramona invertiría este crédito para  comprar más mercaderías y así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramona P. is 63 years old and is married to Victorino Vera who is 64 years old. They have 3 children, all of whom are independent and have already started their own family. Ramona started this business approximately in the year 1979, with the capital acquired from the sale of an automobile. She began with a small pantry that grew with time. Currently, she has a solid clientele thanks to her good customer service and products that she offers. Ramona will invest this loan in buying more merchandise and in this way will offer more variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. Omar has been working as an aluminum installer for four years. He repairs doors and windows. Omar requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his business. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.

Omar is speciA. in his work because he does a clean, neat job. His clients are the people from his area. Omar decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Omar will use the loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.name: Leluna

texts.en:
Leluna has owned a small charcoal store in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for five years. She is part of the Kondoa group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal to sell in order to improve her business. She hopes that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Leluna is 25 years old, married, and has one 7-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: La Union De Los Vecinos 1 Group

texts.en:
The Bank of Hope, whose name is translated as The Neighbor's Union, is a new Bank recently formed in San Pedro de Macoris (southeast Dominican Republic). This will be their first micro loan in what they hope to be a successful endeavor to bring prosperity to their business activities. 
Bernabela B., the group coordinator, sells clothes. The items that have better sales are women's clothing, especially blouses and jeans. Bernabela has 6 children; three of them still live with her. They are 11, 16, and 14. She envisions her future as one where she will own her home and will run a successful boutique.
Most of the other group members also sell clothing. However, they don't feel like there's competition between them because they all have different clients. 
Please help us support this new group of entrepreneurs with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: purchase clothing items for resale.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
“Trusting God will always be of help,” said Felicitas A., a 59-year-old widow and resident of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She has four children: Wilma, Samson, Joel, and Leticia. Two of them graduated from a vocational course, while the other two were not able to finish their college education due to financial problems.

Felicitas and her husband used to manage their farm together to support their family. However, now she is the one solely maintaining their rice field to earn a living. Some of her children are helping her in cultivating their farm. Aside from rice, they also plant vegetables that they can sell in their neighborhood for extra income. Their income from farming is not enough to sustain their needs. As a solution, Felicitas is now requesting a loan of 13, 000 PHP that will serve as her business capital. She is hoping that she will able to increase their rice and vegetable production through financial assistance and with her strong faith and determination.

loans.use: To maintain her rice field and vegetable farm

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
My name is Zahida A. and my husband's name is Munir. We live in Kot Radha Kishan, a city famous for its sweetmeats and its festivals. My husband has a livestock business; he buys buffalos on order to sell to customers. People come to him to buy buffalos because he deals so well with his customers. 

Sometimes I get milk from the buffalo and sell the milk to the milk shops for a profit. I successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I'm applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand my husband's livestock business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for livestock business.

loans.name: Haytalah Group

texts.en:
Haytalah is the group leader of Haytalah group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money to purchase more materials for their businesses to make a good income for their families in future.

Haytalah wants to take a loan for his business as a jeweler and he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Hamaytalah wants to take a loan for his business as an electrician. Aziza wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. Malylah wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store. Khailada wants to take a loan for his tailoring business. They are very happy with this loan opportunity in Afghanistan.

loans.use: for his business as a jeweler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of African traditional cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari K., a forty year old trader, is married with four children who are all currently in school.

Selling used clothes has a very big market in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothes has created a business for many men and women.

Omari sells used men’s clothes like trousers, shirts, etc. He hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in his community. He wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase his inventory. He believes this loan will help him save for his children.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 49 years old. He is married and has 9 children. He is a farmer. He is hoping for a loan of N50, 000 to hire more laborers to clear his farm. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To hire more laborers.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B., 29 years old, is managing a 1 hectare rice field. She has one child and a supportive husband who also helps her manage the farm. Their harvest is intended for family consumption but, because they also need money to cover their daily expenses, they have decided to sell some of their grain to their neighbors.

Shirley is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will buy two sacks of potash, two bags of fertilizer and herbicides to support her farm. She is hopeful, and very optimistic, that her loan will result in a better harvest in the future. She likes CEVI because they offer very low interest rates (2% a month) to their clients. Aside from that, she receives training and insurance from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase potash, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en: K. David is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard-working man with many dreams to come true. He is a businessman with a business of selling green bananas from Mukono Central market. Before the loans, David only sold banana fingers but now also has bunches in his stock. He is grateful for the transformation that the loans have brought in his business and he sees the future is bright for him. He makes profit from his business, some of which he saves for business expansion and paying school fees for his 4 children. He bought a plot of land and he plans to construct a family house where his children and wife will find peace away from landlords. David needs a loan to help him buy more matooke (plantains) for resale.

loans.use: Buying more matooke (green bananas) for resale

loans.name: Maaga Group

texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Maaga borrower group in Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 33  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children.

Benita has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 4 years, she works 6 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Benita`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes fro sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Benita hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Rahee is another member of the same borrower group, she requested the loan amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Lidu

texts.es:
Lidú tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares, junto a su esposo Juan, de 31 años, y su hija Antonella de 3 años, quienes son su principal motivación para salir adelante. Al negocio que se dedica es la elaboración de recordatorios, tarjetas de invitación, almanaques o cualquier otro artículo que uno desee como un recuerdo, ella lo hace posible, ya que es muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes, quienes confían en su habilidad y dejan a su criterio los trabajos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es que mientras atiende su puesto, puede también cuidar a su querida hija. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cumplir con el compromiso que tiene con sus clientes con respecto a la fecha de entrega, por la cantidad de pedidos que tiene, pero sabe que tiene que ser muy puntual sino quiere causarle una mala fama a su negocio. Para el futuro y como consecuencia de su arduo trabajo espera que su negocio crezca rápidamente y le pueda dar a su familia la vida que se merece.
Este es el sexto préstamo de Lidú con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales para realizar su trabajo y así poder cumplir con sus pedidos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para sus artículos

loans.name: La Purísima Group

texts.es:
El grupo la purísima lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, con visión y muchos deseos de auto superación.  Maritza Elena S. S. de 34 años de edad hace dos años que puso una pulpería que gracias a los prestamos de adim ha ido creciendo hasta tenerla bien surtida con productos básicos y de consumo para el hogar. Las metas de S. son seguir incrementando el negocio y poder continuar con sus estudios superiores en la carrera de Contabilidad.

Elsa Susana M. G. de 23 años es casada y tiene dos pequeños  hijos de 5 años y tres meses respectivamente. M. vende caramelos y gaseosa y el préstamo lo invertirá para ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias invertirá en la compra de  una caponera, moto taxi utilizada en las comunidades y espera poder empezar con sus estudios de Derecho.

Juana Dolores A. de 31 años vende productos de la Avon y La Zermat marcas de gran prestigio en cosméticos, perfumes, cremas entre otros productos. Ella desea poner su propio taller de sastrería que es lo que le apasiona.
texts.en:
The group “La Purísima” consists of three hardworking women who have vision and a great desire for self-improvement. Maritza Elena S. S. is 34 years old and has managed a grocery store for the past 2 years. Thanks to the loans from ADIM, she has been able to grow her business and keep it well-stocked with basic necessities and consumer products for the home. Maritza’s goals are to continue growing her business and pursue her higher education in accounting.

Elsa Susana M. G. is 23 years old, married, and has 2 small children (ages 5 and 3 months respectively). She sells candy and sodas. Elsa will use her loan to expand her business and invest her earnings in the purchase of a “caponera”, a motorcycle taxi commonly used in her community. She hopes to begin law school.

Juana Dolores A. is 31 years old and sells products from the Avon and Zermat brands, which are well-known for cosmetics, perfumes, crèmes and other items. She hopes to open a tailoring shop because she is passionate about sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel G. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more bread, beans, beef, rice, etc. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bookshop. Daniel is 36 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more food for her restaurant

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a 31 year-old single mother of two children aged 9 and 16 years old. Both her children go to school. She resides and rents a one room house where she is staying with three people. Marjorie doesn’t take care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and gets three meals a day but has no piped water.

[She incurs   transport costs to and from buying baking materials from Kalerwe market   .]  She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall in Kyebando selling snacks in the market. Marjorie sells all types of snacks ranging from samosas, mandazi chapatti, pan cakes and kebabs.  She works seven days a week and averages 35 customers a day. Her major business challenges include ever increasing prices of cooking oil, wheat and baking flour and the rainy season which disturbs her work because she works in an open place. Her monthly expenses include rent for her residence, monthly market dues, feeding the family and medications. Besides this frying business she also operates a pre-primary school near her home.  She has been in this business for over two years and with Kiva partner MCDT for two years. She is now servicing her third loan working with the same group mates. Marjorie joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because of working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, wheat four and baking powder. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and start supplying to different shops and schools.

loans.use: To buy additional cooking supplies.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V., 29 years old, is living on the island of Nocnocan Bohol. She sells fish to nearby villages to earn an income for the family. Her husband is a fisherman. Both of them work to raise their four children well. 

She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fishing nets for her husband and a barrel of fish to resell. Receiving a loan will help a lot in improving the family's economic condition and supporting all their needs.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and fish to resell

loans.name: Jackeline Benita

texts.es:
La sra. Jackeline tiene su tienda de venta de licores, es muy conocida por la zona y lleva dos años con esta actividad, vive en la casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus dos hijos, son una familia muy unida, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de diseño gráfico, y los fines de semana la ayuda en el negocio. El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de bebidas para fin de año como whisky, singanis y rones.						
						
La zona es bastante populosa, se encuentra cobijado por el majestuoso nevado de Illimani, aprovechando las fiestas de fin de año, quiere mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jackeline has been managing a liquor store for two years and is well-known in the area. She lives in the house of her mother-in-law with her husband and two children. They are a close family. Her husband works at a graphic design company and helps with her business on the weekends. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase beverages for the New Year, such as whiskey, brandy, and rum.

The area where she is located is quite popular because it is sheltered by the snow-capped Illimani. Jackeline wants to take advantage of the New Year celebrations to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liquor

loans.name: Narcisa Jesus

texts.es:
Narcisa V. de 46 años de edad, vive en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, su vivienda es de cemento tiene como servicio básico agua y luz sin caminos pavimentados, es madre soltera tiene 2 hijas una de 20 años que estudia en la Universidad y otra de 13 años que todavía esta en una Escuela Particular. 

Narcisa comenzó hace 5 años comprando poco a poco esmaltes y binchas, vendía en su casa así pudo completar capital para ahora tener un bazar surtido con peluches, tarjetas, maquillajes, papelería etc. Narcisa ahora trabaja desde las  07h30 hasta las 21h00 atendiendo solo el bazar, una de sus mayores complicaciones es tener que ir a comprar mercadería al centro de Guayaquil.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más peluches, tarjetas, ropa interior para agrandar más su bazar. En el futuro quiere poner otro bazar para que su hija de 20 años lo atienda.
texts.en:
Narcisa V., 46, lives in the Paraíso sector of Guayaquil. Her home is made of cement and has basic services like running water and electricity although the streets are still unpaved. She is a single mother of two daughters; a 20-year-old university student, and a 13-year-old who is in private school. About five years ago she began to buy fingernail polish and hair bands. She would sell them from her house and began to make enough money to set up a store where she sells stuffed toys, greeting cards, make-up, stationery, etc. Narcisa works from 7:30am until 9pm. One of her greatest difficulties is having to go to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise. With the financing she wants to buy more stuffed toys, greeting cards, and underwear to enlarge her store. In the future she wants to set up a second store that her 20-year-old daughter can run.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stuffed toys, underwear, make-up.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: Lem H., 30, is married and lives with her only child in Dangkao, Cambodia. H. is involved in a business preparing fabrics at home. She is able to earn an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been engaged in this business since 2005. Her husband is a construction worker. He is able to earn an income of USD 3 per day. H. and her family members work hard to try and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well. As a result, H. is requesting a loan of US $200 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the anticipated loan to repair her house because the current house is very old. This is her third loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: House repair.

loans.name: Paterno

texts.en:
Paterno is a 45 year old father of six. Paterno is a rice farmer and he strives to support his children through hard work. He wants to continue to send his children to school so they can finish their studies. His eldest child is 18 years old.

Paterno wants to improve his farming and increase his earnings. He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. that offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 15,000 Php to support his farming business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his rice farm

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Unidas 4 está  ubicado en el Barrio  km 8  Acaray  D. Ciudad del Este, fue conformado a través D. la Sra. Zunilda   R. quien contacto con sus vecinas y amigas del barrio. Integran este comité 16 señoras activas y emprendedoras.
El crédito que retiran lo destinaran a la compra D. ropas,bebidas,embutidos,carne vacuna  y D. cerdo,pollo,aceite,arroz ,fideos, productos lácteos,cosméticos,cubiertos,joyas D. plata,condimentos,frutas y verduras, zapatos y zapatillas, accesorios para celulares..
Este crédito solidario le posibilita a  cada una D. las señoras tener  un ingreso diario y un trabajo independiente..
Así como la señora quien se dedica a la venta D. comida en puesto en el mercado municipal D. la ciudad donD. ella prepara sus comestibles y los venD. a la gente que trabaja en el mercado así como a la gente que visita el mercado. En su local ella posee todas las herramientas necesarias para cocinar y en ocasiones es ayudada por la hija y el marido, la venta ayuda muchísimo para los gastos D. la familia..
Se las actividades D. las demás integrantes..
Virginia Verdun
Venta D. comidas.
Zunilda R. D. Ferreira
Venta D. ropa y zapatos.
Atanacia Méreles
Venta D. accesorios para celulares.
Juana D. Jesús V.
Venta D. ropas.
Cándida T. D. Arce
Venta D. ropa.
Rosa Gonzalez D. Ortiz
Venta D. ropa seminueva.
Justina R. D. Rolon
Venta D. comida.
Vicenta Noemí O. 
Venta D.  productos D. limpieza.
Natalia Andrea B.
Venta D. ropa.
ClotilD. Notario D. V.
Venta D. comida.
Maria Elena Rolon
Venta D. ropa.
Olga C.
Venta D. joya.
Maria Ana D.
Despensa.
Deysi Andrea S. 
Venta D. ropas.
Liliana Ramona O.
Venta D. productos D. limpieza.
Liliana R.
Venta D. zapatillas.
texts.en:
The “Comité Mujeres Unidas 4” (Commitee of United Women 4) is located in the “km 8 Acaray” neighborhood of the City of Este. It was co-founded by Zunilda, who contacted her neighborhood friends and neighbors. The group is maD. up of 16 active and enterprising women. They will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, drinks, tripe, beef, pork, chicken, cooking oil, noodles, milk products, cosmetics, kitchen utensils, silver jewelry, condiments, fruits and vegetables, shoes, flip-flops, and cell phone accessories. This loan will give each of these women the opportunity to produce daily incomes while running her own businesses, such as the woman who sells food from a stall in the city marketplace where she prepares her food and sells it to the people working there, as well as those who visit the market. She has all of the cooking tools of her traD.. Sometimes her daughter and her husband help her as well. Her sales help the family tremendously. The other women’s businesses are: Virginia – Food sales Zunilda – Clothing and shoes Atanacia – Cell phone accessories Juana – Clothing sales Cándida – Clothing sales Rosa – Semi-new clothing sales Justina – Food sales Vicenta – Cleaning products sales Natalia – Clothing sales ClotilD. – Food sales Maria – Clothing sales Olga – Jewelry sales Maria – Pantry sales Deysi – Clothing sales Liliana Ramona – Cleaning product sales Liliana – Flip-flop (footwear) sales

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann C., 39, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Bonifacio C., a driver, and they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling cosmetics through her direct-selling line of the popular cosmetics brands.

Mary Ann has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her direct-selling business.

Now, with your help, Mary Ann would like to obtain a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying advance orders of her direct-selling line.

Mary Ann dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders of her direct selling line

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
In ten years of farming, Rosalie C. has experienced a lot of difficulties especially financially. But she worked very hard to be able to maintain her farm and earn a living.

Having 5 children, she and her husband double their efforts to keep up with the increasing needs of their family. Now that it is planting season, Rosalie is seeking financial assistance to be able to acquire the inputs her farm needs.

She has applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI, which she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and other items.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante O. is from the village of Nasaag, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 36 years old and is single. To make a living, Dante owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pork, chicken, fish and vegetables in the local community. Dante has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Dante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Dante is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan he has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard N. O. is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child. He has a quiet personality, and he believes in achieving. Benard runs an electronic repair business in Nambale, Busia district. He started the business in 2002, immediately after high school graduation.

He would like a loan of 10,000 KES to expand his business by acquiring spare parts to sell at his premises. His future plan is to venture into the rental housing business after buying a parcel of land.

loans.use: To buy electronics spare parts to sell

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Lulu L. became a member of ASHI in 2001. Her dream of having her own business came true when she received loans after joining ASHI.

At first, Lulu had a small “sari-sari” store. Sari-sari means a store attached to a house where various kinds of foodstuff, beverages and other basic commodities are sold. A lot of people from the village are customers of this kind of store because this is the most convenient way they can access things they need every day without spending on transportation costs. Lulu and her family enjoyed the small proceeds her business brought them. 

Eventually, through her successive loans from ASHI, Lulu was able to purchase a “pedicab” (a bicycle with sidecar) for a transportation business managed by her husband. Lulu and her husband have four children to support and so they both have to work hard and earn through their own business. Lulu’s youngest child is two years old and the eldest is 26. Her oldest and her second oldest child, who is 24, are both working as computer programmers for small private shops in town. Both are not earning well, and so Lulu still supports some of their needs as well as the needs of her three other children. 

Because Lulu’s husband’s pedicab is operated using a bicycle, he earns only a small income by the end of each day of hard work. Lulu is requesting a loan through ASHI to purchase a motorcycle to replace her husband’s bicycle. With this, his income will grow and he will be able to support the improvement of their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Rubimbiri Bakyara Tukore Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
On the face of it, K. Alice is a hard-grinding business lady. The 50-year-old married mother of five school-going children sweats her guts out buying and selling animals like cows as well as selling milk from the cows and selling matooke (green plantain) from her plantation. She operates in the small rural area of Rubimbiri, Ntungamo district, and she has been doing this for the last ten years.

Alice is able to make 450,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is quite modest by any standards and, as such, she requires a loan that will help her buy more cows for her business. Then she will be able to meet her customers’ demand and also earn more revenue.

Alice belongs to a group of members and they insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es:
Deyanira G. Chalarca,  es una mujer muy jovial que vive en Bogotá, la capital de Colombia, en un barrio de fácil acceso al comercio, que se encuentra cerca al centro de esta ciudad. Cuando Deyanira con su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos, llegó desde Ibagué a Bogotá, ya tenía experiencia en la actividad de producción y comercialización de autopartes,  es decir ya elaboraba  gran variedad de  herramientas y accesorios, para el mantenimiento de vehículos como  carro, automóvil o moto etc.  Por eso desde hace 10 años   se dedicó a ello, una vez falleció su esposo,   y como sus  hijos también heredaron esta tradición, hoy tienen su propio negocio, donde todos venden empaques de: culata, amortiguadores, bloque, cigüeñal, puertas, vidrios y protectores de cabrillas, timones, manubrios, eleva vidrios, limpia parabrisas entre otros. 

Su meta es ampliar la línea de sus productos hacia otras marcas de vehículos como Hunday, Suzuki y Mazda; en la actualidad requiere un crédito y está aplicando a un monto por valor de  $1.500.000 COP, para comprar  materia primas e insumos como: 400 metros de tiras de caucho en R-432, 600 metros de empaque espuma para el marco de la puerta de los wolsvagen y empaques plumillas.

Su gran desafío es la competencia en los precios de estos productos, lograr  la calidad    y algunas  veces la escasez de materias primas, por eso debe tener dinero para aprovechar cuando hay en existencia.
texts.en:
Deyanira G. Chalarca is a very cheerful woman who lives in Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. She lives close to the center of the city in a neighborhood with easy commercial access. When Deyanira moved from Ibagué to Bogotá with her husband and two children she already had experience making and selling auto parts. She knew how to manufacture a range of tools and accessories to maintain cars, motorcycles, and other vehicles. So, after her husband died ten years ago, she and her children began a business selling a variety of auto parts, including cylinder heads, shock absorbers, blocks, crankshafts, doors, windows, windshield wipers, steering wheels, door handles, etc. Her goal is to expand the range of products that she offers to include those from Hyundai, Suzuki and Mazda. She is currently requesting a loan for $1.500.000 Colombian pesos to purchase materials and supplies, including 400 meters of rubber cord, 600 meters of foam packing used in Volkswagen doors, and windshield wiper blades. Her greatest wish is to offer competitive pricing on these products, offering quality items despite shortages in supply, and in this way earn enough money to enjoy life.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and materials for auto parts business

loans.name: Beltran

texts.es: Beltrán, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y alegre, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Siendo aun muy joven, Beltrán sabe que tiene que poner todas sus fuerzas, para lograr ganarse la vida con su labor. Él se dedica en la siembra de papa y arveja, productos que llegada la época de cosecha, llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde sus clientes, conocedores de la calidad de sus productos, le compran rápidamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar su cosecha hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Con el tiempo espera comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro préstamo en el futuro. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy participativo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, así mismo comprará abono para aplicar a su nueva siembra.
texts.en:
Beltrán, age 21, is a very straightforward and cheerful young man. He lives in his parents' house, and what he desires most is to get ahead in life. Even though he is still very young, Beltrán knows that he needs to apply all of his efforts to be able to earn a living. His work is growing potatoes and peas, and when harvest time comes, he takes his crops to sell at the wholesale market in Tarma. His customers know the quality of his products and buy them quickly. What he likes most about his work is protecting his crops from pests. He has done this work for 5 years, and he thinks the hardest part is taking his crops to market to sell, since the sacks he carries are very heavy. In the future, he hopes to buy more land to expand his fields. This is his third loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to make his payments punctually if he wants to have access to another loan in the future. In his communal bank, he is a very participative member. With the 1,500 Peruvian new soles he is requesting, he will buy potato seedlings and pea seeds, as well as fertilizer to apply to his new crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pea seeds, potato seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 46 years old. Rosalita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalita owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosalita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rosalita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Elisha Kiprotich

texts.en:
Elisha Kiprotich N. is a 28-year-old man. He is married to Teresa and they are blessed with two children who are aged 4 and 2 years. They live in the Mafuta area in the outskirts of Eldoret. Elisha is a farmer who plants maize and wheat for resale after harvest. Elisha has been farming for five years now and gets a yearly income of 120,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Elisha's third loan with KADET and he plans to use the entire loan to buy fertilizer for his farm. With the income he is going to get from the sale of the produce, he plans to pay school fees for his children.

In the future, he plans to educate his children to the highest level and also expand his business to large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba N. operates a food joint where she prepares 'fufu' for sale at Takoradi.  Araba has a little foundation in formal education. She is divorced and taking care of four children. She responsibly and single-handedly takes care of her four dependents. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook since customers have started requesting other kinds of food. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
