Jalia S. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Jalia has a business selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Jalia sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Jalia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Jalia include transportation of bales of clothes from Owino market to Kisaasi Market and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes directly from the United Kingdom. She has been withn  MCDT for along time and is servicing her twentieth loan.  Jalai decided to join MCDT bcause of the low interest charged and services are brought nearer to the clients.    Jalia lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food  and school fees .

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Circonsicion

texts.en:
Circonsicion L. is from the village of District II, Benito Soliven. She is 47 years old. Circonsicion is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Circonsicion raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Circonsicion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells her raised pig.

In 2009, Circonsicion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Circonsicion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Circonsicion is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional baby livestock. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Circonsicion. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for its Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Providence

texts.en:
Providence is 23 years old, and she is married with two children.  Providence owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods as her picture indicates.  Providence has owned this shop since 2009 and the business hours are from 6 am to 6 pm every day.

Providence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will purchase a variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and some pastries for sale.  As these foodstuffs are highly demanded by a large number of her customers, she really hopes that her revenue will increase and she also hopes that the lifestyle of her family will also improve.

loans.use: A variety of foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and some pastries for resale

loans.name: Maomanyi

texts.en:
Maomanyi has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya, that produces maize, beans, coffee, milk and tea. He sells his products to the local market and through the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He has been practicing mixed farming for five years. He is also a mason. His biggest challenges in farming have been transportation and the fluctuation in the prices of milk.

Maomanyi is 48 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children who are now between the ages of 17 and 26. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his cereals business. The extra income from this loan will help him build a better house and pay school fees for his children with ease. He plans to expand his dairy business in the future by buying three quality dairy cows and a posho mill to ground maize into corn flour.

loans.use: To expand his cereals business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha is 39 years old and married with 2 children, living in Saida, in the south of Lebanon.

She is a seamstress & has a shop where she sells clothing.  Nouha began her business in 1996 and has had a previous loan through A. Majmoua, maintaining a strong repayment history.

Nouha found her previous loan very beneficiA. and is now asking for another loan of $1200 to increase the stock for her shop.

Nouha very much enjoys sewing and running a shop, and also finds the contact she has with customers very rewarding. Since beginning her business, Nouha has built up a large number of clientele.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sewing shop

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 62 years old. Ernesto is married and has four children. To make a living, Ernesto owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Ernesto has been working hard to build his business.

Ernesto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Luz Y Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Luz y prosperidad

Julia tiene 39 años de edad lleva el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “luz y prosperidad” el cual tiene ya mas de 1 año trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad esta y esta conformada hace 4 años por 9 personas que llegaron a conocerse por que son vecinos y le pusieron el nombre de “Luz y Prosperidad” simplemente por que todo el grupo les pareció bien el nombre.
Julia es madre soltera convive con su pareja y mantiene a sus 3 hijas que son menores de edad Julia comenzó vendiendo golosinas ahora  tiene 1 año vendiendo ropa (AMBULANTE)  de esa manera puede mantener a sus 3 hijas junto a su pareja que le tanbien aporta a los gastos del hogar los cuales son Comida, Estudios, ETC  Julia quisiera tener un capital de trabajo para poder alquilar un puesto de vende en el mercado de su localidad y así siguir adelanta como la persona trabajadora que es.
texts.en:
Light and Prosperity

Julia, 39, is President of the “Luz y Prosperidad” (Light & Prosperity) communal bank which has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for over a year.  It has been in existence for four years and has nine members that got to know each other because they are neighbors.  They called it “Luz y Prosperidad” simply because the entire group liked the name.

Julia is a single mother living with her partner.  She supports her three minor daughters.  She started off selling snacks but has for a year now been working as a street vendor selling clothes.  This is how she supports her three daughters together with her partner who also contributes to household expenses which are food, schooling, etc.

Julia would like to have working capital to rent a stand in her local market to sell from there and continue to get ahead like the hard working person she is.

loans.use: To rent a sales stand.

loans.name: Donia

texts.es: Está bella niña, es Samira, de 7 años de edad, es la razón de vivir de Donia, de 39 años, que junto a su esposo Francisco, de 40 años, y sus 3 hijos: Abel, de 21, Yerry, de 16 y Paúl, de 13 años de edad; viven en unión familiar en Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (selva central peruana). Donia, hace 12 años, conocedora de su buena sazón en la cocina, acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su casa, donde todos los días, vende comida típica y local, entre sus platos preferidos tiene yuca rellena, patasca, y diferentes potajes a base de pescados de río. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es la hora en que se llena su local, no solo con personas oriundas del lugar, también con turistas, los que cada año la visitan. Ella se siente realizada y con muchas ganas de progresar; por ello está pensando invertir sus fuerzas y ahorros en la apertura de una tienda de comestibles; con el que piensa abastecer a sus pobladores de productos de primera necesidad. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y conocedora del trabajo esforzado y sacrificado de las integrantes de su banco comunal, se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe. Con el crédito que recibe, ha pensado invertir en el negocio de compra y venta de queso, el cual repartirá entre los pobladores de su localidad; que conocedores del proyecto de Donia, ya le hicieron muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
This beautiful little girl is Samira, 7.  She is Donia’s reason for living.  Donia, 39, together with her husband Francisco, 40, and their three children: Abel, 21, Yerry, 16 and Paúl, 13, live together as a family in Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (Peruvian central jungle).

Thanks to her tasty food preparation, Donia twelve years ago set up a small space in her house as an eatery.  She sells typical local dishes daily.  Among the favorite dishes are: stuffed manioc, patasca (thick stew made by boiling a whole pig, sheep or beef head) and various stews based on river fish.  What she most enjoys is the moment her eatery fills up not only with locals but with tourists too who come by each year to visit.

She feels very fulfilled and wanting to progress.  Because of this she is planning to invest her efforts and savings into the opening of a grocery store that she plans to use to supply residents with basic need items.

This is her 4th loan with MFP and, fully aware of the sacrifice and hard work of the members of her communal bank, she feels grateful for the support she’s received.

She will use the loan she gets to invest in the purchase and sale of cheese which she will distribute among the residents in her area who, knowing of Donia’s project, already have placed several orders.

loans.use: To buy cheese to go into foodstuffs sales.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old and married. She has 11 children, and the younger ones still attend school. Guillerma is a rice grower. She and her husband work their best to maintain their farm, ensuring the rice crops are healthy and the farm is free of weeds and pests.

Guillerma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guillerma has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for the tractor. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and tractor fuel

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 36 años, es madre soltera, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su hija Lucero de 20 años. Después de trabajar muchos años, limpiando departamentos en un condominio muy prestigioso dentro de una zona exclusiva de Lima; Gloria pensó en desarrollar un negocio adicional como la venta de lencerías. Desde entonces vende prendas interiores y calcetines para niños y adultos, negocio que le ha resultado bien; ya que lo realiza sin el mayor esfuerzo, porque ofrece  a las dueñas de los departamentos donde ella limpia, resultándole muy conveniente y rentable su negocio. Por ello los excedentes de su paga, trata de invertirlos en el incremento de más prendas, ya que le gusta tener bien surtida su negocio, porque solo así sus ganancias se suman. Por lo tanto Gloria en adelante piensa aumentar su capital de trabajo y luego cederle una parte a su hija, de ese modo pueda trabajar. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que este aporte será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo en su grupo comunal como socia antigua y responsable que es, sus opiniones es  tomada en cuenta. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará calcetines, trusas y conjuntos de prendas intimas, para abastecer los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en: Gloria, 36, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her 20-year-old daughter, Lucero.  After having worked for many years cleaning apartments in a very prestigious condominium complex in an exclusive area of Lima,  Gloria decided to develop an additional business selling lingerie.  From that time on she has been selling underwear and socks for children and adults.  This business has turned out well, and she succeeds without great effort because she sells to the women in the apartments where she cleans.  It has turned out to be convenient and profitable.  She uses the money that she receives to invest in more clothing since she likes to have a good assortment because that is the only way she will have profits.  Thus Gloria is planning on increasing her working capital and then give part of it to her daughter so that she can also work.  This is the eighth loan she has had with MFP and she knows that they are very important to the growth of her business.  Since she has been in the communal group as a member for a long time, and since she is very responsible, her opinions are respected.  With this loan she will buy socks, panties, and lingerie sets that will fill the orders that she has.

loans.use: To buy socks and lingerie to fill the orders that she has

loans.name: Oyumaasuren

texts.en: Oyumaasuren, 36, is widowed and lives with her three children in Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her older two daughters attend a local secondary school and her youngest son goes to kindergarten. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. Her husband passed away in 2010 so she is responsible for taking care of her family. She began operating a hair salon in Uliastai city, the center of Zavhan province, in 1998. She participates in contests organized by local hairdressers and most often wins a prize. As an experienced hairdresser who has been operating a hair salon for more than 12 years, she also trains students at a vocational school. Oyumaasuren is popular in her area and she has many regular customers.  She is a sociable, responsible and honest person who cares for her children's future. Oyumaasuren is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy necessary tools and items for her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy tools and other items for her salon

loans.name: Gelen Patricia

texts.es:
Gelen T. M.  vive en San Jacinto Bolivar, un municipio donde la tradicion artesanal es la actividad favorita  que identifica a sus habitantes y es transmitida de generaciòn en generaciòn;  por eso es usual llegar a cualquier vivienda de este municipio del departamento de Bolivar y conocer como es un tejido en telar vertical, con el que se fabrican las mas hermosas hamacas, mochilas entre otras bellezas artesanales y justamente Gelen  una mujer de 28 años de edad, que vive con su conyuge y su hijo de 4 ños,  se dedica a este oficio el cual desempeña, haciendole honor a su tradiciòn y que practica simultaneamente  con otra actividad generadora de ingresos,  como lo es la venta de comidas rápidas .
Este es el tercer financiamiento que tiene con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y està aplicando a su primer credikiva, el cual invertirá en la compra de materias primas para hacer hamacas,  pronosticando  una inversión segura porque responderà a pedidos durante todo e resto del año;  asi mismo invertirá en  la compra de insumos para la preparaciòn de sus  comidas rápidas; compra  con la cual obtendrà descuentos, debido a que la harà por mayor volumen, disminuyendo sus costos de producciòn, acciòn muy efectiva para aumentar su capacidad competitiva, pues  trasladarà  estos descuentos al precio de ventas de sus productos.
Gelen siempre le ha gustado el comercio, antes vendía  productos de belleza mediante  revistas  especializadas, con esa experiencia logró desarrollar iniciativas emprendedoras como la actual   producción de comidas rápidas,  actividad que realiza todos los días en las horas de la noche, y la fabricaciòn de  artesanías, que  comercializa con un amigo que tiene en Bogotá , la capital de Colombia y tambien muy cerca al mar en la ciudad  de  Santa Marta. La elaboraciòn y venta de comidas se inicia debido a que en el sector no había un negocio similar y es un sitio de mucha afluencia de pùblico, y respecto a su negocio  de  artesanías empezó cuando    amigos y familiares le hacían pedidos y  comprando y vendiendo,  logrò un pequeño capital que reinvirtió. 
Su sueño y mas grande desafio es fortalecer y lograr un gran empresa, mediante su  trabajando persistente,  para ofrecerle un   futuro prometedor a su hijo, asì mismo hacer en su casa un local amplio y ofrecer un confortable servicio; no obstante su meta a mediano plazo es mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, mediante adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gelen T. M. lives in San Jacinto Bolivar, a town where artisan tradition is the favorite activity of the population as it is handed down from generation to generation.  It is normal to go into any home in this town in the department of Bolivar and find a vertical loom with woven fabric being made for the beautiful hammocks, knapsacks and other beautiful crafts produced here. 

This is precisely what Gelen does.  She is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 4-year old son.  Honoring tradition she weaves fabric as a source of income but also sells fast food.  This is her third loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation and her first through Kiva.  She plans to use it to buy raw materials to make hammocks.  She believes it will be a sound investment since she already has orders for the rest of the year.  She also plans to buy ingredients for her fast food products.  She will get a good discount since she plans to buy wholesale quantities, bringing down her production costs, increasing her competitiveness and allowing her to pass on savings by lowering the sale price. 

Gelen has always enjoyed being a merchant.  She used to sell beauty products through specialized magazines.  With that experience she was able to develop her entrepreneurial skills such as those used in her current fast food business, which she runs every evening, and her craft selling business which she runs together with a friend she has in Bogotá, Colombia, and in the seaside city of Santa Marta.

The fast food activity was begun because there was nothing similar in this busy area.  Regarding the craft business, she started out when friends and family began ordering her products.  She was able to earn a little capital which she reinvested.  Her dream and goal is to have a large company through her hard work so she can provide a good future for her son and expand her home to have a large space out of which to work.  Her short-term plans are to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make hammocks and ingredients for fast food

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida O. is from the village of Salinas Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Leonida is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida raises pigs for fattening and resale. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells one of her raised pigs.

In 2011, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is a married woman who lives in San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband Alejandro, who is 57 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 33 and 34 years old. Arsenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Arsenia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 13,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family. Arsenia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Liliana Gabriela

texts.es: Liliana Gabriela C. A. de 24 años de edad vive en casa de su compañero de vida junto a sus dos pequeños hijos. Liliana es un ejemplo de mujer trabajadora y luchadora. Posee un pequeño negocio en donde vende Hot Dog, carne asada y café. Ubicado en el Municipio de San Marcos Departamento de San Salvador. Lugar que es muy conocido ya que se encuentra en una zona céntrica y  concurrida. Liliana empieza el día desde muy temprano con el fin de tener preparados sus ricos Hot Dog a la  hora que los clientes la busquen. En este negocio lo más importante es la satisfacción del cliente por lo que la amabilidad, higiene, y buen sabor de los platillos es lo más importante para Liliana. Gracias a su arduo trabajo y confianza en Dios la demanda de su deliciosa comida ha aumentado y ha decidido invertir en su negocio para poder ofrecer variedad, calidad y mayor cantidad de sus productos. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar la materia prima necesaria como: pan, salchichas, carne, aderezos, gas propano y de más productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus platillos. Con la Fe puesta en Dios que de esta forma podrá obtener mejores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que cada día necesitan un poco más.
texts.en:
Liliana Gabriela C. A. is 24 years old and lives in her life partner's home together with her two young children.  Liliana is an example of a hard-working and driven woman.  She owns a small business where she sells hot dogs, grilled meat and coffee.  Her business is located in the town of San Marcos, in San Salvador department.  The area is very well known as it is in a busy, central area. 

Liliana starts her day very early in order to have her delicious hot dogs ready when her customers come to buy them.  The most important thing in Liliana's business is customer satisfaction.  For this reason, she is kind to her customers, prepares her food hygienically and makes good-tasting food.  Thanks to her hard work and her faith in God, demand for her delicious food has increased and she has decided to invest in her business in order to be able to offer a wider variety of products, better quality products and more products.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as bread, sausages, meat, dressings, propane gas and other products in order to make her dishes.  She has placed her faith in God that in this way she will be able to make more income and improve the quality of life of her family who need a little more every day.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, meat, dressings, propane gas, etc.

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the town of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, coffee, sugar, rice and bread to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, coffee, sugar, rice and bread to sell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María es una persona que le ayuda a su a su esposo con la  manutención de su hogar , ellos  tienen  cuatro  hijos  lo cuales  son lo mas  importante  en su   vida,  la  Sra.  María  se  dedica a la venta de   ropa  por  lo  cual  viaja  fuera de la ciudad para comprar  mercancía cada quince días  la  cual  vende  con  sus  familiares, amigos  y conocidos, en esta  ocasión requiere  del crédito  para  realizar  la  compra  de  mercancía  para  poder  ofertar a  sus  clientes  una mayor  variedad y  así  obtener  generar   mayores  ingresos.
texts.en: Maria helps her husband keep their household running. She and her husband have four children-- the most important part of their life. Maria sells clothing. She leaves the city about once every two weeks in order to buy more merchandise, which she sells to her family, friends and neighbours. Maria needs a loan in order to buy more clothing. She wants to give her customers more choices and increase her income.

loans.use: buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Ayidote 1 Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Pauline. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier et mènent certaines activités ensemble. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pauline est née le 20 juin 1968. Pauline est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à charge. Tous les enfants ne sont pas scolarisés. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Pauline prépare de la nourriture ("Akassa" fait à base du maïs, accompagné de la sauce de viande) qu’elle vend  à son domicile. Pauline et son groupe vendent également du charbon de bois. Pauline exerce ce métier depuis quinze ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari ,  d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Pauline s’approvisionne au Bénin. Pauline vend la nourriture à son domicile. Ce cinquième prêt permettra certainement à Pauline et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: AYIDOTE 1 is a group composed of three people. The president, by the name of Pauline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. The group members live in the same district and operate certain businesses together. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is requesting for the fifth time a loan from ALIDé. Pauline was born on June 20, 1968. She is married to man named Jean. The couple has four children to support. None of the children are in school. After dropping out of primary school, she has been making food (akassa, made from cornmeal and served with meat sauce) that she sells out of her house. She and her group also sell charcoal. She has been working at her trade for fifteen years. It enables her, along with her husband, to ensure that the various family expenses are covered. She gets her supplies from Benin. This fifth loan will surely enable Pauline and her group to boost their businesses and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, corn, cassava flour, and some meat

loans.name: Zafra Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es una madre de familia que  tiene  de 41 años de edad, ella vive con su menor hijo  en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el  distrito de Zaña, ciudad 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Beatriz se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de cajas de cartón, ella se dedica a este negocio hace más de 10 años en los que ha adquirido experiencia en el rubro y clientela fija para sus negocio. Beatriz se encarga de comercializar sus productos en un puesto en el mercado de su localidad. 

Beatriz está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que pueda obtener más materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, para que de esta manera ella pueda percibir mayor ingresos, para los gastos de su hogar. 

Beatriz desea mejorar su calidad  de vida, con esfuerzo y trabajo. Cuenta con buenas referencias, las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a 41 year-old mother who lives with her [dependent] son in her own home which is located in Zaña district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Beatriz makes and sells cardboard boxes.  She has been in this business for more than ten years.  She has acquired experience in the field and also regular customers for her business.  Beatriz sells her products from a stall in her town market.

Beatriz is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can obtain more raw materials for making her products and  make more income to cover her household expenses.

Beatriz would like to improve her quality of life through effort and hard work.  She has good references.  The people who know her describe her as a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Bahyt's Group

texts.en:
Bahyt is the leader of this group. She is 52 and married to a private driver. She has raised a son, 33, who is engaged in transporting passengers, too. The family’s monthly income from the transportation services provided is 15,000 soms. 

Bahyt applied for the loan because the family needs additional funds for purchasing auto parts. Her son and her husband need to repair the vehicles. In the future the family wishes to save money to purchase a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo, 43, is humble villager in the Ornlong Veng district and the mother of four children, one of which is married and three of whom are single. Most of the children are employed as internal staff in local hotels and they always share their low incomes with Mrs. Keo so that she can use it for the family expenses. Mrs. Keo and her husband are local farmers who have been planting a variety of crops for a few years. Aside from this farming, she often distills liquor at home in order to make alcohol to sell for extra-income. Mrs. Keo will use part of the loan to mend her plowing machine so that she can use it to plow on her fertile land, and she will use the other part of loan fund to buy fertilizers and seed for planting.

loans.use: to mend her plowing machine, and purchase fertilizers and seed for planting.

loans.name: Deky

texts.en:
Deky is a 47 year-old entrepreneur. He is married to Juliana, who is 42 years old. They have four children.  Alexandro, 21 years old, graduated from university.  Geni, 18 years old, is studying at a university.  Kezia, 9 years old, is studying in the fourth grade of primary school. Gabriella is four months old. 

Deky owns a kiosk business and has been running the business for years. He initiated the business using his own capital.  When he started the business he only got a small room but he was excited to run the business. He sells goods such as rice, milk, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, mobile phone recharges, candies, etc.  Deky joined TLM group lending program and his business improved because of the loan support.

Deky dreams of operating a poultry business. He believes that this business will bring more benefits for his family. He intends to purchase chicks and fodder, as well as to renovate the used stall. Deky is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 through TLM's individual lending program.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and fodder, as well as to renovate the used stall

loans.name: Phong

texts.en: Mrs. Phong has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she had learned from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has three school-aged kids. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for her crop. However, Phong doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm, so, she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting. Mrs. Phong very much hopes to receive your support soon.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar believes that, "A quitter never wins and a winner never quits"; it is his guiding principle in life. Despite hardships and problems he still has the strong faith and determination to survive. He is 30 years old, married and has two infant children. As a father, he is responsible to provide for all of his family's needs in terms of financial, emotional and spiritual requirements. Rice farming is one of the major sources of their income. Hence, he wants to increase his productions and income to meet their basic necessities and to save for the future of their children. 

Due to financial difficulty, he wants to ask for an additional capital of PHP20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain their rice production. He believes that the loan will help a lot to increase their production. He mentioned that only hard work can enable him to make his business fruitful and profitable. He hopes that, in the future, he will achieve all his business goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sustain rice production.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: Wilson D. 51 años D. edad vive en el municipio D. Malambo donD. tiene un negocio mediante el cual ofrece servicios D. transcripciones, refresquería y dulcería, iniciado después D. haber trabajado como conductor D. bus durante 28 años y cuando estuvo a L. espera D. su pensión, compró el primer computador para hacer transcripciones; posteriormente con L. ayuda D. sus hijos compró una vitrina pequeña, para exhibir sus dulces y tambien un nuevo computador, y últimamente compro un enfriador para vender cervezas, hielo, agua y refrescos en general. Su meta más adelante en completar su café internet para lograr apoyar los estudios universitarios D. su hija menor. En L. actualidad Wilson se encuentra aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará un computador, surtirá D. refrescos y bebidas el enfriador y comprará resmas D. papel y tinta para el funcionamiento D. su servicio D. transcripciones. Con ello asegura una inversión exitosa, pues se estaba quedando corto en sus servicios y sus clientes buscan nuevas opciones;  así mismo  estarán satisfechos con las bebidas bien frías que encontraran con su nueva inversión, en el refrigerador D. Wilson, después del incesante calor, temperatura ambiente del  municipio D. malambo.
texts.en:
Wilson, 51, lives in the town of Malambo where he has a business offering transcriptions, beverages and candy.  He started it after having worked as a bus driver for 28 years.  While waiting for his pension he bought his first computer to do the transcriptions.  Later, with help from his children, he bought a small display case to display his candy and also got a new computer and recently he bought a cooler to sell beer, ice, water and beverages in general.  His goal for later on is to complete his Internet café to earn income to support his youngest daughter’s university studies.

At present, Wilson finds himself applying for a Kiva loan to buy a computer, to stock the cooler with soft-drinks and beverages and to buy reams of paper and ink for his transcriptions business'  use.  With this he is sure of a successful investment because he was running short on services and his customers were looking for other alternatives.  This way, they’ll be satisfied with the really cold beverages they’ll find in the intense heat and high ambient temperatures typical of the town of Malambo thanks to the new investment in Wilson’s refrigerator.

loans.use: to stock his cooler with soft-drinks and beverages, to buy a computer and to buy reams of paper and ink for his transcriptions business.

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
This is Nelsa, 48, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She and her husband Rogelio, a messenger, have three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nelsa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages in small quantities to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this she also earns additional income from rugs and accessories that she sells. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Nelsa hopes to be able to expand soon, and she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 40 years old and married with five school-aged children. With her desire to improve their daily lives, she spends most of her time in her hog-raising business. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them, earning a profit of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), just enough to cover their daily expenses.

She is now asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. She hopes to be able to send her children to school so that they will become professionals someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Raquel has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON.

Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La señora Ana es cliente antigua D. Emprender que se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en una tienda D. su barrio ubicada en la zona D. Chuquiaguillo a veinticinco minutos del centro D. la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como chofer propietario D. radio taxi. Doña Ana a demostrado ser una cliente responsable y puntual con el pago D. las cuotas D. sus anteriores prestamos. Uno D. sus mayores anhelos es llegar a comprar una casita propia y lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo D. dinero para la compra D. abarrotes para incrementar su capital en su tienda y así incrementar sus ingresos diarios.
texts.en: Ana is a former borrower at Emprender and works selling groceries from a store in her neighborhood located in the Chuquiaguillo area, 25 minutes from the city.  Her husband works as an owner-driver of a radio taxi.  Ana has proven herself to be a responsible borrower and has maD. her previous loan payments on time.  One of her greatest desires is to be able to buy her own house and for her children to be professionals.  At this time, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of groceries to increase her store’s capital, thereby increasing her daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria es una emprendedora que disfruta de esta actividad,  ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura.  Al verse en esta situación ella se vio en la necesidad de buscar un sustento para su familia. Ella comienza su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen la buena calidad de prendas que elabora. Actualmente Ana necesita un préstamo para comprar hilos, tela, dedales, tijeras, cintas y bordados.
texts.en: Ana Maria is an entrepreneur who benefits from her work. She offers a sewing service because she needed to find a way to support her family. She works from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm. Ana Maria's customers recognize the high quality of the garments that she makes. Ana now needs a loan to purchase thread, fabric, thimbles, scissors, tape, and embroidery.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, thimbles, scissors, tape and embroidery.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 37, is a teacher. She has been teaching for seven years. She lives with her husband and daughters in Kherlen, a boundary town of western Mongolia. Her husband works as a fireman and often has a high workload, but his income is not so good. Munkhtsetseg’s monthly salary also does not meet her family expenses, and as such they always face a lack of money. Due to this she and her husband decided to start a new business, a taxi service, to increase the family's income. Now she needs over 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start the taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es: La señora Luz Adriana a sus 28 años de edad, se dedica junto con su esposo a realizar artesanías en madera desde su casa. Todo empezó cuando realizaron juntos por primera vez una alcancía y luego otros artículos para su hogar como mesas y repisas. El conocimiento lo adquirió de su esposo quien anteriormente trabajaba en una ebanistería. La señora Luz Adriana desea amortizar la deuda del activo adquirido en una maquina caladora y comprar material de trabajo como madera. La señora Luz Adriana sueña con tener su propio taller que le permita brindarle a su hijo de 5 años y esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz Adriana, 28, makes wooden crafts alongside her husband at home.  Everything started when they first built a piggy bank and then other items for the home like tables and shelves.  She learned this skill from her husband who used to work as a cabinet maker.  Luz Adriana wants to pay off the debt she incurred when she purchased a boring machine and to buy work materials like wood.  Luz Adriana dreams with having her own workshop that will allow her to provide her five-year-old son and her husband with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay off a debt and to buy raw materials like wood.

loans.name: Sonia Milagros

texts.es:
La mujer que ustedes pueden ver en la foto es la señora Sonia y tiene 24 años de edad, también tiene un pequeño de 4 años y ambos se cuidan juntos. La señora Sonia cuando era niña se dio cuenta que le gustaba vender y es por ello que cuando tenía 16 años y estaba en la escuela vendía golosinas a sus compañeros, esta pequeña cantidad de dinero que ganaba se la daba a su familia para que pudieran tener un ingreso extra.

Sonia vendía hace 4 años junto a sus padres ropa para bebes y el negocio le gustó tanto que decidió abrir una puesto en el mercado, pero debido a que no tenía mucho dinero para pagar todo lo que necesitaba decidió compartir el puesto con su tía y así ambas pagar un monto menor por  alquiler.

Ahora Sonia quiere alquilarse un local propio y comprar más ropa para vender, gracias a los prestatarios Kiva ella recibirá el apoyo que en este momento necesita para poder cumplir una de sus metas actuales. Su gran sueño es poder abrir muchas tiendas que se dediquen exclusivamente a la venta de ropa para bebes y así poder ganar el dinero necesario para ayudar a su hermana a que continúe sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
The woman that you see in the picture is Sonia and she is 24 years of age. She has a 4 year old son and they both take care of each other. 

When Sonia was a little girl, she realized that she liked sales and that's why she began to sell candy to her schoolmates when she was 16 years old.  Sonia gave the small amount she earned to her family so they could have an extra income. For four years, Sonia and her parents sold baby clothes. She liked the  business so much that she decided to open a market stall but due to the fact that she did not have a lot of money to pay for everything she needed, she decided to share the stall with her aunt and thus each pay a lesser amount for the rent. 

Sonia now wants to rent her own stall and to buy more clothes to sell. Thanks to Kiva lenders, Sonia will receive the support she currently needs to be able to achieve her current goals. Her big dream is to open up  many stores that are exclusively sell baby clothes and thus be able to make enough money to help her sister continue pursuing a higher education.

loans.use: to rent her own market stall and to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in eastern Mongolia. His wife works in a factory, his two eldest kids are school students, and the youngest one is a kindergarden student. 

Erdenetsogt operates taxi business. He started his taxi business in 2009 with his own motorcycle. He is a well-experienced driver. With his profits, he  then bought a car for his taxi business. His business income is enough to support his family. However, now that his car is old, nobody wants to sit in it.

He is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to buy new car. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "My income is decreasing rapidly. I have to act aggressively in order to make this right."

loans.use: to buy new car.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El socio Hugo sigue trabajando en una empresa publica,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio termino de estudiar la carrera de geologia y ahora quiere sacar su colegiatura y de este modo salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ser profesional.El socio solicita el credito para pagar la colegiatura de su carrera profesional de geologica.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hugo continues working in a public company.  He works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  He finished his studies for a career in geology, and he now wants to pay to register for his professional credentials in order to get ahead.  His dream is to be a professional.

He is requesting the loan to pay the fees to register for his professional credentials.

He is happy about the loan and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay to register for his professional credentials.

loans.name: Nhamoyapera Group

texts.en:
Patricia is a 41 year-old lady and is married. She has 4 children, aged 19, 15, 10 and 4 years. Three of them are still going to school. She also takes care of her nephew. 
She buys and sells fruits and vegetables in a small township in Masvingo. She has been in business for 1 year and she has no employees working for her. Patricia has requested a loan of $400 to buy a variety of vegetables from local farmers. With the extra income from this loan, she will be able to improve the standard of living of her family. The challenges she faces in the business are  temperature changes, as some of the products quickly perish. This results in a loss of revenue.  She is planning to have a refrigerated container for storage of her vegetable produce stock.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, tomatoes, onions, butternuts and green vegetables

loans.name: Jover

texts.en:
Jover is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jover owns and operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Jover has been in his business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Jover joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Jover is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. He will use these funds to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer and the business is doing great.Michael was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a staff member.

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, to buy farm inputs and prepare his land for the next season of planting. 
 
He hopes to grow his business and become famous farmer who practices mixed farming in large scale.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and prepare his land  for next season of planting

loans.name: Gino Jose

texts.es:
Gino es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Camana, Ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo en esta ciudad se puede encontrar  varios platillos típicos en especial el Chupe de Camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta pasear en la playa  y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual son los riquísimos “frejoles”.

Día a día Gino trabaja como albañil, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar de sus padres; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque siempre tiene a Dios a su lado.

Gino está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mejoramiento a su vivienda ya que debido a la época de verano hay muchas lluvias, por ello realizara refacciones a su techo y de esta manera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una gran ferretería”.
texts.en:
Gino is a hard-working and enthusiastic man. He lives in the town of Camana, a city that is characterized by beautiful beaches. Agriculture is developing there, especially rice. Fishing is also developing, and and above all, in this city you can find several typical dishes especially the Chupe de Camarrones. When he has free time he enjoys walking on the beach and he also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is delicious frejoles.

Gino works every day as a construction worker. He works about 8 hours a day and with his work he can help with his parents' household expenses; he believes his business is doing well because he is responsible and above all because God is always by his side.

Gino is very grateful to Kiva lenders and thanks to the help they have given, he can make improvements to his home. During the summer, there is heavy rainfall, so he will make repairs to the roof and in this way, improve the quality of life for his family and keep working every day to realize his larger dream of having a large hardware store.

loans.use: for home improvements.

loans.name: S.l.m.b. Pri Niahun Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of a secondary school, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL 9,000,000.00. They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, their school’s bursar will deduct their repayment out of their salaries and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Mohamed is the featured leader of this group of teachers. Born in a place called Largo, in eastern Sierra Leone, the 52 years old is married to a house-wife and has 4 children.  Two of whom are attending primary, one in college and one a  grown-up. Mohamed has been a professional school teacher for 23 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails, cements, iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 56 years old, married and has eight children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aida has been farming rice for nine years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Radka

texts.en:
Radka and her husband Atanas have a family walnut processing business in the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria.  Radka and Atanas have two kids, aged 10 and 14.  Atanas drives all over Bulgaria purchasing walnuts in their shells and brings them back to Sliven.  In the family’s main room, Radka, Atanas, their two sons, and a variety of cousins, aunts and uncles shell the walnuts.  Atanas then takes the nuts to one of several walnut processing companies with whom he works, which then clean and package the nuts and distribute them into grocery markets across Bulgaria.  In a two-week processing period, the family nets 250BGN (160USD).

This loan will play a crucial role in increasing the amount of working capital available to Radka and Atanas.  Currently, they have to wait several weeks to be paid by the large companies after dropping off the shelled nuts.  During this waiting period, they do not have the funds on hand to purchase a new load of walnuts to shell… so they wait instead of work.  With this capital, they’ll be able to dramatically increase the velocity of their business, increasing by 50% – 75% the amount of nuts they can shell in a year.  

Radka is proud of the work ethic their business has instilled in their children, a laudable trait anywhere and one that is worthy of encouragement.  

The Roma, commonly referred to as gypsies, is a severely marginalized social group in the Balkans.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.en: Tamasha is a hard working low-income woman. She initially established her tea-shop with a small amount of money.  Using the income from her small business and borrowing two times, a total of $2,200 from the Normicro Baku branch, Tamasha not only expanded her tea-shop business but also opened a new trading business. Now she needs $1,200 to expand her trading business and enhance her tea-shop facilities.

loans.use: To equip a new tea-shop and to expand  her trading business

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana N. is a 26-year-old mother of two. Her husband is a waiter at a local resort. This steady income can cover the basic necessities of her family, but Diana is committed to also taking responsibility for the financial management of her household. She joined SPBD to find a way that she could start up her own business. She began a small taro plantation with her first loan. She is now seeking additional funds to purchase fertilizers and tools that will improve her crop yield. Diana wants her children’s lives to be different than hers. She knows that she didn’t get a good education, and she desperately wants to be able to fund a good education for her children. She believes that her taro farm is the key to being able to reach this goal.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and tools

loans.name: Norma Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is a young mother, responsible and hardworking. She has an eleven years old son who is starting secondary school. In order to obtain the income that will allow her to pay for her and her son’s expenses, Graciela sells several seasonal goods. The products that she sells most are cheese, desserts and shoes. She hopes that her son can finish his studies and will have better opportunities in his future. This is what Graciela works for everyday.

To fulfill customer orders and to increase the variety of the products she sells, Graciela requests a loan of $750 that she commits to pay back in 6 months. You can help improve the wellbeing of this family by helping Graciela to continue working. She and her son thank you for your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es una joven madre, responsable y muy trabajadora, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad el cual va a entrar a la secundaria, para obtener un ingreso que le permita cubrir los gastos de ella y su hijo Graciela realiza ventas de de diversos artículos varios de acuerdo a la temporada, los productos que más comercializa son quesos, postres y zapatos. Ella desea que su hijo pueda culminar sus estudios y tengas más oportunidades en su futuro, y para esto es que Graciela se esfuerza todos los días.

Para pode surtir los pedidos de sus clientes e incrementar la variedad de los productos que comercializa, Graciela solicita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, ayudando a Graciela a que continúe trabajando, ella y su hijo agradecen tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Juan Servando

texts.es:
I am in urgent need of an extra room in my home, as I have two adolescent sons who need privacy; my house is very small and has only two rooms, a living room and a kitchen. I am requesting $1000 to invest in the construction of a room.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Me urge la construcción de un cuarto más en mi vivienda, debido a que tengo hijos adolescentes y necesitan privacidad, ya que mi casa es muy pequeña y solo tiene 2 cuartos, sala y cocina. Solicito $ 1200 para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun P., 39, married with six children and lives with her husband in Batambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her five children, who are in school, whilst her husband works as a construction foreman and one of her children works at the construction as well. This loan is beneficially used to purchase more construction for her members to operate their business.

loans.use: To purchase more costruction tools for her husband and one of her children to operate a business.

loans.name: Nonoussi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Nonoussi M. is married and mother of five children. She and her family live in the village of Atséti. Her business is farming and she raises primarily corn and hot peppers. The poor condition of her soil keeps her from having plentiful harvests the way she used to in years past. To improve the fertility of her land and enlarge the area she is able to cultivate, she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 300. This will permit her to purchase fertilizer and rent a tractor for plowing. The success of these plans will allow her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 40 ans, madame Nonoussi M. est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Elle réside avec sa famille d’Atséti. L’agriculture est son domaine d’action et elle cultive essentiellement du maïs et du piment. Mais l’appauvrissement des sols ne lui permet plus de réaliser des moissons importantes comme c’est le cas quelques années plus tôt. Pour renforcer la fertilité des sols et agrandir les surfaces cultivables, elle sollicite un crédit de $300. cela lui permettra d’acheter de l’engrais et de louer un tracteur pour la préparation du sol. La réussite de ce projet lui sera bénéfique, tant elle va améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
Buying fertilizer and renting a tractor

Achat d'engrais et location de tracteur

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is in her early fifties and she is the mother of four grown-up children who all work outsiD. the community. Felicia runs a small grocery store; she started her business two years ago. She would like to enlarge her store in order to increase her income and improve her financial conditions.

With her loan, she will buy goods that are running low in the store. Given the loan, she is sure she will be able to keep satisfying her customers and fulfill her dreams before long.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to replenish a small grocery store

loans.name: Nalweruba A(I) Group

texts.en:
Juliet is 36 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells snacks (e.g., chapatis, samosas, etc.) for a living. With the increased business profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children and also buy a plot of land. Edith has a restaurant business. Betty sells raw food in the market and wants to use the loan to expand her business. Jesca and Madina sell second-hand clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand businesses selling snacks and raw foodstuffs

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adzo Daké is a married mother of four children. She is 38 years old and has owned a roadside restaurant for the past seven years. The income she earns from this business helps her take care of her dependents. This loan will enable her to improve the structure and environment of her restaurant in order to better accomodate her customers.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva translator

Mme Adzo Daké est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle est âgée de 38 ans et est propriétaire d’un restaurant sis au bord de la route pour la consommation populaire Depuis 7 ans. Le revenu de son activité participe aux charges de familles. Le présent crédit va lui permettre de construire un cadre plus agréable afin de mieux accueillir Sa clientèle

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of corn and 3 bags of sugar for the production of juice

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina A. G. is a female resident of the municipality of Achuapa in the city of León in Nicaragua. Carolina is a stay at home mother with three school age children. Her husband earns the only family wages as an agricultural laborer. He has worked in this industry for many years and it has provided the family with the ability to maintain their humble home.

Carolina lives far from the city and lack electricity. For this reason she purchased a solar panel to illuminate her home. In order to acquire the solar panel she took a loan from a vendor, and now is in urgent need of canceling this debt. Given her situation Carolina has requested the assistance of CEPRODEL.

Carolina is requesting a loan to repay the debt of the solar panel. This will enable her to better the families life style and help them to further provide for the successful futures of their children.

Carolina A. G. es una dama habitante del municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Se dedica a la labor de ama de casa y atención a sus tres hijos todos en edad escolar. Su ingreso económico depende de su esposo cuyo trabajo es la agricultura a la que se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta manera el le brinda el recurso económico para que ella lo administre en su humilde hogar.

La necesidad de la señora Carolina radical en que debido a que no poseen energía eléctrica por vivir en un sector alejado, ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para iluminarse. Al haber adquirido este panel necesita con urgencia cancelar esta deuda y es por este motivo que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener crédito que le permita salir de esa deuda y de esta manera mejorar la condición de vida de sus hijos que en un futuro serán unos profesionales de éxito.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
María Teresa is originally from Guadalupe, Nuevo León, México. She is married and has four children. Her husband works for a trash collection company and earns very low wages. When Maria Teresa would bring lunch to her husband at work, his co-workers started asking to buy food from her as well. Because her food is very good, she soon had many paying customers. This is how she started her business four years ago.

Maria Teresa wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $675 to pay back in 6 months, which she will use to buy a new stove in order to cook many different foods at the same time, and offer more variety to her customers. You can help Maria Teresa to improve her business and help her to give her family the best quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new stove

loans.name: Hasiba

texts.en: Hasiba was born in 1969.  She is married and  lives with her husband and two children in Ribnica, a small village near the town Zavidovići. Her husband works at the market and has his own stall.  They are also doing farming and earning additional income by doing it. This is Hasibas first loan at MCO in the amount of $825. Hasiba will use the funds to buy chickens. Her wish is to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Brenda Lorena

texts.es:
My name is Brenda Lorena Girón Gómez and I am 32 years old. I’m originally from the capital city, and it has been eight years since I started a business selling of slushies from my doorstep. This enterprise went very well for me and I was able to save money, as well as obtain a loan from the Shalom bank which allowed me to buy new children’s clothing that I sell from my home. I also sell my merchandise by foot on the local streets, as well as used clothing which has also been a successful endeavor for me. Although my earnings have improved, I still want to increase my sales. This requires obtaining additional merchandise, and is the reason why I am seeking new capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Brenda Lorena Girón Gómez tengo 32 años de edad, soy originaria de la ciudad capital, hace ocho años inicie mi negocio el cual consistía en la venta de granizadas, las cuales las vendía en la puerta de mi casa, donde me fue bastante bien y pude ahorrar alfo de dinero y con un préstamo que hice en el banco de confianza Shalom, pude comprar ropa nueva de niño, la cual la vendo en mi casa y tengo un puesto ambulante en la calle, actualmente también me dedico a vender ropa de paca donde me ha ido muy bien , debido a que se han incrementado mis ganancias y quiero aumentar mis ventas pero debo surtir mi producto para eso necesito el capital que he solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for clothing sales.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Señora Rosa María is married and 51 years old. She studied until the third year of high school. She has 7 children, 5 living in Lima and 2 who are students. She lives in the neighborhood of Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. She is a businesswoman that works in the preparation of fast food for university students. She has also started to work raising animals. Her friend motivated her to join Manuela Ramos. The first loan she recieved was for S/.300.00, which she invested to buy a blender and also to travel to Lima because her son passed away. She belongs to the Community Bank of "Las Palmeras." With this loan of S/.800.00 that she will repay over 6 months she will buy food for her animals and also rice, oil, and beans. Her other dream is to have a restaurant in an appropriate location, to buy a television, and to build her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa María está casada, tiene 51 años, estudió hasta 3er año de secundaria y tiene 07 hijos, 05 trabajan en Lima y 02 son estudiantes; vive en el distrito de Víctor Larco Provincia de Trujillo, La Libertad. La empresaria, se dedica a la preparación de comida rápida, para los estudiantes de la universidad y también empezó a dedicarse a la crianza de animales. Su amiga la animó a participar en Manuela Ramos, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00, invertido en la compra de una licuadora, y tuvo que viajar a Lima porque su hijo había fallecido. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS PALMERAS”. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses, comprará alimento para los animales y también arroz, aceite, menestras. La socia sueña con tener un restaurant en un sitio apropiado, comprar un televisor y seguir ahorrando.

loans.use: To buy better ingredients and to by food for animals.

loans.name: Eufemia Magna

texts.es:
Señora Eufemia Magna is 39 years old and one of eight siblings. She only reached 8th graD. in school because she did not have her mother and father and thus lacked financial support growing up. Right now Eufemia is going through a divorce, but is in another relationship. She has three children and lives in the district La Esperanza in the Peruvian state La Libertad.

To help herself financially, she started a small grocery store in Trujillo. After having some family problems, she changed her business and started selling porcelain. She has been doing this five years now, and always travels to nearby towns to sell her wares. On the recommendation of a friend, she started participating in the Communal Bank "Nueva Esperanza" (Fresh Hope) when she found herself in financial problems and didn't have sufficient capital. With her first 300 Sol loan, she invested in aluminum pots, sliverware, cups, blenders, irons, and thermoses.

With her current 700 Sol ($US 250) loan, to be payed in four installments, she plans to invest in porcelain pots, rice cookers, blenders and bowls. Eufemia dreams of having more capital to invest in an appliance store.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eufemia Magna, está separada, se encuentra gestionando el divorcio y ahora tiene otro compromiso, tiene 39 años, estudió hasta 2do año D. secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque era huérfana D. padre y madre, eran 08 hermanos y no se abastecían para el sustento económico, tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Distrito D. La Esperanza en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender abarrotes en la ciudad D. Trujillo, después tuvo problemas familiares, ahora se dedica a la venta D. porcelana, tiene 05 años en este negocio y como siempre viaja para ofrecer la mercadería conoce distintos sitios como Bagua, Pedro Ruíz. Tiene 01 año trabajando con Manuela Ramos, una amiga la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “NUEVA ESPERANZA II” como tenía problemas económicos, no tenía capital y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró ollas D. aluminio, cucharas, tazas, licuadoras, extractores, planchas, termos, etc. Con este préstamo D. S/. 700.00 que cancelara en 4 cuotas, tiene pensado invertir este dinero en la compra D. ollas D. porcelana, ollas arroceras, licuadoras, tazones, etc. La empresaria sueña con tener más capital para invertir en un negocio D. artefactos.

loans.use: Buy items to sell such as porcelain pots, rice cookers and blenders.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi M. is 47 years old. She joined TYM Fund in 2002 and borrowed  VND 1 million to invest in farming. At present, her family has a big lemon garden with an income of VND 15 million/year. Besides, every month her husband works as a builder helper in his spare time. With these sources of income, she repays her loans very well. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 4 million to buy more young lemon trees and fertilizer for this business.

loans.use: to buy more young lemon trees and fertilizer

loans.name: Rehema D.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Rehema D. M. from Tukuyu, married with three children between the ages of 8 and 18. Rehema, who has been running a hair salon since 2007, works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week, earning about $100 monthly.

She is requesting a loan of $325 in order to buy salon items such as hair costmetics, nail polish, artificial hair, etc. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty boutique. Rehema thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy salon items such as hair costmetics, nail polish, artificial hair, etc.

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. B. G. habita junto a su familia en la comunidad de Mazapia, Tecolostote, dedicado a la siembra de arroz y socio de la cooperativa agropecuaria La Esperanza, por esfuerzo propio tiene establecido 8 Mzs de arroz, un problema es la falta de un trillo en la comunidad, por lo que tiene que vender a bajo precio su produccion, lo que le reduce sus ingresos que son el sosten de su familia a traves  de su cooperativa tiene la oportunidad de participar como socio en la construccion de un trillo en su comunidad, para lo cual solicita el presente financiamiento  y asi alcanzar su mayor deseo que es ser parte de esa sociedad que le permita mejoar sus condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. B. G. lives with his family in the Mazapia community in Tecolostote. He works in rice cultivation and is a member of the La Esperanza agricultural co-op. He has established 8 Mzs (manzanas—about 5.6 hectares) of rice from his own efforts. One problem that he faces is the lack of a rice huller in his community, which causes him to sell his crop at a lower price, thus reducing his income—the family’s means of support. Through his co-op, he has the opportunity to participate as a member in the construction of a rice huller in his community. For this reason, he is requesting this loan so that he can reach his greatest wish, which is to be a part of this association that allows him to improve his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contribute 30% towards construction of rice huller for La Peña rice

loans.name: Karimberdi

texts.en: I. Karimberdi is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. Karimberdi has an engineering education, but he switched to agriculture to increase his salary.  He has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Karimberdi works hard to cultivate his products such as potatoes, carrots, onions and other vegetables. He works from early morning until late night hoping to have a rich harvest. Karimberdi sells his crops in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality.
