His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Today Karimberdi is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300 USD) for the term of 7 months to buy bags to keep his products fresh to sell later, when the price for them will increase. Let's help Karimberdi as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Purchasing bags to keep his products fresh

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van N., 50, is a widow with six children. Two of them are married and live outside the family home; two daughters have full-time employment at an NGO. One son is a painter and the other one is a mason. Besides her children, she also has an elderly mother living with her. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Van has been selling fish for 20 years, a skill she leaned from her parents. She buys them from her villagers for re-sale at the local market. Van earns about US$ 5 per day.

Van has her own farmland and she wants to grow bananas so she is asking for a loan of US$ 700 in order to purchase a water pump and to buy small banana trees for planting.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump  and  small banana trees

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rafael L. se destacar por ser un trabajador que posee su propio negocio de ferretería ofreciendo todo tipo de productos ferreteros los cuales son comercializados con mucho esfuerzo en su localidad y a pesar que se encuentra a la intemperie solo con una pequeña mesa de madera, ha logrado realizar ventas que le han permitido el sustento familiar.

La razón por la que el señor A. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros y es por esto que muy confiadamente espera que su crédito sea otorgado para así continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Rafael L. is well known for being a good worker. He owns a hardware store where he offers all kinds of ironmongery products, which are sold outdoors over a small table. However, in spite of the basic conditions of his shop, he manages to make enough sales to support his family. The reason why Rafael is looking for support from Ceprodel is to request for a loan to purchase hardware products. He is very confident with the idea he will obtain this loan to keep his business running, business that requires a lot of work and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware products

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia lleva cuatro meses con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pero ya lleva tres años con su negocio. Ella compra y vende bajo pedidos: quesos, maca y miel. Los quesos los trae desde Huancayo. Se animó a empezar este negocio una vez que estuvo en Huancayo, donde a menudo viaja para visitar a su familia, y gracias a un familiar se enteró que podía comprar quesos allí para venderlos a un precio un poco más alto en Puente Piedra.
Con las ganancias de la venta de sus productos vuelve a invertir en el negocio, los demás gastos del hogar los cubre su esposo que es chofer.
A sus treinta y ocho años planea en un futuro tener una tienda propia desde donde vender quesos y otros productos lácteos, su esposo está tratando de construir el local en el pequeño lote donde viven.
texts.en:
Sonia has been borrowing from EDAPROSPO for four months but has had her business for three years. She buys and sells goods on request: cheese, maca [an Andean root vegetable] and honey. She brings the cheese from Huancayo. She decided to start her business on a trip to Huancayo where she often travels to visit her family: thanks to a family member she realized that she could buy cheese there and sell it for a slightly higher price in Puente Piedra. With the profits from the sale of these products she has begun to invest in the business; her husband who is a driver pays for the household expenses. Thirty-eight years old, she is planning to own a proper store in the future, where she can sell cheese and other milk products. Her husband is trying to build her a store on the small lot on which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan was used to buy maca [an Andean root vegetable] for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosemary Janet Awuor

texts.en:
Rosemary Janet Awuor is a 32-year-old mother of three children aged 16, 7 and 3. The older two are in school and she is raising them by herself. She runs a small fish shop where she sells Omena fish. She purchases her stock from fisherman at Lake Victoria. She says that transporting her goods can be a challenge.

Rosemary recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: More Fish Stock/Transport Fees

loans.name: Kuña Activa De Cabañas Group

texts.es:
El presente Comité  denominado Kuña activa de la compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupé, la misma integran 15 mujeres, todas ellas mayores de edad, y residentes en el mismo barrio.

En la actualidad el comité opera en su 10mo. ciclo recibiendo un promedio de guaranies 540.000 por cada integrante. Las mismas beneficiadas destinan sus prestamos en actividades comerciales detalladas mas abajo, que como se observa en la gran mayoria consiste en vender productos variados en forma ambulante que requiere de mayor esfuerzo para demandar los productos.

Es bueno mensionar que,  a la par que éstas mujeres reciben una asistencia financiera, asi tambien se benefician de servicios no financieros que comprenden la capacitación por cada ciclo, en las que las mismas aprenden como mantener la integridad del comité en donde pertenecen, aprenden a ahorrar, y a realizar presupuestos personales y familiares. Todo esto engloba los beneficios que reciben del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras que promueve la fundación Paraguaya de Cooperación  y Desarrollo.

La  integración toda del detallado Comité , agradece a la fundaciòn Parguaya por brindarles este tipo de oportunidades que promueve la creación de pequeños negocios y por ende generar recursos económicos a sectores desfavorecidos por este tipo de beneficios.

1.	Francisca C.        Vivero                             
2.	Elvira V.                   Vivero                            
3.	Inocencia A.          Despensa                      
4.	Marta B.                Venta de ropa             
5.	Felipa Q.            Peluqueria                     
6.	Maria C.                Despensa                       
7.	Elva D.                  Kiosko                            
8.	Juliana V.                   Venta de carbón             
9.	Lidia M.                   Vivero                             
10.	Clementina V.            Venta de ropa                  
11.	Hilaria G.             Venta de chipa                 
12.	Pablina V.         Vivero                              
13.	Maria M.               Despensa                        
14.	Liduvina C.            Despensa                         
15.	Carmen B.             Venta de cosmeticos
texts.en:
The present committee is named Kuña Activa in the Cabañas group from the city of Caacupé. Its membership includes 15 women, all of them adults and residents of the same neighborhood.

Right now the committee works in 10-month cycles, receiving an average of 540,000 for each member. These recipients use their loans for the economic activities detailed below, of which you will see the majority are street vendors that sell various products.

It should be mentioned that as well as the financial assistance that these women receive, they also benefit from non-financial services such as training each cycle, in which they learn to maintain the integrity of the committee, to save and to carry out their personal and family budgets. This encapsulates all the benefits that they receive from the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women’s Committee) that promotes the foundation Paraguaya de Cooperación y Desarollo (Cooperation and Development of Paraguay).

The members of the Committee thank the foundation Paraguaya for bringing them these types of opportunities that promote the creation of small businesses and generate economic resources for sectors that are not favored for this type of benefits.

1. Francisca C. Nursery 2. Elvira V. Nursery 3. Inocencia A. Small store 4. Marta B. Clothing Sales 5. Felipa Q. Hair Salon 6. Maria C. Small store 7. Elva D. Kiosk 8. Juliana V. Coal sales 9. Lidia M. Nursey 10. Clementina V. Clothing sales 11. Hilaria G. Chipa (bread) sales 12. Pablina V. Nursery 13. Maria M. Small store 14. Liduvina C. Small store 15. Carmen B. Sale of cosmetics

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise: fruits, vegetables, meats, cosmetics, hardware, bread-making materials, coal, fertilized seeds, plants and others

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 54 años D. edad, es conviviente, y tiene 05 hijos, ella no recuerda hasta que grado estudio. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en la plaza D. Cabanilla, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar más golosinas al por mayor para seguir con su negocio. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir mas golosinas e insumos para iniciar un negocio D. preparación y venta D. gelatinas; su deseo es poner una tienda bien surtida en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the community bank "Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“ of the district of Cabanilla in the province of Lampa, department of Puno. She is 54 years old and has a partner. She has five children. She does not remember what graD. she studied until. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. She currently sells candies in the main square of Cabanilla. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy more candy wholesale in order to continue in business. She would now like to borrow 300 soles which she is committed to repay in six instalments. With this loan she will buy more candies and ingredients to open a new business preparing and selling gelatin. Her wish is to have a well-stocked store in her city.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies wholesale

loans.name: Shazia Rafiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of R. M. who has a clothes-selling business. They live in Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband buys clothes from different cities (Multan, Peshawar), cities that are famous for their variety of clothes, and sells them in the city of Lahore. Shazia baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes for her husband’s clothes-selling business. Shazia baji is the group leader of two other women from her locality: Sugran baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell; Nargis baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng P. is a villager in Roeusey Srouk village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows vegetables. In his growing, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to buy vegetable seed and other supplies to grow them on the field. In order to deal this problem, he decided to request a loan.

His wife, Mrs. Kong Koeun, is a housewife who does housework. Mr. Heng P. is 49 years old and the father of seven children, one of whom is a banana seller while another is a jasmine seller. Two of them are laborers and help their father’s work and the remainder are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed and other supplies for his field

loans.name: Akpomudje

texts.en: H. sells soft drinks and foodstuff. She has been in this business for the past two years. She needs a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuff so as to meet the demand of customers. H. is 52 years old and married, with two children. She promise to pay back and says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Neyling

texts.es:
Neyling Gutierrez es una dama muy esforzada cuya labor ha sido la venta de productos lácteos como lo son quesos de todo tipo, quesillo, cuajada y crema.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora que ha llevado el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de adquirir un crédito para la compra de los productos lácteos para ofrecerlos y seguir vendiendo el mejor queso que a muchas personas les ha gustado.
texts.en:
Neyling Gutierrez is a very hard working lady whose business is the sale of dairy products such as cheeses of all kinds, curd and cream. She has been an excellent worker who has provided for her humble family. She is asking for a loan to Ceprodel that will be used in the purchase of dairy products to offer and continue selling the best cheese that many people like.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es una mujer de 36 años, su afán de progreso la llevaron a potenciar sus capacidades comerciales en beneficio de su familia, pues sus hijos son su mayor motivador. Elegir la venta de productos naturales ha sido una de las mejores decisiones que tomó, ya que  estos productos son muy solicitados debido a sus propiedades curativas, por lo que es un negocio muy rentable. Para obtener mayores pedidos, Julia sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa a sus clientes, siendo largas horas de caminata pues recorre varios lugares de su ciudad, regresando a altas horas de la noche a su casa. Por ello, para evitar estas caminatas, Julio desea invertir en la instalación de una tienda naturista en su casa, ya que la empresa con la que trabaja le puede brindar facilidades de pago para obtener grandes cantidades de productos y espera aprovechar esta oportunidad. Este es su octavo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, en su banco comunal, lo que más le agrada es el esfuerzo que cada miembro realiza para el progreso de su grupo. Con los 2000 soles que ahora solicita incrementará su capital de trabajo para obtener mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 36 year-old woman. Her family’s welfare drives her to maximize her business capacity. Her children are her primary motivation. Her choice to sell natural products has been one of the best decisions that she has made. These products are very much in demand because of their curative properties. It is a profitable business. To obtain the most requests for her products, Julia sells them door to door to her customers. She works long hours selling her products in various neighborhoods in the city. She returns to her house late at night. In order to stop working such late hours, Julia would like to install a permanent natural products store at her house. In this way she can buy a larger quantity of products from the company that she represents. This is her eighth loan with PRISMA Microfinance, a cooperative bank. She is most thankful for the effort that each member makes towards the progress of the group. With the 200 soles that she seeks she will increase her working capital so that she can buy a greater quantity of products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Buligo United Anyago Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is thirty-four years old, married with one child, and looking after two dependents, going to school. She operates a business selling used clothes from market to market. She has been in her business for ten years. She is using the loan to improve her business, that is, buying more clothes for sale. She wishes to prosper at least if, God willing, she wants to obtain a house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Mary Geraldine

texts.en:
Mary Geraldine E. is a 41-year old pig grwer in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She has six children, 19 years old the eldest. She is very uch worried about their family growing finances, espeially that her children are studying so she needs to provide more on their needs especially school like tuition fee, books and other daily costs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 13,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. Part of the loan as well will hopefully put to starting a new businesss that will hel augment their oncome. Her planis actually having a sari-sari store and the loan that she applies will truly help for the realization of her plan.

She likes CEVI because they are giving loans of smallest interest rate, only 2% a month.

loans.use: To help start a business and buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 6 años implementó una pequeña bodega en su vivienda y durante todo este tiempo viene atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes, debido a ello se ha hecho muy conocida y la preferida de su pueblo y esto le causa mucha alegría. Pero últimamente tiene dificultades económicas porque la mayoría de sus clientes le compran al crédito, pagándole a fin de mes y mientras tanto sus estantes se ven vacíos. Por ello, su esposo con anhelos de apoyarla trabaja como jornalero agrícola desde la madrugada, pese a eso no le alcanza el sueldo. Entonces Olinda, en aras de incrementar su tienda y tenerla atractiva, los fines de semana prepara comida para vender en la puerta de su casa y así captar más dinero.
Es así que acude a este tercer préstamo con MFP, sus anteriores créditos los pagó responsablemente, además se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal y con sus funciones de secretaria en éste. Con el dinero solicitado comprará productos comestibles para su negocio y de ese modo seguir trabajando alegremente.
texts.en:
Olinda is 31 years old and lives with her partner and their 5 children in their own house. Six years ago, she started a small grocery store out of her home. During this time, her business became well-known and favorite establishment in her town because of the friendly attention she gives to her customers. Lately, her customers have been buying on credit and paying at the end of the month because of financial difficulties. Meanwhile her shelves remain empty. Her partner works in the early morning hours on a farm, but his salary is not enough to cover their expenses. In order to restock her store and keep it attractive, Olinda prepares food on the weekends and sells it from her house in order to generate more income.

This will be her third loan from MFP. Olinda repaid her previous loans responsibly and she is very comfortable with her Communal Bank and her role as the group secretary. The money she requested will be used to buy more food products for her business to keep it running smoothly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K. is  33 years old, married to Lucy Wanderi and they have one school going child.

Paul operates a motorcycle taxi business in Naivasha town. He has been doing this business for three years now and it has been sustainig both himself and his family.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan with KADET. He is planning to use the funds to repair his motorbike.

In future, Paul plans to diversify in the transport business and own his own fleet of motor vehicle taxis.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: G.s Sangre De Cristo Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Sangre de Cristo está conformado por Hermenejilda P. M., Rosa Alpina M. Z.. Sus actividades económicas son diferentes, pero esto no les impide desarrollar una amistad y lograr sacar adelante a sus familias y negocios. Hermenejilda se dedica a la venta de frijoles, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, en cambio Rosa se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Ambas trabajaron desde muy joven para sacar a cada una de sus familias. Por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. El sueño de estas 2 integrantes es salir adelante con sus negocios.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida G. is now 57 years old and happily married to Ernesto G.. They were blessed with three children namely: Herardo 34 years old, Valentina 33 years old and Ernesto 17 years old. All of her children have their own work, which is one of the things she will be saying thanks to the Lord for, for giving all their children the chance of experiencing what life really is. But she and her husband still continue to strive so that they will not be a burden to their children, instead they will help each other in order for them to experience a better life.

Leonida runs a variety store business that is one of the sources of their income but aside from that, she also sells different homemade sandwich spreads like peanut butter and coco jam (made from coconut). Now she focuses on this business, and that is where she will use the loan that she will receive from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), buying things that are needed for this business. She will also use the loan in her trading business. This is the selling of different kinds of fish, some of the people in their place call this trading. She is hoping that after buying what is needed for her business, it will give them income for all of their expenses.

Leonida’s dream is to have a comfortable and strong house for their family. And she is also really hoping that her businesses will continue to run and grow so that her dreams will become possible.

loans.use: To finance her businesses

loans.name: Emith

texts.es:
La señora Emith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 56 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella y sus hijos, emprendió un pequeño  negocio D. venta D. abarrotes establecida en su misma casa obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donD. sus principales clientes son los moradores, vecinos D. su barrio y amigos. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como: arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Emith, hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emith is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Luchadoras: (struggling women), district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin, state of San Martin. She is married, 56 years old, and mother of two children who are already independent. Faced with the need to contribute to her home's income and motivated by her children and herself, she began a small business selling groceries from her home with very good results from the beginning because of the quality of her produtcs, her reasonable prices, and good customer service. She continues with her business where the main clients are residents, neighbors and friends. With the $475 loan, she will buy additional products for her business such as: rice and sugar by the kilo, eggs by the box, personal hygene and home cleaning products, sodas by pack, candy and other products to maintain her clients happy. Emith feels very happy today for the services she offers and is thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping people like her who want to work and get ahead in life. She hopes the help continues for a long time assisting many families and enterpreneurial women.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase greater quantity groceries and offer more prodcuts

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en: Anafe R. is from the village of Mailag, Valencia City. She is 28 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Anafe owns and operates a clothing business selling ready-to-wear items. She also runs a side business selling snacks, fish and vegetables. She has been engaged in her businesses for over ten years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Anafe is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in another business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to purchase additional inventory, to use as working capital, and to pay off her weekly obligations to HSPFI. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in another business

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther es una socia jovial, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante; vive en distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 19 años, es madre de un pequeño y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de telèfonos.
Maria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor y paralelamente vende caldo de gallina junto a su madre desde hace un año en la vereda de su casa.
Ella es una de las socias que integra el Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace un año donde se ha caracterizado por ser puntual. Nos comenta que està contenta de participar en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le ha dado la oportunidad de comenzar con su propio negocio y ayudar a su esposo en la economía D. hogar. 
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de gaseosas. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos comestibles (aceite, fideos, arroz, azúcar, leche, etc). 
La meta de Maria es llegar a tener un restaurante de comidas típicas de la región Ucayali.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is a joyful, hardworking member with much desire to succeed. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 19 years old, is mother of a small child and counts on the support of her husband who is dedicated to selling telephones. Maria is dedicated to the retail sale of groceries and also sells chicken broth along with her mother, which she has been doing for the past year from the sidewalk in front of her home. She is one of the members who has been in the Las Rosas Community Bank for one year where is known for being punctual. She is pleased to participate in the Manuela Ramos Movement because it has given her the opportunity to begin her own business and help her spouse support the home. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN which she used for the purchase of sodas. Currently she needs a loan of 600 PEN with which she will buy food products such as oil, noodles, rice, sugar, milk and other products. Maria's goal is to have her own restaurant with food typical of the Ucayali region.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of food products

loans.name: Folole

texts.en:
Folole T. is 39 and married with 6 children (ages 4 - 14).  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Folole has 6 years of experience in this business.  Folole needs a loan of WST $2350 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 700 tala or US $292 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Folole joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Folole's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Folole T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isabilito

texts.en:
Isabelito is a 44-year-old married man with four children. He is from Agusan Del Sur and like most of the people there, he is involved in rice farming. It is the only source of income for his family, so he works hard to ensure an abundant harvest. 

Lacking financially, he joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to be able to support his business. He applied for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos. With this loan, Isabelito will be able to finance his farm. He can now buy quality seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs needed at his farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Reaksmey

texts.en:
Mrs. Reaksmey U. is 43 years old and lives in Angk Roveay village, Takeo province. She is a silk middleman and is also a silk weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to bU. more silks to sell and to support her silk weaving.

With this loan, she hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Leng Tin, works as a truck driver and is on the left of the picture. Mrs. Reaksmey U. is the mother of two children who are both silk weavers at home.

loans.use: To buy more silks

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos vive en el, municipio de La Guardia, barrio Monte Alto, esta casado y tiene 2 hijitos pequeños su actividad es la de venta de productos de primera necesidad ambulante en los mercados, no cuenta con domicilio propio por lo tanto vive en la casa de su suegra, es una pareja joven con mucha ganas de superación, por lo que recurrió a la institución para acceder a su primer crédito financiero, lo recomendo otro cliente de la institucion teniendo buenas referencias por su responsabilidad y ganas de trabajar se le otorgo el credito, uno de sus deseos es de tener su propio puesto de venta y tambien comprarse su casita, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the municipality of La Guardia, in the Monte Alto neighborhood. He is married and has 2 small children. He is a street vendor who sells products that are basic necessities in the markets. He does not have his own home, so he lives in his mother-in-law's house. He is a young husband who has a strong desire to succeed. For this reason he turned to the institution to access his first loan. Another client of the institution recommended him, and having good references for his responsibility and desire to work hard, he was given the loan. One of his wishes is to have his own stall where he can sell, and also to buy his own little house. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Simeon's Group

texts.en: Simeon T. is from the village of Carikkikan Norte. He is 44 years old and is the group leader of a twenty-one-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Simeon T.. Simeon is married and has three school-aged children. He owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 78,000 PHP every cropping season. In 2010, Simeon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his first from ASKI. Simeon plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 45 years old and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living Gemma raises pigs to sell. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Gemma joined HSPFI to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business. About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her pig business.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato A. is from the village of Capt. Vicente Roa St., Cagayan De Oro City. He is 44 years-old.  He is separated from his spouse and has four adult children. Renato owns and operates a specialized retail business seling  motor and car accessories including car aircondition parts and supplies in the local community. Renato has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Renato joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renato has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Renato is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Renato from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Capt. Vicente Roa St., Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Grace Wanja

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old widowed woman living in Kibaoni with her three children: two girls and one boy.

Grace does cash crop farming and this has been her main source of income for the last eight years. She sells her produce to distributors in the main markets of Malindi.

Grace was introduced to KADET by an opinion leader and she has applied for a loan of which she will spend Ksh 2,000 to buy water melon seeds, Ksh 10,000 on pesticides, Ksh 6,000 on fertilizers, Ksh 2,000 to buy vegetables and Ksh 6,000 on land preparation. The balance will be kept aside for weeding purposes.

Grace anticipates a profit from the sale of the farm produce and she plans to save for her children’s education. Grace is very ambitious and she hopes to build rental houses on her plot.

loans.use: To buy melon seeds, fertilizer, pesticide, vegetables and to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Mrs. Tob K. is a villager in Angk Ta Phouk village in Takeo province. She was born in 1970. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Besides the farm business, she is a chicken breeder too. Her obstacle is that she does not have something to transport while she does farming. So to improve the conditions for her family, Mrs. Tob K. is seeding a loan to buy a motorbike to use. She is single and lives with seven members in her household. Two of her assistants are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the others have different positions.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
Nuth C., 36, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She buys rice for resale for an income of about 1.50 USD per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of 4.30 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.

C. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase more rice for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale

loans.name: Sope Nabi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE NABI est créé depuis 6 mois, il est composé de 13 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles se ont constitué le groupe par affinité, elles sont âgées en moyenne de 45 ans et sont au moins mères de 3 enfants. L’activité principale du groupe est le petit commerce de produits divers tels la vente de produits halieutiques, d’effets vestimentaires, de produits cosmétiques et alimentaires et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. Le nouveau crédit permettra au groupe de solidarité de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier.

Madame Hawa D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en tenue noire avec des rubans dorés à la ceinture et à la bordure des manches de la robe, son livret d'épargne et de crédit à la main, est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants (15, 11 et 07 ans). Elle joue un rôle fondamental dans le groupe par rapport au renforcement de la solidarité entre les membres. Elle est détentrice d’une boutique devant une école où elle vend des rafraîchissements et des beignets. Son financement lui permet de renforcer son activité et de fidéliser sa clientèle constituée essentiellement d’élèves. Son objectif est de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants. Elle cherche également à faire de sa petit boutique une grande buvette.
texts.en:
The SOPE NABI group was created 6 months ago. It consists of 13 women, all from the same village. They were brought together by their mutual affinity. On average, they are 45-years old and have at least 3 children each. The group’s primary activity is the retail sale of various items such as fish products, apparel, cosmetics and food, and ice cream for those with a refrigerator. The new funding will allow the solidarity group to strengthen and diversify their economic activities. Mrs. Hawa D. is the president of the group. She is at the far right of the picture in a black dress with gold trim at the waist and the sleeves, holding her bank book. Mrs. D. is 43 years of age, married and the mother of 3 children (ages 15, 11 and 7). She plays a critical role in the group, strengthening the solidarity between its members. She has a shop in front of a school where she sells beverages and beignets. Her loan allows her to bolster her small business and to build a loyal client base consisting mostly of school children. Her goal is to increase her profits and contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions with food as well as healthcare and schooling for the children. She would also like to turn her little shop into a large refreshment bar.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the economic initiatives of the solidarity group

loans.name: Kafayatou

texts.fr: A. Kafayatou est née en 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Kafayatou n'est pas encore mariée et n'a pas encore d'enfant. Kafayatou vit donc seule depuis une douzaine d'année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, et assure seule ses différentes charges. Kafayatou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Kafayatou  vend des vêtements pour femmes à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est à Lomé au Togo, que Kafayatou achète ses produits. Kafayatou exerce cette activité depuis près de cinq ans et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts qui ont été tous bien remboursés à ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, Kafayatou sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
A. Kafayatou was born in 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is not yet married and still has no children. So she has been living by herself in the Hlacomey district of Cotonou and covers her various expenses on her own. Kafayatou did not attend school. To support herself, she sells women's clothing at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She purchases her goods in Lomé, Togo. She has been in this business for nearly five years and has already had four loans, which have all been repaid at ALIDé. With the goal of bolstering her business and growing her customer base, Kafayatou is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ladies' clothing

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Determined A. Edwin is a happily married father of 3 children, two of whom are in school. Like any other responsible man, he examined how best he could satisfy his family requirements, having previously been engaged in poultry farming. He went into agriculture and built up a banana plantation and started up a farm rearing cows, goats and sheep in his home area of Katabwigute, Ntungamo.

Having a variety of livestock on his farm makes his business more attractive and beneficial. He has been able to capture a good market for his meat from butchery owners and for his bananas from hotel owners who use them to prepare a local dish for customers. This has seen him earn 210,000 UGX on a monthly basis. His main setback is having a small stock. With this loan, he hopes to restock more animals and also modernize the farming system on the plantation. This will improve both his market supply and his sales revenue.

loans.use: to buy more cows, sheep and goats for restocking and to modernize the plantantion with fertilizers

loans.name: Zungumzo

texts.en:
Zungumzo S. M. is forty years old, married and has four children aged between twelve years and two and a half years old. His business is located along the Likoni-Lunga lunga road which is a busy highway and near the Likoni bus stop in Mombasa. It is well known by the name Z Auto parts. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites not forgetting the Indian ocean's white beaches. 

Zungumzo sells auto spare parts and also owns a garage in which he serves taxis, Matatu owners and walk ins who have private vehicles. He has been in this business for five years now and he says that this business is profitable. The major challenge that he has is that he lacks machines in his business to enable him to work efficiently and effectively. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more auto spare parts to sell to his clients and expand his business. He hopes that someday he will diversify into carpentry where he will open a training school and train other young people and make them self-reliant. He says he is very passionate about what he does.

loans.use: Auto spare parts

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Batbaatar N. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own house which was built in 2005. Both of Batbaatar's children attend a district secondary school while his wife helps him out with his business, a retail dairy operation which he runs out of a local market. In the summer, when dairy products are abundant, he buys all of his supplies from Arhangai province, which is known nationally for top-notch products, and resells them from his shop. For the rest of the year, Batbaatar buys dairy products in bulk from Huchit Shonhor, the largest dairy market in Ulaanbaatar. Batbaatar attributes his success to his knowledge of market demands. He is a modest and creative person, and is applying for a loan for 2,500,000 MNT to buy more dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months when prices for such products rise. He will also use a portion of this loan to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To buy more dairy products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Mame Marie Fall

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Marie Fall B. est une femme de 46 ans qui habite a la cite Ousmane Fall dans la localité de Dalifort. C’est une enseignante de profession. Mais parallèlement  elle a opté de s’adonner a u commerce d’habits qu’elle  revend a ses collègues.
Madame B. est membre de la caisse de Dalifort  depuis 3 mois. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs .L’objet du prêt est l’achat de tissus et habits pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle  en cette veille de fêtes  de Korite. Ce financement pourra contribuer  a l’augmentation de ses revenus et a l’amélioration du niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Marie Fall B. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Ousmane Fall, in Dalifort. A teacher by profession, she has a sideline reselling articles of clothing to her colleagues. Mrs. B. has been a member of the Dalifort credit union for three months. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase clothes and fabrics so as to meet customer demand on the eve of the Korite celebrations. This loan will help to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Vui

texts.en: Vui T. N. is 52 years old and has one child who is at high school. She has been running a shop that sells construction material such as soil, stone and cement for five years. Her shop can generate 3,000,000 VND per month. Since joining our credit program in 2006, she has used loans very effectively. August is the construction month. She needs a loan of 7,194,000 VND to invest in her shop to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to invest in her shop to meet customer demand

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha was born in 1968 and is married with one child. She also takes care of two dependent relatives.

Liberatha is a businesswoman and her husband is a driver. This family works hard so that they keep on growing in their daily activities.

Liberatha owns a store which sells various products. She has good experience in this field because this is her tenth year of successful operation. The hours of her daily activities are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day.

Liberatha is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business, which is the best way of attracting the new customers. With these new customers, she will be able to earn more profits to use in her business and for her family as well.

loans.use: To expand her business
